review: Here we are on the first day that CPK opened in Kapolei. The wait was reasonable - 40 minutes at 5pm.  Once inside we were greeted by everyone that walked by. Nearly all the servers, trainers and managers stopped by our table to see how we were doing.  No sooner had we finished eating than they were there taking our plates, bringing more bread or filling our drinks. The wait staff has been well trained and the food was top notch! I hope that they continue the excellent service.  We did notice that many tables were empty although many people were waiting outside, perhaps the kitchen couldn't handle a full service. With time I'm sure they will run at full capacity.  It's nice to have more and more options for dining here on the Westside. We have waited a long time for this.

So Delish! We went on the opening day. Met the manager and staff. They were nervous but on point. We enjoyed the flight of sangria, the new fried cauliflower with Siracha Buffalo sauce - so hot and good with the blue cheese dressing and celery salad. The halibut was amazing... Even more was the squash beneath the halibut. I'd order a dish of that and eat it alone. The rib eye was topped with blue cheese butter and gave it a creamy rich taste. The lemon juice salad was nice. To finish - the infamous pumpkin cheesecake. Love the new decor. Lots of refurbished pallets and up cycled materials.

How exciting to have CPK in Kapolei! We had to try it out on the first day. The restaurant itself is beautiful! A modern/contemporary ambiance. Still very noise though. The black & white pics of old Hawai'i are perfect. The bar is a separate area with seating all around. We sat right next to the pizza oven area. It was very entertaining watching them work. We will be visiting the CPK a lot since it's close to home. Congratulations Alfred & staff! Wishing you many years of happy customers!

Great start, very good service and super busy. So they were trained very well. Too bad the good food doesn't have good wine. So, if you are having the wild mushroom strozzapreti (or rib eye)bring your own wine. Not a good selection here. But food is very good.
Dined here on the 2nd day.  Service was very friendly and the food came out pretty quickly.  The food was great, as always.  We'll be coming back quite often!

CPK (Kapolei - Ka Makana Ali'i). (2.67 stars). Let me start by saying I'm not a huge "chain" restaurant fan nor am I a huge fan of most Pizzas. OK having gotten that out of my system... We got to CPK which is on the opposite end of the mall. I was already hangry but felt very depressed when I saw (literally) 50 people standing at the entrance!! I walked in to see the hostess and asked how long the wait was for 2... She said it is about an hour!! I looked at my friend and said forget it!! Then the hostess said if we sat at the bar it was first come first serve! I said great! So we grabbed the last 2 seats and proceeded to order. Then our bartender said, "Just to let you know the wait time for food has been approximately 35-45 minutes!"... I looked at my friend and said well so much for eating here!! We had a salon appointment in about an hour!! So my friend asked if we could just get our "Free Small Plate" and the bartender said, "Sure, but u have to buy $15 minimum purchase!"... Sigh. So we left. We decided to come back to CPK that same night to try it!! This time it wasn't crowded at all!! But we decided we still wanted to sit at the bar since the wait time was still 10 minutes for a booth. Here's what I ordered: -Jamabalaya Fettuccini -Shaved Mushroom + Spinach Flatbread -Sangria Flight Jambalaya Fettuccini - $18.99. (2 stars). First off I have to say my Fettuccini was cooked al dente so I was happy with that! This dish comes with Blackened Chicken (which I asked to be removed... if it's not fried or grilled I do not heart chicken!!)...  Shrimp, Andouille Sausage, Crawfish, Tasso Ham, and a Cajun sauce. I was ecstatic that I didn't have to peel my own mudbugs (aka Crawfish)!! There were about 8 shrimps in my dish which I thought was a lot. The Andouille Sausage was a bit of a downer just because I have had Andouille Sausage straight from Louisiana and it's amazing!! This Sausage just tasted like something bought from Safeway. Not awful but no real seasoning or SPICINESS!!??? Yes, I know, stupid me comparing genuine authentic items to a chain restaurant's version!! GRUNT!! The Cajun sauce did have a kick. But it mostly just tasted like Tabasco and a hint of cayenne pepper?? I wouldn't order this dish again. Shaved Mushroom + Spinach Flatbread - $7.99. (3 stars). I'm not a flatbread person but since my friend chose this as our Free Small Plate... I decided to try a small piece. For $7.99 this is a wicked awesome deal!! This could be a meal in and of itself!! I have gathered from eating with my "Thin crust Pizza snob buddies" that flatbreads should be closer to CRISPY?? Well CPK's wasn't terribly CRISPY but a cross between thin crust and hand tossed.  I will say that CPK piled this flatbread with tons of mushrooms which I did like!! I hope they can keep up with their consistency because if I come back with the BF I'm sure he will notice if he gets shorted ingredients!! LOL! Definitely worth ordering this plate especially to share!! Sangria Flight - $9.99. (3 stars). I love ordering drink samplers!! It gives me an idea of what to order next! In this case I was surprised to see a Sangria sampler!! The price point was worth it to me.  The Sangria Flight comes with Beehive, Berry, and Orchard. I started with the Beehive (White Wine, Cointreau, Monin Lavender, Strawberry purée, honey, and lemon.) This drink was wicked light and refreshing. For better or worse I couldn't taste the alcohol in any of these drinks!! Berry (Red Wine, Remy VSOP, Monin Blackberry, Raspberry purée, cranberry juice, and lemonade. Typical Sangria I'm used to. Tasted like drinking juice.  Orchard (White Wine, St. Germain Edelflower, Monin Stone Fruit, Orange & Cranberry juice. I liked this Sangria the best just because it was so different!! This drink taste like peaches!! Light and refreshing! --- All in all, CPK is average food with wicked cool bartenders. Parking is ample and on-site. Right now due to construction the parking lot is a maze but it will get better!! Sit at the bar if you can. I prefer to. Service is quick and friendly. Although hearing all the managers argue with each other was awkward!

This my first time at CPK and it was a really  good experience.for my first time here. And here as CPK didn't go to pearlridge anyway all places that open for the first time no matter what, run into bumps on the road but how you recover is the winning experience keep it up KAPOLEI CPK

A long wait was expected for the first day opened. A text is sent when your table is ready so you can cruz around the mall if you like. The energy was high in the restaurant. Workers were pleasant and wanted to serve you. Unbelievable service and care by all. We had about a team of 4 catering to us and the manager came by too. The food was amazing and on time. Thinking about when I can go again!!!

I must say considering they have been open only 3 days it was a great experience! They were fast serving the food and drinks...the place is beautiful! The only downside the wait....we were fortunate the bar had seating but if you want a table 1 1/2 hr wait! Yikes

Day 3! It was so busy & they took down our name and number. It was a 70min wait and WELL WORTH IT!!! While waiting in the car, I got a text saying our table was ready!!! It was so packed and I'm so impressed because the customer service was AMAZING!!! Like 5 different people came to check on our table even though they weren't our waitress. And our waitress was so sweet and helpful. Our water was always filled, our bread kept coming and I nodded in guilt every time!! I never felt rushed. Thank you Ray!!!! I love the smiles and energy people transfer throughout the whole restaurant!!! definitely the new hotspot!!
Service was great!  Everything was good except for my soup being luke warm. My son loved the fried macaroni!

Randomly ended up here... the inside is not very big. When we walked up they took my info and said they would text me when our table was ready...  We went to the bar to grab a beer and found out that since it's full service  (they serve food) our kids (age 5 & 10) can sit here with us. After waiting about 30 minutes we cancelled our table and ended up with great service at the bar! We can't wait to come back.

Came here for a late lunch around 2pm. There was a 40min wait so we walked to Macys. Got a TEXT to come back to the restaurant.  Restaurant is beautiful! Very modern looking, full bar inside. Some seating outside.  Server Didi was great and very tentative! Thanks for that! :) Water was always filled.  Complementary bread with some oil sauce thing. (4/5) Got the Mahi Mahi tacos. Came with 3 tacos, and chips with some kind of salsa. (3/5) because the fish was bland but the siracha sauce made up for it, kinda. But the portion for the meal is great, so so filling. Artichoke dip is always great, chips are bottomless! (5/5) its the go-to appetizer! Butter cake! Got it without icecream because we were already so full! But def recommended to get with haagen daz ice cream! (5/5) According to my sister, the menu were missing some items from other CPK locations.  Parking is ample, shared with the rest of the mall parking!

My family and I had lunch here yesterday for the first time.. and it was a very pleasant experience. As soon as we walked through the door... the CPK employees made us feel very welcomed. From when we first walked in... to when we sat down and ate... to when we got up and left(as HAPPY customers)... everyone was very nice and friendly. And as for the food... the food was nice.. hot.. fresh and very delicious! No disappointments here. Food and service was on point. My family and I will definitely be coming back again :)

Ate there during the "soft" opening and ordered out today. Both times the staff were super helpful and super friendly. Quality of food did not disappoint. Take out order was neatly packed and more importantly, correct. I have been waiting for a CPK to open on the west side and with the service and quality food here in Kapolei, it may become my favorite eatery near home.

First time at this location since they opened a week ago. Normally I don't go to a restaurant before they've reached atleast a month opened because service can be horrible. But that's not the case for this place. Came in with a family of 6 the wait was about 10 minutes this was on a Thursday night 5pm. Our waitress Jen lo. (I think) was awesome very friendly and not too upbeat . She was very considerate about giving us time to decide what we wanted. I ordered the garlic cream fettuccine with sautéed mushrooms and it was amazing!!! Lots of flavor nothing over powering. Kudos to the chef!!! Not sure how long they'll be giving complimentary artichoke dip for first time customers but that was a plus ! I honestly don't have anything bad to say about this establishment. Please keep up the good work. Thanks Jen lo for a pleasant first time.!!
I really love it here this place is so nice da workerz is super sweet n on it. Janique is alsome I'll come back again

I'm typically not a big fan of chain restaurants, but since this place is new to our area in the upcoming new mall, I found it my civic duty to go an check it out and inform the masses, haha!  Thursday night, 6:22pm. 50 minute wait for first available seating. Seated outdoors at 7:15pm.  Luckily, we were seated outside which seemed a little more quiet than the inside. Comfy chairs with pillow were 5 star for me at that point. DRINKS: Strawberry Mango Cooler- refreshing! yum! I savored it though out the night because it not refillable.  Frozen Strawberry Lemonade- beautiful and the bomb! Also non refillable. But I think it be well worth buying another! Lol! STARTERS:  Spinach Artichoke Dip- good size, you'll need to ask for more chips Tortilla Egg Rolls- i did not expect to like these as I do not like egg rolls at all. we got (2 choices) Thai chicken, YUM! Mediterranean Veggie- THAT WAS AMAZEBALLS!!! If you like mushrooms, you will absolutely Love these egg rolls! I think the torilla wrap made all the difference for me.  ENTRÉES: Adult size Mac & Cheese- This was the biggest disappointment. we got our toddler the adult size so that she could share with her brother.  Well the plate was bigger than she was but the PORTION GIVEN WAS SO INCREDIBLY LITTLE she finished it on her own. We've had this dish before at other CPKS, and this was the smallest portion we've ever gotten. I almost said something, but I didnt. Felt kinda ripped off.  Garlic Creamy Fettuccine with Chicken, Shrimp and Mushrooms- I swapped fettuccine for spaghetti. Excellent Ribeye- served on a cutting board. There was a spice to it I couldn't exactly place, but my son enjoyed it. The only thing was the SALAD NEEDED MORE DRESSING.  Shrimp Scampi Zucchini- this was a surprisingly light dish for a "scampi."  Bolognese Pasta- looked really DRY with not much meat.  Cedar Plank Salmon- Charred and OVERDONE  SERVICE: Despite the recent openning, the servers were very attentive and accommodating. Water was refilled, every request granted with a smile, they were all great!  BIRTHDAY TREAT:  Vanilla Caramel Sunday with walnuts and a song! It was lovely So ALL IN ALL it was an okay first visit. Definitely some of the food was amazing, and some were lacking in the biggest way. My biggest gripe is the incredibly SMALL PORTIONS of PASTA entrées on such a big rimmed plate.  My daughter's Mac n Cheese being such a small portion, paying the adult price so she could share with my son... I kinda am mad at myself for not saying anything, but oh well. Next time I know. I hope CPK takes all this into consideration to improve. it is a new location after all.

Eating here on the 6th day after opening, they have some kinks to work out. Pizza came out wrong three times, but the staff was very apologetic and they were slammed busy. So I'm chalking it up to them still getting settled in to the new restaurant flow and didn't take it personally.  Food was good, very nice staff, great ambience (just loud). We will be back.

Arrived for the first time at this new CPK location already excited! Without really knowing the new mall, CPK was easy to find. It's at the far left side of the mall and is fairly big and very modern. Indoor and outdoor seating is available and a large rectangular bar you can sit at as well. Me and my friend checked in at around 8:45pm and were texted 5 minutes later for our table. It was still a pretty busy night for a Thursday at that late of an hour surprisingly. Our waitress was super sweet and very informative when we asked questions about their new seasonal items. The bar manager even came to talk story with us to see how we were doing. This was a nice added touch that we noticed, at other restaurants the managers do come up to see how we are doing but only to ask the usual questions "How is everything tonight? Good? Good." It was nice to see a pleasant face that wanted to really see how we were doing instead of a robot. Each part of our meal from our drinks, to the appetizer, and the meal were all brought out in a timely manner. Our waitress always made sure our drinks were filled and if we wanted more bread. Drinks Very Berry Sangria and Strawberry Lemonade Awesome drinks! Appetizer Artichoke Dip Always amazing, I don't think you can ever go wrong with this dish Entrees The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad Salad was dry, very little dressing. but at least had other flavors in it so it wasn't as bad Garlic Cream Fettucine with Chicken The noodles were a bit undercooked (it was still hard...I don't mean al dente hard, I mean I had to pry it out of my teeth hard) Fire-Grilled Rib Eye Steak (medium) It was very heavily salted but still a good piece of meat -- this is weird of me to say only because if you know me I love my salty foods. But this steak on one side was very heavily salted but the other end was salted just right. I suppose you can't get it perfect every time. Overall, the experience was amazing and I will definitely come back especially when the whole mall is open.

Horrible first impression. Arrived at 6:50pm. Was told that the wait time is 60 minutes. I asked why that was since I seen a handful of open tables. The worker at the door tells me the staff are all new so they're very slow.  Why would CPK bring in inexperienced servers to work in a new restaurant? Isn't that what soft openings are for? Anyway. He asked for my cell phone number so they can text me when my table was ready. I waited for 25 minutes and ended up leaving. I received a text message from them at 8:47pm telling me that my table is ready. Really now??? Won't be trying that place out anytime soon.

I was really excited to have CPK on this side of the island.  It's of my husband and my favorite restaurants.  I have to say, the salad we got was the same, great salad we've always enjoyed.  But the other items, not so much.  We ordered the avocado club rolls, garlic cream fettuccine with mushroom and chicken, and the original chicken salad with avocados and no cilantro (I really want to like cilantro, but I just don't).  It took 1 hour for our take out order to be ready (which I'm forgiving about since they're still so new) so that's not why I rate them at 2.  The avocado club rolls tasted vastly different than I know them to taste but worse than that, the fettuccine also didn't taste as good AND they must have mistaken the parsley for cilantro?! or something because there was cilantro in my pasta! Not ok.  I would like for them to get better... still really enjoy CPK but the cilantro really ruined the pasta... I don't think its ever been in the pasta.. but it was in mine tonight and it made me really sad.  lets get this right, please because I really want to come back... and come back often ;)

Got here on a Sunday a little before the doors opened so stood in line about 20 in front of us.  They finally open the  doors, they open at 11.   There is 15-20 minutes wait ..... we were here before they opened .....

After waiting over an hour for takeout the food was cold clearly having sat out. The service was extremely chaotic and seemed very unorganized. We opted for takeout because of the almost 2 hour wait time to dine in, although there were many empty tables. It will be quite a while before I come to this location again.

Came here for lunch on Saturday opening weekend.  Minus one star for the check in, we arrived at 10:45 (no line at least) but they wouldn't take our name or number to add on a list until 11am.  They need to put a sign on take out back door, several customers came through that door and made a mess of the people already waiting for a table. Once 11am came around, it was crowded but luckily we got our name on the list to be seated immediately.  Odd though, even though we were one of the first on the list, they tell us it may be a 15 minute wait.  At least it wasn't.  Instead of buzzers, they take your cell phone number and text you when your table is ready.  The atmosphere is nice, seating area seems a bit smaller than the other CPKs.  Service was great, attentive and filled our drinks often.  The works and five cheese pizza are both really good.  Menu items seems a bit limited, but looks like a good variety.  Hope to be back and try the other items.
Went to CPK at 5p, 1/2 empty but told 1 hr wait cuz kitchen staff can't handle any volumes. Really???? Won't be back or at least for a long, long time. Disappointed.

Unsatisfied with the staff and management of the kitchen that evening.I celebrated my bday here on Friday 10/7 at around 5pm. It was a 40 min wait for my party of 10 which was reasonable but the wait turned out longer because to text notification was received. When I followed up with staff at the entrance, they were confused and claimed they had sent a text. I quickly answered and showed that no text was received. When we were shown to our table, I was given a table for 8.  We ordered about 11 items on the menu including 4 pasta dishes, a ribeye steak, a couple of pizzas, the chx Moroccan salad and the bbq chx salad. All but the ribeye steak came out within reasonable time. The chx moroccan salad came out with no chx. chx tequila fettucine pasta was hard.  Half way done with the our meals, i followed up with our server (Kami) and what it appears to be happening was the steak was being sent with another order. Most of my party was done eating and no steak yet. You could see the miscommunication between the kitchen staff and the servers.  A lot of food was coming out, but our steak was being sent to another table. Kami apologized for the wait and said that management from the kitchen will stop to apologize. No management from the kitchen ever came by. I appreciate that the bar manager(Eve or Eva) that evening came out of her way to help Kami remedy our situation. We felt that these two were the only ones who were genuinely sincere about the situation. Eve and Kami helped me by removing our appetizers and the steak from my bill.  We want thank Kami and Eve for staying calm and resolving the situation. They both have served us with aloha.

The food was delicious, the waitstaff was very attentive, we had a larger party of 8 people  initially we were told we would have to sit separately but they accommodated our group together   A great place to celebrate national pizza month. It has indoor and outdoor seating, an nice bar area and a take out counter. Love the new location and the surrounding shopping mall.

It's been awhile since we've had great food service.  Everyone was awesome!  Greeters, Host and Hostesses. The chef also did a great job with the food. Thank u to our super friendly waitresses, Amber  & Chayna.   The whole crew ROCK!!! . Dinner was super yummy.  Best CPK on the island.

The wait: they take your number down and text you when your table is easy. Accuracy of wait time is wrong though. They said "it'll be about half an hour or less" it took 35 mins till our table was ready. Looking inside the restaurant, there were lots of vacant tables... maybe lack of staff?  Service: our server, Carolyn, was extremely friendly and personable and made our experience 5 stars.. the wait was the -1 star but she made up for it. Mahalo Carolyn! Food: wait for food wasn't too long. Typical CPK food, good appetizers and entrees. Drinks were good too. Overall: good experience. So glad there's a CPK in Kapolei now!

We ordered take out from Kapolei CPK we waited for one hour for our food we kept checking they kept telling us it wasn't ready and when it WAS READY they didn't even tell us!!!! we got home our food was COLD and our Pizza tasted like rubber and the salad dressing was HORRIBLE!!!!!! I think we will stick to Pearlridge CPK for now and let Kapolei CPK practice a little more

Too bad I couldn't put zero stars.   Two hour wait?   I saw at least 10+ open tables and at least the same amount of tables that were already eatting or finished eatting.  Their excuse "We don't want to slam our kitchen."  Uhm, the kitchen better get their $#it together,  because the size of the dinning area ain't going to get smaller.  If they are so concerned about the kitchen getting over worked then they should have either made the restaurant smaller or hired a bigger staff.  I may update if I decide to give this place a second shot.

Excellent customer service.! The wait was long understandably because it just opened. Everyone was friendly, Aloha abounds. Manager, and server was so accommodating because of some delays. Thank you  CPK for coming to Kapolei.

Arrived at 12:30 with a party of 6. 50 minutes to be seated ... the restaurant and outside area were at about 60% capacity. "We don't want to overwhelm the kitchen" was the answer when I asked why we would have to wait for that long. Listen, you're a new chain restaurant at a new mall. How in the world do you not take advantage of your opportunity for putting the best foot forward? Lame.

Tonight I had an amazing server Amber U. We sat down for like 5 mins and she was on top of everything. Ordered our food and not even 10 mins later we got our appetizers. Everything was perfectly cooked well prepared and her service was SUPER WELCOMING AND FRIENDLY.  Also there was our hostess Danielle M. She was super helpful and welcoming too. Most definitely will come back. Ask for Amber U. ! You won't regret it

Went tonight at about 8:45pm. I was told at the hostess stand that the wait would be about 45min to 1hr wait. There were a lot of parties waiting for tables outside and only 50% of the restaurant was full. We decided to eat somewhere else. What's the point of advertising such a large restaurant if you don't even keep it filled? I hope this improves over time and is only because the restaurant is new. I won't be eating here until this issue is fixed.

On a Sunday night I asked for a table for two and the hostess tells me it'll be a 1.5 hour to 2 hour wait for a table in their dining room, but there's no wait to eat at the bar.  My husband and I opted to dine at the bar area and it worked out well because the two men behind the bar were attentive and checked up on us, the food came out fast, and we got to watch "The Simpsons" show on one of the flat TV screens above our heads.  We ordered our usual favorites like the Avocado Egg Rolls and Thai Crunch Salad.  My husband ordered the Two-in-a-Bowl soups and he said he like the Tortilla Soup better than the pea soup because the pea soup tasted "too earthy".  We also split a Garlic Chicken pizza and we shared the Butter Cake.  I wish the pizza had more caramelized onions.  Butter Cake was a great ending to our meal.  Everything had the same taste and presentation like the other CPK restaurants we've dined at.  However, the seating of guests in the dining room with the more than an hour wait time is questionable to me because as we sat at the bar, I saw at least two two-top tables and three four-top tables empty in the dining room and they were not filled right away.  By the end of our meal I saw two four-top tables that were never occupied the whole time we were there.  If we chose to wait, I'm sure we would have been seated earlier within an hour.  I also saw friends who were seated outside with their large party after waiting for 1.5 hours to be seated.  They were not happy because it was taking a long time for their food to make it to their table, they were given a wrong order for a pasta dish, and were still waiting for the right order to get to them.  It seems inconsistent for us at the bar to get our food sooner than my friend's party that was seated way before we were.  I would have been happier to be seated at a table and to see two empty tables the whole time kind of annoys me and makes me wonder if the hostesses at the front really know how to accurately gauge wait times for smaller parties.  It's understandable that larger parties need to wait long, but for two or four people they could have easily been seated within an hour.  Maybe that's just a kink they need to work out since they've only been open for less than a month.

Chose to eat here with some family and friends last night, in celebration of our friend's birthday. We expected that there would be a really long wait determined by the amount of people that were waiting outside as we first pulled into the parking lot. Was told that the wait would be about 80mins and for a party of 7, we thought it was expected. Thankfully they have some seating areas near by, so we sat near the fountain which kept my 5 year old busy. We saw a lot people being seated, as well as people who came after us. Kept having to check in with the hostess to see what was the hold up and finally after waiting for over an hour, we got a table.  Server came and got our drinks and we placed or orders right away cause we knew that it was gonna take awhile due to how long we had to wait for our table, and also with the fact that we understood that the place was pretty new, so the kitchen staff would take long as well. We got our complimentary bread and oil, which we pretty much murdered cause we were all starving. Then our appetizers....then another hour later, we finally got our food. I ordered my son a meat sauce pasta, so I was quite confused to see that they brought out a plate with just plain pasta and placed it in front of him. I waited as they were giving everyone else their food, thinking that maybe the had the sauce separately and I would have to pour it on myself. But nope, that wasn't the case. We notified the server that I ordered a meat sauce pasta, and he said, 'Okay, I'll check up on that'..and mind you the server that took the plate away was not our server. He then came back a minute or two later to tell us that it's a buttered sauce that was ordered and not the meat sauce. We still proceeded to tell him that it was meat sauce that was ordered, so he took it back to the kitchen. The kitchen was nearby, so we could see that he printed out the receipt to show the manager what was "ordered" like it was such a hassle to take a ladle to scoop up some sauce and pour it onto the pasta. While they were doing that, another server came to our table with another plate of buttered pasta and pizza (same pizza that my husband ordered and already was eating)...so on top of them giving the wrong type of pasta, there was more miscommunication with the staff cause double orders were made. Still, waiting for my son's food, he was so hungry so I fed him some of my pasta in the meantime. They were still trying to figure out what the hell to do with his pasta, cause they were still talking to the manager...which I cant figure why it was taking so long cause all we were doing was adding on meat sauce to the pasta...there wasnt gonna be a change in the price of his food cause they wouldve all been the same price. So many minutes later, they finally come with his food and he started to chow.  Dont get me wrong, the food was good. My husband's pizza was a little hard, and our friend's salmon was on the dry side. Service was the only thing that brought this place down. Sure, the space is huge, thank goodness, cause their Ala Moana and Pearlridge location is quite small. But they really need to get their crap together, and probably won't be back til they do so.

Went there with a friend last Friday night, expected to wait as there was a lot of people waiting outside.  Was told wait was about 40 minutes so not to bad, got a text 40 minutes later that it would be another 5 to 10 minutes so ok.  We finally get a text 27 minute later (total wait 77 minutes) out table is ready.  I order the mahi tacos which were great but my friend had the shrimp scampi which was not good.  After trying it she tells me to try it and it tasted watery like just defrosted,   shrimp was overcooked and pasta which was almost half slices of zucchini had no taste at all.  The bottom of the dish was normally is garlicky scampi sauce was instead watery liquid!      On the plus side when we told our waitress she i mmediately called the manager who instead of making excuses, apologized and agreed there was to much liquid.  He offered us another dish but we were pretty much done so he gave us a free dessert and of course did not charge us for the scampi.  Service was great along with our waitress but did notice as mentioned in another review empty tables while people waited (under staffed?)!        Great location and will be even busier when the rest of the mall opens, seems like a good manager and great waitresses, just needs more staffing and better execution on some dishes but will be back!

CPK food is typical, our order came out quick. Our server was phoebe, she was excellent and courteous. The service was by far the best I've had from a CPK. The decor and overall landscape of the restaurant is open and lots of natural light. Great place to eat.

Awesome and beautiful new location. Came go lunch to this new location. Lots of workers walking around so the wait wasn't too long. Tables were pretty full so we decided to take a seat at the bar. The bartender was awesome and really took care of our thirst. There were 2 other people behind the bar taking food orders. Come to find out one of the servers recently married a family friend. Small world. The two also helped with drinks from time to time. Very friendly and talkative. Made our lunch hour go by quickly. We ordered a salad and a pizza, lots of food for 2. They even write their names down on a glass shot glass with our running tab so you don't forget their names and vice versa. Cool idea. Will definitely return and advertise.

California Pizza Kitchen is located in the new mall that all officially opens this Friday. My friend and I were excited to come here, as we remembered loving their menu. Since it was new, we expected it to be a little busy, but we came for lunch and there was plenty of bar seating so we sat right down. The bartenders were nice, but they seemed a little more concerned with cleaning the bar for the night shift than helping customers as we ordered a salad and a sandwich and a guy next to us who had come in about an hour after us and ordered a well done ribeye steak and both of our orders came out at the same time.... I think they lost our ticket because the food took 45 minutes to come out. After 45 minutes of waiting we finally asked where our food was and was told it'd be out soon before she went and finally checked on it. When my friend's salad finally came out it was wrong and she had to wait again for them to fix it. When we did finally get our correct food it was delicious! But waiting that long for a salad and a sandwich was kinda ridiculous. Maybe come here in a few months once they're better trained.

Went there for lunch when it opened, service was slow. Ordered only two dishes, avocado egg roll, and spaghetti bolognese, took 45 mins. Then my egg rolls came out burnt! Why even serve them? Like I'm not going to notice it and send it back?? I wouldn't go back until this restaurant can work out its kinks with its new crew. Too bad, love this place, only to be ruined by bad service.

This may be my favorite CPK location to go to! Because of the service I've had, along with the food I've tried, and the aesthetics of the place inside and out, it made me want to come back for more! This CPK location is located in the new mall in Kapolei/West O'ahu called Ka Makana Ali'i. It is also located right near the new Olino Consolidated Theatre. I felt like there were limited parking spaces for such a big shopping center... Besides that, the wait to get a seat inside CPK wasn't that long! I came around 2pm on a Wednesday and requested for a table for 2. The hostess said the wait would take about 15 minutes for indoor seating (you can choose between outdoor and indoor seating), so she took down my name and phone number on an iPad, and told me I'd receive a text when our table would be ready. I sat and waited inside since there was air condition lol! 5 minutes later, I got the text that my table was ready, so another hostess guided us to our table. I was soooooo excited when she seated my friend and I at a booth table, enough to fit 4-6 people.. Even though I was a party of 2, and saw a couple empty seats for 2 as well. It's like this hostess knew I preferred the booths :') she also proceeded to give us the menus to browse over before our server came to retrieve our orders.  My server went by the name "Pebbles", and took our drink orders and appetizers first. I got a Mango Lemonade (~$4), which she happily let me know it's free refills, and I also got the Spinach Artichoke Dip (~$11.50)! She brought out 2 waters, the lemonade, and complimentary bread promptly, and that's when I placed my order on the meal. My friend got the Roasted Garlic Chicken ($19.99) and I got the Garlic Cream pasta with penne instead of the usual fettuccine (~$13.50), and added on chicken (+$3) and sautéed mushrooms (+$1.50). My friend was nuts for ordering all the add-ons for me T_T I would have simply went for only the pasta because honestly, I thought it was a bit too pricy for the portions I received at other locations I've tried at before.  The Spinach Artichoke Dip came out shortly after, and presentation of it was like nothing I've seen at other locations... Or maybe it's been a long time since I've been to CPK hahaha. The bowl of dip is in the middle of a larger bowl with tortilla chips surrounding it! Yummy. My friend and I devoured that thing in less than a few minutes!! The wait for the meals took a little longer, I'd say ~20-30 minutes.  Pebbles was nice enough to let us know it'll be out shortly, and she'll check on the status of it. She came right back with my friend's chicken and a plate of Garlic Cream FETTUCCINE with the add-ons... She said the cooks mistakenly made fettuccine instead of the penne I ordered :'( but that my penne should be coming soon. She was so nice though, that she gave the plate to me for free! I was really hesitant to take it, but who can say no to free food?! I ended up eating the fettuccine instead, and had the penne packed to-go.  While my friend and I were still eating, Pebbles gave us a dessert menu to look over. I got the Red Velvet Cheesecake ($7.99) with Haagen-Daz Vanilla Ice Cream added on for $1.50 more. I love that dessert so much!! Especially the white chocolate swirls, and with the ice cream makes it perfect for a dessert :'d My friend really enjoyed his Roasted Garlic Chicken (pan-sautéed chicken breast in lemon-garlic sauce with potatoes, cauliflowers, and Brussels sprout). It came with 2 small pieces of chicken though.. I didn't think it was worth the price, but he said he liked it and thought it was worth it. So I'll just take his word for it.  My friend also pointed out the songs that were playing in the restaurant, and I loved it! Great songs were being played, in genres I normally wouldn't listen to. Like James Bay soothing music! I also noticed there was bar section with basketball playing on TV. Didn't know CPK had a bar! Throughout the entire dining experience, Pebbles checked up on us each time to see if we liked the complimentary bread, the mango lemonade, the appetizer, our meal, and to let her know if I wanted my dessert packed to-go if I couldn't finish it. She would always refill my friend's water before it went completely empty. She refilled my lemonade twice, and asked me if I wanted one to-go. With such a positive, genuine attitude and consistent service, I decided to tip her 30%! Upon leaving, one of the hostess held the door for us and all the hostesses greeted us farewell with "have a great day!" Fantastic service here, no doubt.

While CPK has always been one of my favorite restaurants, especially in the realm of chains, this one is definitely the best in Hawaii! It may be the largest one on the island so far and it certainly has a much more refreshed and inviting atmosphere than some of the others! The new bar is a great size and is really neat too! As always, the food and staff are on point, true to the CPK way!

The food is awesome here. We came here the other weekend. I liked that their tea is endless. Peach ice tea has got to be my most favorite one. The service once we got seated was very good. Server always kept checking up on us. The only thing I didn't like was the wait. We had a 30 minute wait which isn't bad. But we ended up getting seated by the entrance where we was & the whole time we waited, nobody was seated at the table we ended up getting seated. So in other words, we could have actually been seated once we signed in.. BUT THE FOOD MADE UP FOR IT IN A WAY. The fettuccine alfredo with chicken,shrimp n mushrooms was very full of flavor. Lots of garlic just how I like it.

I understand they're newly opened.  But, we waited so long for our take out order.  When we got our food home, my ginger chicken dumplings were ice cold.  It was like they took it out of the fridge and put it in my order.
2hour wait but empty tables though out the restaurant I do not think place effective management or they would not let this happen

Wait time: Horrible!! I went twice already. Both times over 2 hour wait times. Both times had plenty of open tables both inside and outside. Both times I ended up eating at the bar at 1.5 hours into our wait. First time my table was ready at 2 hours, second time 2.5 hours. AND both times it was only a party of 2 (my 13 y.o and I) !!!  Food: It also took an hour to get our food both times, there's was a lot of workers in the kitchen too.  Service: when we did get to sit down, like I said earlier, I ended up eating at the bar both times with my 13 y.o; the servers at the bar had great customer service, they were friendly, and as efficient as they could be. Every time I ate at the bar, there was Carl, Aulii, and Sandy, they were superb, awesome, and had great customer service!!
I love love love this new location close to home the servers are super nice and the food is so damn good especially the steak mouth watering I can't wait To have it again

Always delish! Even though it's crowded and busy you always see smiling employees and that's a plus because that means service will exceed your expectations! Their mushroom pizza is delish and Moscow mules are on point!

First off I wanted to say this was the most pleasurable experience i've had at a CPK EVER Came to the mall for the first time since they opened 2 days before. I knew CPK opened a few weeks before but everyone I knew said to wait it out till they got in the groove of things just as any new establishment. Came to front and was greeted by the hostess Dani. She was very informative and told us that the wait would be a hour and half minute wait. I was hesitant at first but I said why not since it would give me and my girlfriend time to look around the mall and told her if anything opened up sooner please let us know. So we walked and after about 40-50 mins came back since it was Sunday and majority of the mall was closing. Snagged a seat right next to the check-in table and Dani was there again, asked if we could see a menu while we waited and after 5 mins she was able to get us seated right away which was perfect! She sat us in the back near the take-out area and told us that our servers name was "Amber" and that she'll be assisting us tonight Amber first came and introduced herself was very attentive and took our order for drinks and apps. When she came back she informed us that they had ran out of bread but me and my girlfriend said it was fine since we know it was a busy place. Ordered the friend mac n cheese and it was good and ordered the lettuce wrap. Amber then left and checked up on us frequently and we then decided to share a asian chicken salad. The Mac N cheese and salad came out before the lettuce wrap and amber apologized for that since she inputted the Mac N Cheese and Wraps  before she even inputted the salad. She also tipped us on the CPK app to let us know about discounts and other things which was useful as we waited. The Asian Chicken Salad was so good you gotta try that for sure. The Pizza's were goos just as you would expect a CPK pizza to be. Dessert came along and the Pumpkin cheese cake and the  pound cake w/ice cream just topped the night with great food and service. Out of all the CPK's on island this is my favorite and most definitely will be going back for everything.

DISCLAIMER:  I am basing this review solely on my experience ordering take-out. My parents really wanted to go out to eat at the new CPK but when my step-dad called ahead, he was told it would be an hour and 45-minute to 2-hour wait and they don't take reservations.  Being accustomed to CPK, I said why not order ahead and just go pick it up. Simple enough, right?  Wrong. While attempting to use the website to place our order (which I had done at other CPKs), I was met with an error that that particular restaurant was not accepting online orders and that I should call. Okay, fair enough. They are new enough that I could expect that not everything is up and running. So I proceeded to call the restaurant...here we go. I spent over 10 minutes on hold - I was put there by 3 DIFFERENT people before someone finally got on the line to take my order. Every time someone answered, they put me on hold again and again. I was finally able to place our order and when I asked how long it would take before it was ready, the lady stated 45 minutes because "the food was coming out slow" that night. But she assured me that she would call my phone number provided should our food be ready before then. I let her know I lived in Ewa so it would take a few minutes.  Needless to say, I never received a call.  When we got to the restaurant, we still had to wait for our order. To add insult to injury, they had run out of their complimentary bread and made no attempt to offer us something else instead. Service was slow and sub-par. Although not incorporated into my review, rumor has it they work their emloyees like crazy and don't let them have breaks. That's not cool. The food was about the only good thing. But hey, CPK is CPK. Of course I'll eat there again, but only because I like the food. I fear what my experience would be like if/when I actually dine in.

Chicken Picata entree was very tasty and a nice-sized portion.  But...wine prices have gone way way up. Can no longer justify $10 a glass and $33 to $42 a bottle. Music so loud that conversation over a meal is not possible. We both pulled out our phones and read. Uncomfortable ambience with the loud music made worse by the very bad acoustics where every noise and every voice reverberates off the high ceiling. Long-time local CPK customer, but I'll be staying away from this one. Btw avoid the rolled pasta with mushrooms. Very small portion of mushrooms for the large portion of pasta, with an overly salted sauce. Had it last week.   Ewa Beach Bill

Wait was about a hour which wasn't too bad. Went on a Wednesday about 8pm. Got seated around 9pm. However when we arrived we seen A TON of tables that weren't taken and asked them about it they said they weren't seating people there. My guess cause they're still training or whatever and don't have enough staff to handle. When we finally got seated table wasn't even 100% set. Guy had to go come to drop off plates. Forgot utensils & napkins, we had to ask for it later. Waiter took about 10 minutes to come to us as she was chatting with a friend that was there on another table she was serving. Then finally came to take our orders. Then took another 10 minutes to bring our waters, no other drinks just water. Out of 4 of us took about 40 minutes or so for us to get our food. Noticed while we were sitting a lot of workers standing around not doing anything or even staff that work there that may have been on break we're sitting down in the chairs by take out. Very unprofessional like go to the break room or whatever. While we were eating our courses as well not once did the waitress come to ask us how our food was. I know this place is new and all but the WORST CPK I've been to. Won't be visiting this CPK for a long time.

I think they might have forgotten about our food or it was just super busy.  Kellie our server was really good and probably not her fault...but food took like an hour.  They comped our whole meal and making us want to come back about 5 minutes prior we were about to just walk out the door. Good job cpk!

First thing I noticed as I walked along the window of the restaurant was wow it shouldn't be to long of wait since I saw at least 8 open tables inside the restaurant and another 3-4 in the outdoor seating. Come to find out our friends who got there first and checked in said it would be a 40-50 min wait. We knew there would be a wait and just accepted it. 50 min went by and we still didn't get the text alert so we went to check in with the hostess to see what the status was. There was 4 more people ahead of us (all parties of 2-4). As I did another stroll along the windows I still saw at least 5 tables open in inside with 2-3 that needed to be cleaned up. The automatic answer if you question the open tables was "we don't want to overload the kitchen". If you question that response you will quickly get "would you like to speak to a manager". So apparently their kitchen can't handle a full house and if you come to this location you will most likely see many open tables and have an hour long wait. After maybe 5-10 min then we were seated. And guess what?! It was at one of the open tables I had seen earlier. The food is still same quality if went to any of the other locations. So needless to say we won't be coming back to this location for at least a couple of months until they work out all their kinks and their kitchen staff can handle a full house.

This is mainly because the host that greeted everyone waited at the door while everyone was standing in line in the rain. She didn't even bother to move inside so we all wouldn't get wet. I felt that it was incredibly rude.

Although the food was pretty good, the service was horrible.  We sat at the bar an waited for about 10 minutes for someone to take our drink order.  Then we had to flag someone down to take our food order.  Then the order was never put in.  After 30 minutes we were asking about our food and that was when I think they forgot.  I am not being harsh because there were literally 5 bartenders behind the bar working.  I could have worked that bar by myself with a barback.

it was my birthday and it was kind of disappointing. My order was wrong and when they delivered it the second time they didn't ask if I wanted cheese :( Everything tasted fine but boy it was pricey... and our waitress didn't smile at all.

Waited for quite a while for our food to come out then when it did it was soggy and bland. Got a different pizza instead but to go since my company was done with her food. The new pizza came out in minutes which just tells me it was sitting in the window for a bit. On top of that we were purposefully given hard bread ends since we, verbatim "look young and probably have strong teeth."

My girlfriend and I came on a Friday night and it was really busy so we ate at the bar. We waited only about 10 minutes for bar seats to open up. The bartender AJ was great giving us drink recommendations and the food came out quickly. We left a credit card accidentally and the manager was nice enough to get it back to us after hours the next morning.

Empty tables in and outdoor seating area while you wait over an hour to be seated.  Other places tell you an hour but call you earlier, NOT here.  You wait longer.  Told 70 minutes going over 75 now, talked w mgr not much help but gracious.  They don't want to bring you in and you have a long wait, still trying to balance and get kitchen up to par.  Not a good first impression.  Arrived 520pm, Sunday 10/30/16 now 634pm still not called.  Ugh should have gone Zippy's

I would give 5 stars for the waitress she's awesome! Very helpful and attentive.. but the chef????  Pasta is raw...their rib eye steak was tough.. not all customers wants a free meal specially when all we wanted is to enjoy the food... I will definitely won't go back.. I rather cook at home! Thanks to Chelsea our waitress shes a keeper for ur company!

ASK FOR HUNTER!  Super kind and down to earth. It's important to have customers feel welcomed and overall enjoy their experience and he did that. We enjoyed our meal and we all left being friends! My girlfriends and I will be back!

I've eaten at the CPK at Pearl Ridge before and absolutely loved it!  So me and my friends decided to check out the new one at the Mall.  We thought going at 5 oclock on a weekend was going to be early enough to miss the dinner crowd and we were wrong!! Let me tell you how our night went! Pros- They text you when your table is ready! So now you can go shopping at the mall anywhere and just come back quickly when you are ready!       - The tables outside were really nice and with the cool breeze made it a nice night to have dinner outside. Cons- The wait for 3 adults and 2 children at 5 o'clock on a weekend was over an hour         - My friends ordered a margarita- Now I don't know much about using "top Shelf" alcohol but this margarita came in a shot glass..... which he drank in a shot....... because it came ina shot glass...with ICE!!!!!!!  So the next drink he asked for it to come with no ice as you are barely getting any drink when it is in a double shot glass with ice.... It came half full.... when we spoke to the manager she stated that the alcohol is strictly measured out and without the ice the drink looks small.... I told the manager they should rename the drink and asked how much each drink was... 12.00!!!! I about fainted..... I can go to Ruby Tuesday and get a real Margarita and upsize the think for like 10.00 I think!!        - To top it off the food took about an hour to get to us...... My soup which I ordered as an appetizer came after my entrée, because they forgot and here's the best part!!! Another manager who knows how many CPK has on hand came over and told us " See that large table over there.... well sir your steak accidently went to them..... but we are making you a new one and it should be out in about 15 minutes."  Mind you this was after we had all, already gotten done eating.  Who tells the customer that there steak is being eaten by the guy next to him! Conclusion-- CPK is not all bad- just don't go to this one!

The five stars are for the decor/ambiance, the system they take the names of the restaurant-goers, and the extremely excellent service from our server. We arrived and there was a line.  We were surprised as we were only 10 minutes past opening time, but alas, we figured it would be busy anyway.  We moved up the line in a reasonable amount of time and they took our name and number, saying they'd text us.  We chose to stand around nearby since we didn't think the 20 minute wait was worth going to walk around.  We'd do that afterwards!   There is an indoor area, bar area, and a patio area.  Some people did choose the patio area, though we did not want to sit outside - it was a hot day and it was lunch time.  The place looks pleasant and I would consider it for dinner. After being seated, we saw that there was a new menu item for rib eye and that made my boyfellow very happy.  He ordered that in a jiffy while I ordered the California Club pizza, which is a departure from my normal staples.  We also got a free small plate (one of the flatbreads) with our Pizza Dough app.  I was happy with the flatbread but it had spinach, so boyfellow doesn't eat it.   Our server was very much "on it" with my boyfellow's refills and even my slower-drunk water with no ice.  I always emphasize that I don't want ice and I do judge on whether anyone bothers to refill my water AND/OR refills it with ice water.  Our server was very friendly, polite, and exceedingly attentive.  :)   We also ordered butter cake, of which I devoured of course.  Sadly, this butter cake was not up to par with the other butter cakes I have ordered, but it isn't bad either.  It just wasn't quite as moist - but there are always off days, I suppose.  That will not stop me from ordering it next time! I would come here before any other CPK on the island - but alas, I don't live on the West end....

Located in the brand new mall in Kapolei, less than 5 minutes away from my house.  You can bet I'll be here often.  Way too often.  During the day, there's ample parking, and I like that they have reserved stalls near to the takeout entrance so you can quickly run in and out for takeout. This is one of the larger CPK locations that I've ever been to.  Much nicer in design than the Ala Moana and Pearlridge locations.  Keep in mind, that even though there my be empty tables, they purposefully don't seat everyone so that the entire restaurant is at capacity.  This is so the kitchen doesn't get overloaded with people all ordering at the same time.  Hopefully, this is something they will slowly do away with once they get into the swing of things, but we'll see. We arrived at 1:30 PM on a weekday, and we were seated in less than 5 minutes!  We could have been seated quicker as there was more than 1 empty table, but as I said, they like to stagger seat times so that the kitchen doesn't get bombarded.  I had read other yelp reviews of people having 1.5 hour waits, so 5 minutes is NOT a problem for me.  I like that they offer to text you when your table is ready, that way if you are quoted a really long wait time, at least you can walk around the mall instead of being confined near the entrance with those buzzers that only work within X feet of the restaurant entrance. For the appetizers, we had the half Caesar salad, the Hawaii exclusive ahi egg rolls, and the avocado club egg rolls.  I don't think we'll be ordering the Caesar again, but just remember that their salad portions are HUGE.  A half portion is a regular sized salad at any other restaurant.  I really loved the ahi tuna egg rolls.  The avocado club egg rolls are my absolute favorite, but the ahi tuna egg rolls have a different flavor.  Try both if you can!   For my entree, I had the garlic cream fettucine with chicken, shrimp, mushrooms, AND avocado on top.  I've been ordering this for years.  I never try anything else, because it's always so good.  One of my absolute favorite foods to eat.  Another reason why I love dining in at CPK vs. takeout?  The unlimited bread + bottomless strawberry lemonades.   The food at CPK is always consistent, which is part of the reason it's one of my favorite restaurants.  The quality of food here is on par with the other CPKs on island, and the service was really prompt and friendly.  The food came out really quickly, appetizers out in less than 10 minutes, entrees out in less than 10 after the appetizers were finished. I was scared to come here after hearing the wait times, but if you go for a later lunch on a weekday, it's not bad at all.  I'll definitely be back, and back again, and back again after that.  ;) PS: If CPK isn't doing specials on gift cards, Costco sells $100 worth of gift cards for $80.  Even if you're not giving them to a friend, buy them for yourself if you're going to end up coming here a lot!

Wait time was a bit too long but their service made up for.  I was surprised that they actually will call your cell phone when your take out order is ready.  Chicken piccata was on point and the shrimp in the fettuccini was big and fresh.

Told it was a 60 minute wait. Waited for 60 minutes and still had 5 more parties ahead of us. They should at least update the time using their text message paging system. I really felt really bad because I had my relatives with me. If you come here at night, I recommend calling ahead.

Thank you LORD for answering my prayers!!! Finally a CPK on the west side of Oahu!!  I dreamt of days when CPK would open up on the west side of Oahu, and those dreams of driving less than 10 minutes to CPK has finally been answered!  CPK is my go to spot, whenever my friends/family want to go out to dinner and don't know really where to go, CPK would be the best option. It caters to all ages. With a kids menu, to small bites for a snack, huge portions for shareable dishes, and desserts to drool over.  I am seriously in love with this location!! The ambience doesn't feel like the CPK in Pearlridge and in Ala Moana! There's a bit of an industrial look to it, and hints of a "Hawaii" theme scattered around the restaurant.  There is outdoor and indoor seating for your preference.  Another thing that sets this location apart is that they send out text messages to you while you wait. So no more of that short distance buzzers that keeps you anticipating while watching people go in and out of the restaurant!  Since this place is still new and closer to those that live on the west side, we anticipated a long wait, so the 1 hour wait didn't surprise me and my friend.  We were able to walk around the mall, buy some things and as soon as we were heading back I received a message that our table was ready!   Our server DIDI WAS AMAZIG!! She took very good care of me and my friend, and the food came out super fast!  If we had a choice to recommend a server for my table it would be DIDI! Maybe I'm being biased because she was the first server we experienced at our visit to CPK, but she served us with a genuine smile and we truly enjoyed her service!  My go to dish is their Thai Crunch Salad with Avocados! :). Let me tell you this, The portion of the salad here compared to the other locations was HUG! Like in your face huge!! Like another planet huge!! Good thing it had it own gravitational pull...to my mouth! HAHA!  My friend ordered their Penne pasta along with Avocado club egg rolls!!  We truly enjoyed our visit here!  Definitely check out this location!

It either takes me a really good experience or a really bad one to write a Yelp review.  As much as I want this review to be the former, unfortunately it has to be the ladder.   We started our dinner with the spinach dip appetizer.  It took about 30 minutes for it to reach our table, and by then the dip had gotten pretty cold.  I suspect that it was forgotten on their kitchen counter, only to be rushed to our table after we told our server we were still waiting.  Meanwhile, this couple seated next to us got the exact same appetizer and received it in about 5 minutes after their order.   What I really disliked was how our main course came out about 1 minute after we got our appetizer.  For a sequential eater such as myself, that can be very frustrating. Before I forget, I ordered their tequila pasta thing with mushrooms, and they basically forgot the mushrooms and our server had to bring it on the side, which also came cold.  After several bites into my meal, I noticed hair in my pasta and immediately sent it back to the kitchen, which took another 10 minutes for them to replace.  Oh, and they forgot the mushrooms.. again.  By then, I had lost my appetite and packed the entire meal to go.  The manager offered free butter cake for the hair in my food.  Unfortunately, the cake didn't do a good job of cleansing my palette of the very poor experience I had just received.  The only saving grace of eating here was our server who kept apologizing profusely for all of the dinner mishaps.   Would I eat here again?  Probably not.  Don't get me wrong, I love CPK.  Just not this one.

Bar service not too great. One man in particular. Dirty blonde hair, looks about 40. I work with clients/customers daily, and no matter what mood I am in, my goal is to make every single one of them happy. Even if it was an un happy client that came from another counter of the same brand, that had a bad experience there, I'm always trying to make them happier than they arrived.Hostesses were nice though.

Terrible. I'm not sure if it's because the mall itself is new which can only mean new employees with less experience in the service industry, but this establishment needs a lot of work service wise.  My friend and I decided to try the new CPK and it was a plus to drive out to this new location to browse the shops and see what this place had to offer. We checked in with a lady at the front and she told us our wait would be at least 60 to 75 minutes. Luckily we weren't very hungry at the time, so we didn't really mind. She took down my name and number and said I would receive a text when our table was ready.  What put me off at first was seeing all the open and clean tables in the outside seating area (visible from the mall/walkway near the shops). If there were so many open tables, why was our wait so long? Well, whatever. My friend and I looked through a few shops then decided to just sit and wait until I got the text. The total amount of time we waited was 90 minutes.  When we were seated, to my surprise, there was about 5-6 empty & clean tables inside! This annoyed me a bit. It took about 10 mins for someone to acknowledge us. By this time, my friend and I had already decided what we wanted to order. Our server finally came over and introduced herself and she took our order. Our waters took another 10 minutes, served by someone who wasn't even our server. Throughout our whole dining experience, we saw our server 3 times. Once to take our order, once for us to ask for (what I thought was complimentary, at least it was at other locations) bread/butter, and at the end of meal for our check. Everything else including receiving our entrees, taking away our plates were from all various people.  I understand that a lot of restaurants don't have one specific server or that you'll have many different servers/food runners, but what really put me off was seeing employees- employees who were on the clock- sit down at what at first looked like customer's tables, eating off their plates, sharing food. I can only assume it was an employee who came in on his time off to eat dinner there and his friends/coworkers were stopping by periodically to sit down, chit chat, and eat. I thought this was extremely unprofessional, but that's just me.  Waiting 90 minutes for the service we got? I'll pass and probably never return to this location again.

I arrived at CPK at 7:45 Saturday November 5th; sat at the bar for dinner & drinks. The bartender A.J. was very friendly, polite and excellent. At 8 pm I ordered a small dinner, at 8:20 A.J. went to the kitchen to find out where my dinner was. He came back and told me they were "plating" my food and it will be brought out in a minute. I sat there and waited......and waited....... At 8:35 pm I told A.J. to cash me out for my 2 beers. As he was doing that my food arrived. I was already standing and waiting to pay. I gave a $10.00 tip for 2 beers since A.J. was excellent. I then asked to speak to the manager. Patrick came behind the bar and asked me "what"... I told him I waited 35 minutes for a chicken dinner and he told me I can take my food "to-go". I informed him I am staying next door at the hotel and I eat dinners in restaurants not hotel rooms. Patrick then turned around and walked away. As soon as he thought I wasn't going to be a regular he couldn't care less. I guess he doesn't realize that this was my 3rd time this week at CPK and I spend 15 weeks per year on business in Kapolei. He is a TERRIBLE manager that has no respect for his customers.

The wait time is ridiculous. You would think with all the open seats the wait time wouldn't be so bad but just the opposite. 30 to 40 minute wait time and not to mention 5 parties left during the wait time and still it's overly long. The hostesses give you a long wait time in hopes you choose not to wait. We ate here early during the week and as we entered you had 5 employees at the front doing nothing but talking etc. Just terrible.

This is the slowest CPK I've been to. We had to wait 20 minutes to be seated even though they just opened and there were a lot of open tables.We had a great waitress came back to refill drinks, ask if we wanted more bread but waited over 30 minutes for our food and they weren't even full. We ordered flatbread pizza, cup of soup, pizza and a kids pasta meal. We were waiting for the kids meal. What a disappointment! As you can see from the picture where is the Alfredo sauce for the kids pasta I asked for more sauce they told me another 5 minutes how ridiculous is that and it took 10 minutes. We were late for a movie because they took TOO LONG

Great place. Better than the PC location. The food taste better. It was crowded the night I went, but the bar area was open. The bartender Sandy was great. We enjoyed it. Looking forward to having dinner their the evening of my birthday.

Tried out the new CPK and it was very busy.  We placed our names on the list and were told it would be 2 hrs but they took my number down to text me when the table was ready.  To our surprise it took less than an hour and I had to rush my family back as they were busy shopping sort of upset that it was so soon!  Really??! It was my wife and two teenage daughters, go figure! The service was prompt even though it was busy.  They must have had 4 different people help from the person who sat us to the person who took our drink order, the runners, and our waitress.  It was especially busy because they were honoring Veterans with free meals which I took advantage of by ordering the Italian chopped salad.  We also had a new item which was a mushroom pasta dish that was outstanding.  Our daughters had the salad and club sandwiches.   We took advantage of the gift card promo where you buy $100 GC and get a $30 GC to spend before January.  Too easy!  When I got the bill they had added the $200 GC to it but I was smart enough to only tip for our meal not the $56 that was recommended!  Not complaining but they should have done it separately.  Overall the restaurant is very nice and food was good.  Thank you to CPK for honoring the Veterans!

When we arrived we were told the wait would be 2 hours for a party of three, since it was only 4 pm we said okay and proceeded to walk around the mall until we got the text to come back. Upon walking in there were 7 tables around us opened. When we FINALLY got seated we immediately ordered a appetizer and our meals. 30 mins later we see multiple artichoke dips come out and being served to the tables around us! When we clearly came first and ordered first... finally we get our appetizer after asking the server about it. About 20 more mins until our meals came, but here's the best part- we don't have any utensils on the table!! We sit there for 10 mins after asking 3 different employees for utensils and a extra plate for sharing-by the way we haven't seen our server since she checked on where our appetizer was! Finally we get utensils but no extra plate! My mom was forced to use the plate the  appetizer came in because no one was helping us at all. While eating our waters ran out and they only got refilled when I walked up to the kitchen with the empty glasses asking for a refill of water. Again our server is not seen anywhere until the end of the night when she hands us the check. I get that it's a new location but they need to work on their service big time

Two stars because of the wait and service. I mean okay, I know I should give it a rest because its a new location but when you know there's Iike 10 tables open and your party waited for over an hour, there's definitely a setback in the service line. Which could expain why the "drink" server served a spilling Moscow Mule and still handed it over the table, from the opposite end. Of course another server dropped a glass wine on the floor that cracked. Idk, it just seemed like this location is ran by employees with very little to no experience. Other than that the food tasted the same and our waitress was friendly.

I LOVE IT HERE....Okay if your going to eat and shop.  I suggest put your name in first at CPK for dining wait is kinda long.  BUT they text you when your table is ready.  Food and drinks are on point.  CARAMEL SALTED PUDDING...My favoritest I start with it first and a sangria flight.  The BAR Staff are the BOMB...Eva the Bar Mgr is awesome and friendly...

Food was excellent but most importantly our server RAIN was the bomb, made me and my kids feel so comfortable she gave the kids play doh to play with and also sent us home with some. Wish to have her next time again. Thanks RAIN
The service was great. They frequently checked on how I was doing. I also didn't like a drink I ordered, and they brought me out a different one!

I'm giving this location a 5 star review because of the impeccable service, cleanliness of the restaurant and how delicious everything was, not to mention how reasonably priced the items on the menu were and how quickly and efficiently the servers were with bringing the bread, drinks and entrees to our table. My husband and I decided to have lunch after an appointment for our daughter. Because California Pizza Kitchen has been so busy we haven't had a chance to check out the New Location but thought now is the perfect time. 20mins before they opened for lunch at 11 there was already a line formed outside the door (luckily everyone was seated very quickly) and man is this location's atmosphere just perfect. Trendy yet warm decor, very spacious and comfortable seating and I love how knowledgeable the staff was.  Our waitress Alice was outstanding!!!! Seriously, if you decide to go make sure you request to sit in her section! She exceeded our expectations and than some. She knew the menu and knew exactly what to recommend (I mentioned my favorite drink that they no longer offer and she recommended an alternative that would be even better! And it was! She also mentioned to my husband that he could get Half of the pizza he normally orders and Half of another pizza he really wanted to try, which worked out perfectly. He loved that idea and has now found another favorite thanks to Alice!) she also payed attention to the little things also like bringing more bread over when we finished or offering more water when finished with our drinks and just the overall attentiveness with bringing what we needed when we needed it!  We ordered the Jambalaya Fettuccini and the half & half Hawaiian and Carne Asada Pizza! Everything was so good! I can not wait to go back!

Our experience at this CPK location has to be the best we ever had! Service was amazing, food was delicious, and the vibes were so good! The interior of this locations is the prettiest I've ever seen (comparing to locations in Las Vegas). It's modern, CLEAN, and well spaced which is awesome when you have a little one! Our server was so sweet and well mannered! She took our order for the Spinach Artichoke Dip (YUM YUM YUUUUUUM) and offered a side of pita bread with it. The pita bread was way too doughy for our liking but the dip with the chips was absolutely irresistible. We ordered our dinner, the tomato basil pizza, and my husband our daughter and I were in HEAVEN! With a little salt and pepper and some red chili flakes (which were actually spicy [yay]) that bad boy was one for the books! Our drinks were made perfect, our food was made perfect (minus the pita), our server was perfect, and the atmosphere was perfect. Overall I'd say this CPK is.... perfect :D

Aside from the delicious tasty food, the service and staff are always friendly, presentable, and on their game!  We eat here at least twice a week and never a let down on our overall experience. Servers had was Shae, Pepples "Brit", Leka, and more but just to name a few. Very personable and very attentive.  Thank you CPK Kapolei and staff for continuously excelling with food, service, and atmosphere.

I love CPK but the Kapolei location has slow service. After waiting 50 minutes for a seat - we had to wait another 20 minutes for someone to take our drink/food order. Maybe they're understaffed? The food was really good tho.

I don't usually review chain restaurants, but I had to for the fact that I've seen so many reviews of this place with people complaining about the wait time or how slow the service is... ITS BRAND NEW, WHAT DO YOU EXPECT? Whenever something new on Oahu opens, it's always busy... get over it or go somewhere else if you don't want to wait! Never had a bad experience at a CPK so I was pleased eating here! It's pretty big and the set up of this CPK is really nice! The bar is pretty big and had a nice set up as well! The service is very friendly and welcoming! And they're doing a great job for it being brand new!! Keep up the good work and don't let these idiot complainers bother you!

Arrived around 3pm this afternoon for Linner with my family and girl friend.  We were seated right away and greeted with our waitress Ki (? Sorry if this incorrect). She took our drink orders right away and we received our drinks with in a 10 min span.  It was enough time to review the menu, however I already knew prior to arriving what I wanted.   I ordered the kids cheese pizza for my son,  and the Mahi Mahi Tacos for myself. I really enjoyed the tacos at both the Kahala Pearlridge locations and wanted to see if Ka Makana Ali'is location would follow suite. Which it did.... *happy dance* My boyfriend and friend both had pasta dishes which from what I could tell they both enjoyed.  At the end of our meals we had ordered the kids sundae for my son and of course we had to have the butter cake. My boyfriend enjoyed the Sunday (haha) and well, I wasn't super thrilled about the butter cake. It was unusually dense and heavy but none the less it was still good.  Our waitress was attentive and was pretty on it with refilling our drinks or asking if we would like to a refill on our drinks. That is always a plus in my book.  Keep up the good work CPK at Ka Makana Alii

Went once to another location years ago and didnt like it at all...decided to take my wife for lunch earlier and WOW...great food...great service...glad i gave it another shot...ill be a regular for a while im sure.

Had dinner with friends there last week.  Waitress was obviously brand new as she never gave us the bread after taking our orders.  She also never gave us water so we had to ask for both items.  I understand this CPK just opened recently but the manager needs to ensure the wait staff realize that regular CPK customers expect the usual CPK service.  Food arrived at a decent time but service needed some work.  Btw, food was good overall.

First of I'm glad they opened a CPK close to my home. I was tired of driving to Pearlridge but the service there was awesome. Anyways, first time in CPK Kapolei and let me tell you, wow this place is huge and spacious. Open floor plan of say. There was the four of us and the wait was 45 mins...... kinda expected that since it's fairly new and it was a Sunday night. My friends and I didn't mind, they said they will text us when our table is ready. So we decided to walk around the new Ka Makana Alii mall and just see what new shops were still opening and of course guessing where the new store for my job was going to be. Within 30 mins we got a text saying our table was ready. Once we got in, two girls we're in the front and they just stared at us.....expecting us to say something first. I'm sorry but if a customer walks in, proper greeting is "hi welcome what brings you in today". So there wasn't any greeting at all even though we put our name down 30mins ago. So my other half said kinda loudly, we got a text from you guys saying our table was ready. Girl looked at us again and then said oh let me check and your name was? She said oh ok got it. "Thinking to myself, weren't you the one who took our name down in the beginning" keyword="memory" Anyways besides that we sat down in our booth. I'm so going to hate myself but I don't remember the servers name and to tell you this she was awesome. Very friendly and fast service. Also, another thing that's different from other CPK I feel like the food portion got a little bigger and the taste was different in a good way. Usually I order chicken piccata and I would eat it but I couldn't and had to take it home for the first time.  Another opportunity that the management could do is to train hostess/host properly and respectively and professional. Also, other CPK usually have there managers walk around each table to greet and see if customers were doing ok. But none came to our table.
