As a yelper, hopefully this helps to make the company better and grow and of course I'll probably be a regular here since I live close and I will be working in the mall soon as soon as our store is open.

My friend and I came here on a Wednesday night. The wait was about 20 minutes long so we walked around. When we got back, we were seated at a nice booth. We waited a little and got helped. Our waitress was Chayna. She was great, very attentive, and always kelt pur drinks refilled. The atmosphere was modern, I liked it a lot! We ordered our food, our appetizers took a little long but by the time we got it our food had came out 2 minutes after. It gave us little time to enjoy our appetizers but Im not complaining. Food was great, server was great, but felt like something was missing. It was a great experience though. Will definitely return when the mall is more up and going!

It's great that Kapolei is developing and there are more places to eat.  Since California Pizza was the one only operating restaurant at Kamakana Ali'i with alcoholic drinks we decided to come here instead of driving somewhere else.   I am not a fan of the food.  Never really cared... The review is mostly for the service which was very disappointing.  I know this is not 5 star fine dining but the experience was so awful for us I really don't care to come back.   I have been here 2 times since they open.  First time we came here as a party of 3 for late lunch on a weekday.  Wait time seating was about 30-40 minutes.  Our waitress was nice.  I had really bad heartburn from the drinks and food. Second time we came here as a party of 3 with my toddler on a Friday night.  The wait was about 20 minutes so we decided to dine here.  It's cool they incorporate texting when your table is ready, but maybe it was a mistake because the front desk seem to question if our table was ready.  They gave us a very small table outside which only had 2 chairs.  I told them my daughter did not need a high chair so they brought us another chair.  Our table didn't have utensil.   I figure they will give it later.  We got our lettuce wrap appetizer,  but still didn't get our utensils.  I had to ask for our utensils and it didn't come right away.  We finally got the rest of our food, but it was crowded on our small table.   We were eating and I saw our waitress so I ask for more lettuce.  We waited.  I saw her attending to other tables.  We were pretty much finish with our meal and the waitress did not come back!  I had drank all my water and started to drink my fiancé water.  She still didn't come back.   I talk to the manager about our waitress attentiveness.  The waitress finally came back with wet lettuce and an extra glass of water.   Now I know being a waitress can be stressful and busy.  Maybe she avoided our table because I have a toddler and my daughter was yelling for food or maybe the wait for our food was long.  The waitress seem fake and not sincere after my complaint.  I don't' think she gets customer service.  She needs to be retrained or consider another job!  I can only hope this establishment can improve in customer service.  BTW I didn't ask for a comp and I did warn the manager of this Yelp posting!

Food was great but our server was not. I get it, new restaurant, new servers, kinks are still being worked out, so I won't mention her name.  For most of the time she was MIA.  She did not offer us bread, so after 20 minutes I asked another server if they still offered bread, she said yes and told our server we would like some. Took her another 5 minutes to bring it. She got my order wrong so the rest of my family ate while I waited, at least I had soup. The manager came over and apologized so that was nice. A different server brought my corrected order over and she apologized as well so I asked her if she thinks the manager will comp us a dessert, she said I'll send him over. He came back over and without me saying a word he said I'm taking care of your pizza and your dessert when you're ready, PLUS he handed me a $15 gift card for next time! Now that's great Management! I had to wait quite a while for my check and when she finally brought it it had my wrong order on it so I had to wait even longer for her to correct it. I still tipped her about 12%, because like I said earlier, I get it.  We all start somewhere.

Not sure what it is about this location. Even when it doesn't seem that busy, the wait for food takes a while. On top of that my pasta arrived on the cold side so the cheese in it began to solidify and I was eating wads of salty cheese in my pasta. I really don't like sending dishes back but unfortunately I ended up sending mines back. It just doesn't make sense to me why my pasta should arrive cold if it's not that busy. The manager was extremely nice and took good care of us but it's still a bit disappointing.

Honestly i've never been here but wow, service was incredible, our waitress Bray was awesome she got our drinks fast, we got our food fast and she took away al the plates fast, best service we've seen in awhile, food was really good and one of the best expierences I have gotten. Come here super good !

Overall I like CPK's menu, although the food is a bit pricey for the quality. However, it's a nice place to go with family and friends. Unfortunately ALL of them are crazy crowded (especially at peak hours) and the Kapolei one is no different.  There is absolutely no way I'm waiting an hour or two on a weekend night but I was lucky enough to stop by on a weekday during lunch. No crowd, no wait.  The food was as expected but I'm writing this review because we received excellent service. 5 stars - they only get 4 stars overall because of the usual crazy wait times and average food. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive and there was someone else, a manager maybe, who kept coming to check on us and made some good menu recommendations.  It just felt like they really wanted us to have a good time and enjoy our food. I was actually surprised because I've never had service like that at a CPK. The others are not bad... just not this good. Kudos to Kapolei CPK and their staff. I hope this lasts and isn't just because they're a new location.

This comment goes to "Amber" who was an fantastic server.  My fiancée and I don't get to eat out to often due to our work schedule. We decided to squeeze in a lunch date before he headed out to work. We were seated right away , and Amber introduced herself and talked about th best sellers and what drinks are good.  We started with 2 appetizers, which she recommended and I got the a pizza that started with a M and my fiancée got a pasta. The appetizers came out faster then we both expected and the flat bread was delicious.  Amber made sure we got all the right food, and asked us if we were okay and refilled our drinks promptly. She also talked about the decor and how it all is sophisticated. I really enjoyed talking to her. Thank you CPK for an amazing lunch and thank you Amber for your kindness and sincerity   Hope to see you again!

I met my two classmates for a mini reunion dinner at the recently opened California Pizza Kitchen.  It was a busy Saturday evening and the Ka Makana Ali'i Mall was filled with myriads of people celebrating the holiday season. I put our name in for seating and was informed it would be an estimated 50-minute wait.  They will get your name and phone number and text you when the next available table is open. That was fine with us, because we had a lot of catching up to do.  To our surprise our wait was just 40-minutes. Our waitress gave us our menus.  As we glanced around we all decided that this CPK is the largest on the island.  We enjoyed the appetizer of the bread with oil and balsamic vinegar.  Next, we ordered our dinner.  One of my friends really enjoyed her half-order of Thai Chicken Salad and her Roasted Garlic Chicken with Seasonal vegetables.  She liked the crunch and spiciness of her chicken salad.  She also mentioned that the Chicken was moist.  It was the first time for her to have brussel sprouts and she said it was similar to a mini cabbage.  My other friend ordered the half order of Ceasar Salad and she enjoyed it.  I purchased the Cedar Plank Salmon.  It was flavorful and it was unique that they served it on an actual charred plank on your plate.  I've had better Cedar Plank salmons before though.  In my opinion the serving size was small for the price.  It wasn't as succulent as the one as I had before, that was homemade on a grill. The succotash was delicious, though. All in all, our service was wonderful.  We all asked for separate checks and the waitress was very accommodating.  She even took photos of us on all of our cell phones at the end of our meals. She also was pleasant when we asked for take home boxes and packages for our leftovers. The food was good. My friends said their serving portions were fine and it was tasty.  I wanted a bigger salmon for the price.  Lastly, the ambiance was great for reuniting with my classmates.

The food here is good and the location is even better. The service is good especially the managers, their customer service is amazing. They are very understanding and accommodating to your needs, my rewards card wasn't working and I had already missed $100 worth of points. Luckily for me I called and spoke with the manager Patrick, he apologized and let the ones  in charge know about my card. Within 2 days he was able to resolve the situation. Will be back for the great service.

Dined here last night for the first time. They have a new system where they take your phone number and text you when your table is ready. There were 5 hosts at the host stand and they were playing around so as she tried to take my number down she kept getting it wrong so I told her I'd just sit on the bench next to the host stand since it would only be 10 minutes.  20 minutes went by and a number of parties were sat so I decided to check on my place and she told me that she had attempted to call me but no reply. Although I had been sitting literally 2 feet away from her the entire time.  Another host intervened and was able to have her seat us immediately but upon seating us to our table the same host developed an attitude and felt she needed to let us know how we were at fault for waiting longer. For that, I had addressed her about her unprofessional behavior and lack of customer service at that point.  Our table was right by the bar so our view was of the host stand. So I watched her walk back and gossip to the other hosts about our table. Thus I felt that a manager needed to be notified of the situation. I am a frequent diner at CPK and have always had the best customer service experience when dinning here. So the behavior witnessed tonight was appalling and definitely ruined our experience overall since your first interaction upon entering the restaurant is with the hosts.  The manager was apologetic and I know she was not fault for their actions. But she did the best she could hearing our concerns to rectify the situation.

We tried to make a reservation a couple days ago being that we had a party of 18 coming in at 7pm.  They didn't take our reservation but they did say to come in early to put our name down. I arrived at 530 to put down our names- in hopes of being sat at 7. The hostesses in the front were very pleasant. They asked for my number so they could text me when a table would be ready and they informed me that they could only place us outside on the patio because we had a large party. Which was totally fine! At 645 I got a text saying that it would be an additional 20 minutes for a table to be ready. We didn't actually get sat til 730.  Because we were waiting long we asked the servers if we could start ordering already. They took our drink orders and appetizers. There were two servers serving our party. Our drinks came out okay, our appetizers took a while. Half of our table didn't get our appetizers or our salads. We ordered a chicken Waldorf salad with extra walnuts. When we finally got our salad, there was no CHICKEN or extra walnuts. So we asked if we could just get it on the side which they did bring out (I'll get back to that in a bit).  Most of the salads and appetizers came out after we received our entrees.  I finally got my pasta and as I was eating it I noticed a long hair entwined in my pasta. I asked to get a new one which they brought out. By the time all the food came out we were pretty frustrated with all that went on in our dining experience. Being that we are all servers ourselves we tried to be understanding. I don't usually like to come on yelp to write bad reviews but too much went on that we had to say something. We asked for boxes and they asked us if we wanted to order dessert. A couple of us decided to eat dessert so we ordered the butter cake with ice cream! YUM! BUTTT, when the butter cake came out it was COLD! The servers came around to give us our checks (we did separate checks) and when we got OURS, we got charged for that chicken ok the Waldorf salad even though it came with it. By that point we were frustrated so we asked to speak to a manager. We told the manager what had happened and she was surprised that we waited til the last minute to say something. We just told her that we really didn't wanna complain cause we know how it is as servers. She did talk to the servers from our table and she was apologetic! So these stars are there just for the manager! She fixed all of our checks.  We love coming to CPK! But we'll probably wait a while to come to this location.

Waited for 20 mins and no one came to check on us, give water or take order. My first time and very disappointed. They put us on the end and no one dared to atleast give water. My kids were very hungry and frustrated. Servers kept looking at us. They served breads & waters to those who just came, seen two tables like that. Out of frustration, we just walked out. Yaaayyy will never come here ever again.

Me and my church friends came here right after my baptism, One other friend and myself had a lei, so our waitress asked if we were graduating or something and we said no we just got baptized, she replied "oh... cooool."  Mildly enthusiastically. Besides that she took our orders right away but the food took a long time to come. Four of us out of six got their food at the same time however I had to wait at least 20 more minutes after that, and the last one of us had to wait even longer,  thus we notified our server that it was taking a long time she said oh sorry. And continued to do whatever it was. Eventually the last one of us got our food mind you was ONLY avocado eggrolls. The manager came out and apologized saying she would take the eggrolls off the bill which she did. However our waitress disappeared pretty much for the rest of the night. She took a long time to clear our plates and give us a dessert menu. Then she took forever to bring the desserts, and also another forever to give us our bill. I really don't feel bad for tipping her she seemed very unenthusiastic to be our waitress. I have no idea what she was doing in the meantime but she never seemed too busy. I know this restaurant recently opened but still I don't think I would give them another chance. I would rather go to the cpk in Pearl Ridge that has much more attentive stuff and Way closer to home.

Wait time was super long. But getting a text to your phone when your table is ready was cool. Super convenient too so you can still walk around the mall and shop while you wait. Also I think they forgot to bring me my food. Everyone was almost done eating by the time I got my food. And when they finally brought it, it was cold. I know they're pretty knew so not gonna complain too much. I'm sure once they get used to things it will be much better.

This place is okay.  I'm glad that I didn't have to wait 90 mins to eat though or I would have been saddened. We got here on a Sunday around 1.  We waited about 30 mins for a table. We ordered the dumplings for an appetizer.  I had some kind of seasonal hand rolled pasta with crimini mushrooms.  My husband had the kung pao pasta and we ordered the kids mac and cheese for my son. The dumplings were pretty good.  They didn't look that appetizing, but they had a good flavor.  My son even enjoyed them. My pasta was amazeballs.  The flavor was on point and the mushrooms were perfectly sautéed.  My husband's kung pao pasta was pretty good.  Tasted just like it sounds.  There was a good kick, but not too much as my son ate some of it no problem. My sons mac and cheese was lame.  Boxed and cheese would have been better.  Not getting that again. We ordered the butter cake because it just sounds amazing.  And it was.  It was very moist.  We didn't get ice cream with it but it probably would have been a foodgasm if we did.  I would say that it tastes just like those Dansk cookies, but better.  The one with the little crystals of sugar on top of it.  Yummy. I think I would come back again, but probably not for a while.  There are so many other places to try in Ka Makana Alii.

I used to LOVE CPK!  I've been coming to CPK for almost 20 years!  I started i Los Angeles and moved back to Hawaii, and the Pearlridge and Kahala restaurants are wonderful!  Perhaps this one is so new it's adjusting.  We arrived and there were clearly seats inside and out but we had to wait 30-45 minutes.  We then were seated and waited another 25 minutes for our drinks.  They messed up on our order, not once but 3 times!  Lol!  They switched servers on us in the middle Of dinner so we had to explains things all over and there were no apologies.  There were a ton a workers working so I'm not sure if they just weren't managed properly or riding off of the CPK name. The restaurant looked good but clearly needs better management.

Now before you say, four stars, you just went there and waiting forever, I agree completely, but we will get to that last.  Upon being sat, we were brought water straight away, and our drink orders taken.  1 point in basic restuarant service.  Then not long after, but long enough to review the menu, our server returned and took our orders and asked how to align the biill as we were a table of eight.  We did/four and four.  The apps came out in good time, and hot and were rather good, and our food was not far behind.  We had pasta's and pizza's (they had a nice crust) and salads.  All were please, but with the BBQ Chicken salad it had the nice flavor but the ratio of chips to lettuce, lead you to think you had ordered nachos - too many chips and not enough lettuce. We had our water and bar drinks refreshed  - 2 points.  Now its time to talk about the wait.  The manager has been to our table twice as we have dined there three times, so we know she cares.  Tonight the issue was being short wait staff or proper utilization of wait staff.  There were no less than 12 -14 tables open and in the bar, the seats around the bar, more than 70% of those were empty.  When you are told you have to wait 30 minutes and it turns to 50 minutes + and the empties are staring at you, it's clear you have staffing issues.  So, we went to the bar, no seats, (and there were children "at" the bar") so we stood, and ordered alochol drinks $$, and when we notice the booths were not being filled sat with our drinks but were told to stand despite the booths were not being filled.  If you can't fill dining room and outdoor tables, then let the bar booths be for drinks only, no food, as you will sell ($$$) drinks to waiting people. We stood and the booths still remained mostly empty. Will we go back, yes, the food and staff are good and its 10 minutes from our house.  Pleaseeee work to over come the phrase you can build it in Ewa but it's still Ewa.  It's so great to have jobs, stores and restuarants in Ewa and Kapolei and we will support them always, lets work to support these businesses and encourage them to be the best they can be.

Horrible service! We were told that it was 1hr wait so we got there at 6:30 and she told us we will be seated by 7:30 or 7:45. We walked around the mall for a bit it and by 7:45 we got a text saying it will another 20mins wait to have tables available. We were seated at 8:05 she took our order at about 8:10 & didn't get our water and bread til 8:30 then she came back saying that one of our the things we ordered was unavailable and to take a look at the menu again. Then 8:45 she took our order again then waited a little bit more and by that time it was already 9:05 she kept saying sorry that she was overwhelmed but we just told her sorry but we've been waiting too long and walked out, by 9:20. Overall I wouldn't come back to the CPK in Kapolei. I would definitely go to the Pearlridge or Alamoana location.

Don't bother unless you have three or more hours of your life to waste waiting. The wait for a table is ridiculous and don't think that take out is any better. As I type, I have been waiting 40 minutes on my take out order of spinach artichoke dip and a pepperoni pizza. Yeah, a freakin' pizza!! If this wasn't for my daughter, I would have taken off long ago. My true rating is zero stars but I have to choose at least one star for this crap hole.

The first time that I dined at this restaurant there was not issue.  Waited about an hour to be seated, but their estimated wait time was accurate.  The second time was an entirely different story.  Wait time was estimated at around 2 hours, which was kinda of weird since there were about 8 tables open in the out door seating area.  Waited about an hour and came back and the outdoor seating area still had an abundance of open tables.  Proceeded to as how much longer was the wait.........another hour.  Left and ate somewhere else.  Who ever is in charge of the seating is not doing a good job.  The wait times are way too long to have so many open seats.

45 minute wait...got sat waited for server for 10 minutes. In that 10 minutes saw about 5 different servers and waiters. No one waited on us. Walked out and won't be back. They are going to be in big trouble when more places open in the mall.

Do not go there!!!!!! If there's a choice of no star, that would be it. The others Yelp reviews are true, Host lack tack but also had an extreme attitude problem! Do not ever dine there!!!! Unless u want to be treated poorly!  The first dinning experience is the host-they will make or break ur restaurant experience.....those youngsters should stay within their means and go work at a fast food restaurant such as The Golden Arches......jacks or Ronald's place. Poor host service!

I gave this NEW CPK A ONE STAR due to the fact that we didn't even make inside to eat!! At first, they told us, it was a two hour wait so we waited and waited and waited!! About an one and a half hour into it, I ask the hostess, "how long more?" since I've been seeing people who JUST arrived go in before us and was rudely answered, "well it's been only an hour and half since you arrived, you have another 40 mins left till our two hour wait." And I said "NO THANKS!!!" I was thinking to myself, we have two hungry kids who have been waiting, cranky and hungry and you saying we have 40 mins more?!? So we cancelled and ate at LUI BUENOS instead. BEST DECISION I MADE!! I'm not sure if I wanna chance trying to eat there again but they LOST my business. BEWARE IF YOU WANNA EAT HERE BE WILLING TO WAIT TWO HOURS, so if you got two hours to spare then this is the place to be.. And they DON'T TAKE RESERVATIONS FYI..

Been there 2x when it first opened, sat at the bar both times and am giving them the thumbs up! Sure, people are crazy to wait for over an hour to eat here, and it is not worth it, but it is consistent and good. They weren't perfect (forgot flat bread 2nd time we went) and brought it out super late, but comp'd it. bartender is so nice and friendly, I think her name is Crystal? Anyways, the food is regular CPK, there is nothing special about this location, except it is new and clean. They are trying their best and I think it is one of the better, newly established eating places in Kapolei. Not only for the food, but you can tell they train their staff better than other places. That goes a long way with me and am willing to go back if you can see the effort. I have been trying all these other new places in Kapolei to eat and they have not been very good experiences so far. Everyone has their challenges but I felt like this place already had shown they are committed to providing good service and good food. I will be back on the regular.

The wait time for dinner every time we went is just ridiculous no matter what day you go.  Cancelled 4 times now and ended up eating somewhere else.  And yes there was at least 5 tables open that no one was seated at when we got there and even after we cancelled.  We won't waste anymore time and choose a different place from the start instead.  It sucks cause we like CPK.

This was my first ever experience at this CPK in the new Ka Makana Ali'i mall, though I've been to other CPK locations around the island. I checked in, gave the hostess my name and cell phone number, and was notified by text 20 minutes afterwards that my table for two was ready. That system was convenient as my friend and I strolled through the mall to kill time. Upon entering the restaurant to be seated, I was taken aback by the roominess of dining area at this particular CPK, though, the openness made the dining atmosphere very loud. Overall, the food was great and our server was very attentive to our needs. I do hope this location can keep up its great food and service.

Took the kids here for dinner last night, thanks to my brother and two $25 gift cards.  Obviously, brand spanking new location, so looked great.  Unfortunately, it was Friday and we had to wait 50-minutes for a table. It was cold out (for a Hawaii evening), so we preferred a table inside.  We, of course, ended up with a table outside.  That said, we scored with a polite and timely server, and someone who understood the importance of keeping the drinks full.  Quite happy. We ordered chips with spinach dip for about $13, and my son and I ordered two iterations of pizza...the barbeque chicken and the wild mushroom.  My daughter had fettuccine, and we all had iced teas.  All told, came to $68, $80 with tip (generous, I know). I'll definitely come back.  Long wait, yes, but great food and great service!

First time visiting this restaurant. Was greeted at the door immediately. After being sat the hostess came to our table and was very attentive. Food and drinks came immediately. Very large portions and nice flavors. Great dinner.

Our first time here since opening, my pregnant wife and in came on our date night yesterday evening to celebrate. We anticipated long wait times because they were busy so we simply walked around. When we received the text that our table was ready we went in. There were a plethora of inside open tables and seating at the bar tables. Instead we were sat 1 of 3 parties outside patio. We sat there with menus for exactly 7 minutes before we were greeted by our patio server (female) and gave our drink order and appetizer. From that point it took another 5 minutes or more to get those first opening beverages on our table. I know the CPK policy is 2 min for specialty or bar drinks and less than a minute for regular beverages. We were still drink less when the manager came by some time after we gave the app order to inform us that the crispy ahi app was sold out, he made no mention of our drinks. The bread she choose to serve us was hard and crouton like.  We placed our regular order in with her and requested a fresher bread when it was ready. That came only just before our dinner meal of 20min arrived ( which wasn't too bad for dinner at a new place) we saw our server 3 times until the end of the meal. 1) greeting and drinks/ app  2.) ordered dinner 3) towards the end of our meal to ask us how everything was when we requested the check.   Meanwhile two others were nice and assisted us to change my husbands Diet Coke order from regular coke and kept my refills steady, got us peppers for our pizza, etc...  I was thoroughly annoyed with our current server. At the time we got our dinner she had us and one family trying to cash out. Then it was just us, and  while we were eating our dinner some younger guy probably a busser or host informed us that he was locking the inside door so we had to go out the gate to leave. Which is fine if we were done with our meal but we still need to use the bathroom and it's pretty unprofessional to inform the guests that they can't come in through the restaurant while they are still eating dinner. I believe it to be an uninformed worker, he wasn't rude. Just trying to do his job.  Our dinner was tasty, but not quite up to Pearlridge in food quality. My pizza was cut badly, one piece was so pieces and I had two tiny slices, then one was just enormous. My wife thought her pizza was pretty good just not as good as Pearlridge. We had a 10:30pm movie to catch next door so we asked for the bill. Our server packed one pizza away and left. My wife's pizza remained unboxed and we sat there waiting for a grand total of 15min to receive our check to go! My wife went inside through the server entrance to use the bathroom and the server was first just hanging out by the counter. And another just cruising on her phone. She told me she asked where our server was because we needed a box and our check and that we had s movie to go to. Instead of the other servers just bringing a box and the check, which I know they can do through the type of system they use. They went searching for our server who was no where to be found. Seemed like she forgot about us and was doing her closing duties. This is insane, can't handle one table? Your turn around table rate is so slow, which jacks up the waitlist. Because there is not enough adequately train your staff or hire those with not much service background. When she finally arrived we left as quickly as we can. The tip was as scarce as she was to our table unfortunately... new or not the service we received was terrible. We won't be returning to this location for another year or so until we have faith we can get better service and not have to wait long for every portion of the dinner. The one star is due to terrible service and wait times for every portion of the meal.

went last nite and they were packed so we grabbed a seat at the bar. had two lovely bar maids working..sorry we didnt get their names.mom and i had a great time....2 glasses of wine and brussel sprout flat bread wedge salad and zucchini spaghetti...amazing! great time for all...cant wait to come back. thanks for the awesome service

Our party got seated fairly quickly, and our drink orders were fulfilled pretty quickly. But we had to request the balsamic vinegar two times. Apparently they didn't know where it was. We had to wait like 10-15 minutes to even place our food order. By the time we received our food, we'd been seated for at least 40 minutes, and my fettuccine wasn't ready for another 10 minutes. They said the kitchen was backed up. But that doesn't excuse the servers having to be asked by tables to get their checks on multiple occasions. The operation seemed rocky. The servers were nice, but the wait was extremely frustrating, especially with a child.

I've come to this location twice and I've had bad service both times but this review will be mostly on my second visit here. It was a busy Wednesday night and we waited about 50mins to be seated. No server came to our table to help us or even greet us until 15 minutes later. A server, named Chelsea (I think), was kind enough to help us after she had seen us waiting for so long. She took our drink and food orders but our drinks and bread didn't get to our table until about 15-20 minutes later. I appreciate Chelsea trying to help us because we were waiting for so long but it seemed that she was too busy for us. My sister ordered some special mushroom pasta and a cup of soup on the side. A manager (I think) stopped by our table as we were waiting for our food to notify us that the soup that my sister ordered had just run out. My sister was a little bothered especially because we have been waiting for just about everything this night. A few minutes later the manager came by to tell my sister that even the pasta she had ordered also just ran out. My sister was completely frustrated at this point because she made sure they had it when she put in the order, since the last time she came they were also out. The manager offered to exchange the noodles for the dish to something else and my sister agreed to have the dish with fettuccine noodles. Our food came out and my sisters dish did not come with fettuccine noodles.  Overall we were mostly frustrated with the service we received because we were waiting an unusually long time for literally everything. I appreciate the server trying to help us but she was just too busy. It seems that everything else, like running out of certain dishes, just happened at a bad time and of course there is no one to blame for that. I did feel bad for the server because I understood it was a really busy night and some people of my party were being rude because of the service. But overall I think that this could have ended better with a sincere apology from the manager. Of course they apologized to us, but they did not recognize that we had bad service from the beginning until the end. I wish the manager would have spoken to us more and would have apologized about the horrible service rather than just apologizing for my sisters order. This experience makes me not want to come to this location again. I wish the management would look at the bigger picture and realize that either they need to hire more servers and staff or they need to retrain their staff. I feel that our visit today should have had the full attention of the manager, but it didn't, so I wouldn't be surprised if they didn't even care about these Yelp reviews.

I would have given this location a one star, but since the food was good, I guess it deserves two stars. Anyways, my boyfriend and I (along with 2 relatives) ate dinner here and the service was horrible. Our server was extremely nice, but it didn't make up for her inability to check up on how we were doing because we had a few complaints. Firstly, we waited about 30-45 minutes for 2 appetizers to be served; secondly, our spinach artichoke dip was not served to us because the manager served it to the wrong table (don't worry we got a discount on it); and thirdly, we waited for about an HOUR for 2 of our pasta entrees... Throughout the night, the manager was our server because he was the only person that could see us waving our hands for attention. In addition, there were about 3 servers standing around doing nothing behind the counter and one of our relative witnessed two other servers talking in the bathroom.  I'm not too sure about you guys, but I don't think I'll be coming here for awhile.

On new years day, we took my grandma to lunch.  Love how convenient the location is, seeing that Grandma lives in Ewa. No need to fight any traffic and over crowding of people. We waited for about twenty minutes before we were seated, and inside is very spacious.  we ordered Avocado Eggrolls for an appetizer, which came out fairly quickly, never a disappointment those egg rolls YUM. our waitress did mention that it would be a few minutes before any complimentary bread came out as they were still baking, those never came though. It was okay because service was very prompt and we received our Entrees.  I ordered Shrimp Fettuccine, one of the go to's at CPK, i was about Two-thirds through my meal when i noticed a hair in my entree. i know that it is never purposely done, so  i would never get upset about something like that, but i quickly became nauseous as i the thought of me eating almost the whole meal before finding it. I showed to waitress, and she immediately felt remorseful, but don't worry girl, it's no ones fault. She offered to have another one made but I was already full and would feel terribly bad having them make another. A few minutes later i believe we were greeted by the Manager on duty and he also felt bad and offered to comp the meal.   we also ordered a take out dish, for someone who couldn't join us, we ordered the Kung Pao Chicken no peanuts, due to allergies. upon arriving home though with our take put, i realized there was peanuts in the dish. bummer, as we weren't going to chance trying to pick out the peanuts and still consume the meal. Still, mistakes happen we definitely should have checked the dish before leaving the restaurant, so that was a downer.  we still opted to have dessert, after all I absolutely love the butter cake, which was amazing as always.  I love CPK and i love the convenience of the location although it may take me some time to work up an appetite to eat there again.  on the plus side, staff was really attentive and nice, and service was quick, so we still enjoyed ourselves, and we appreciated how professional and caring the staff was towards the mishap. we will surely be back.

By the theatres in Ka Makani Alii, great location with no competition close by at the moment. Smart! Like other CPKs, this one is spacious with lots of tables both inside and outside, plus lots of seats around the bar with big flat screen tvs. Music is a little loud, pounding. Funky lights. Bustling with activity. Quite full on a Saturday noon! All too soon there is a line queued up to get seated. Fascinating to people watch! Love the wild mushroom strozzapreti pasta! It wasn't on the menu, but when I asked about it, my server quickly offered it to me! Great customer service! Also love the crusty bread with olive oil and herb dip as a complimentary starter. Convenient take-out window too.

I would recommend the beehive sangria. It has a nice sweet taste to it. Also the strawberry lime margarita is very good (and very good strong). Our server Justin was really nice and helpful. Coming here again !

I love coming to CPK and this was the first time my boyfriend and I came to the kapolei one. We waited about 2 hours just to be seated but it was busy so we understood. We then got seated and it took our waiter 20min just to take our drink order. Our drinks came 10min later. After waiting for the bread they normally serve, for about 10min more. Still waiting patiently and 35-45min later and we still haven't gotten our food yet. By now everyone around us has gotten there food and left. 50min later we finally got our food and it's not even what we ordered.

CPK is by far, my favorite place to eat pizza & have a few drinks. I decided to check out the new location close to my house out here in Kapolei. I heard it has been busy so I decided to go later in the evening on a Sunday night. Fingers were crossed hoping that it would be slow. I was wrong. The wait time that I was quoted was 1.5 hours. The host who quoted me the wait time was very friendly and happy. She took down my name and cell number and mentioned that I would receive a text once my table was ready. It ended up being only a hour wait so I was pleased.  I love the atmosphere of this location. It is dimly lit with plenty of seating options ranging from tables, booths and bar seating. One thing I was a little unimpressed with was the fact that our waitress switched out mid order. We had no idea until we flagged someone down and asked if someone could take our order. It was then disclosed that we had a new waitress and our initial waitress had "gone home for the night". Otherwise, the food was great and the new sangria (I want to say it was a strawberry flavor) was to die for. I had 5 total !! woot woot! I want to try and hit this joint for lunch and experience a shorter wait time.  Would I recommend this location? Friendly staff, good eats and great atmosphere... of course I would !
Yes!! A taste of home. A place that has good service and food. Thank you for coming to Kapolei!!
Great food, awesome customer service! Shae and Ki were very attentive! He atmosphere is a little loud but just fine for lunch with friends and family.

So I called to order take out...at 7:13pm, I already knew what we all wanted (4people) so we were on the phone maybe 5 minutes tops.  The lady said our order would be ready at 7:50pm...I said thanks and hung up.   So I get there at 7:55pm! The workers behind the counter just continue doing stuff not acknowledging me or anything...couple minutes later she says I'll be right with you, don't even say hi or thanks for waiting...nothing!!! Like seriously...where is the customer service??? Take care your customers especially the ones right in front of you (girl at the take out counter)!!! So it's 8pm now and she says my order is gonna take 15-20 minutes more. Doesn't offer me anything to drink or bread or anything for this issue!!!!  Like wtf!? Get it together!!! I get you're busy on weekends...that's why I decided to order take out an hour ago...to not wait long!!! This is messed up, no customer services skills...so annoying!!!! Never again at this kapolei Cpk!!!

Awesome food and service from our server at the bar Amber. She was very friendly, energetic, and made us feel so welcome. She made sure we were satisfied with our drinks and food. The restaurant was clean and everyone else at the bar had a great attitude. Love this place and their people.

Have eaten here several times since my last review. Service is good. It takes about 45 min to get seated now. If the bar is open, you can sit there and you'll be served like you were sitting at a table (all ages can sit at the bar).  Overall, 5/5. Will eat here again.

3rd edit for yet another bad review! Husband ordered a tostada pizza to-go.  Got home, and they had forgotten to pack the lettuce/tortilla crips toppings...which for those that don't know, is the whole other half of that pizza!  Huge thumbs down! My husband has also called in to order ahead.  He was quoted 30 min.  He arrived a little early so he killed some time walking around the mall.  A little after the half-hour mark, he made his way down to pick up the food.  He then waited another half-hour!  This takes the whole convenience factor away!  Why even call ahead when you are waiting 30 minutes AFTER the original 30 min they told you?!  And they made us wait 1 hr for that tostada pizza that they forgot the topping for!  My poor husband, I couldn't scold him for not checking the order before leaving after he waited that long for bullshit.  You would think if they had an hour to produce an order, they could get that one order right.... WRONG! When will they ever get it together?  Sadly, probably never.  This place is so popular...people will continue to flock here.  I will admit, after all this...all bad reviews being on take-out even (refuse to dine here if take-out can be this bad) ...I still choose to patronize this place!
Place is kinda loud, and food takes some time. It may be because they are a new restaurant in a new mall. But the quality is top notch and comparable to other CPK's.

My first time in this CPK, and i'm disappointed.  The service was slow to the point I wondered why I stayed. Something that was clear is that the staff was not enthusiastic.  Drinks took a very long time to arrive , a menu took even longer.  The food was the bright spot, it tasted good. In general I'm a fan of CPK, but to make matters worse the place was not busy.. Managment needs to get a handle on this.

Went into CPK for an early dinner today.  First off the waitress didn't even know we were one of her tables, the manager had to point it out to her.  I ordered the Chicken Club sandwich.  She bought the bread and olive oil but no plates.  Then when my sandwich came I had to check it twice and there was NO chicken.  I let her know and she apologized.   The kitchen remade my Chicken club sandwich but this time my sandwich was cold.  The chicken was cold like it just came out of the chiller.  There was so much chicken it was hard even eat the sandwich that when I bit into it everything would fall out.   The waitress asked if we wanted dessert and were not even finish eating our food yet.  We said no then she brought the check.   The manager came to the table and ask me "How was your sandwich with the chicken?"  All I could reply was better.  I mean the sandwich is suppose to come with chicken so why would you ask me that.  We couldn't even sign our bill because the waitress didn't even give a pen. Here is a tip CPK please train your managers and staff on customer service.  I used to work in customer service and as a manager that is not someone you ask a customer when the kitchen made an error on a order.  PLEASE RETRAIN YOUR MANAGERS AND STAFF

It's been awhile since we ate at CPK Ka Makana Ali'i, because last time they messed up our order. The times before that the wait times are crazy with empty tables inside. Last time we ordered the Thai chicken pizza, one of our favorites. Instead, we got a pizza with zero toppings. This time I order for my family, I get the main dishes but no sides. So tacos, but no chips or salsa for the chips or for the tacos. We got a kid's meal for my daughter, but we only get the food and not a drink even after specifically ordering fruit punch. When I get there to pick up my order, I have to wait another 10-15 minutes for my incomplete order. The avocado on my mahi-mahi taco still had the brown hard part that connects the avocado to the tree. No idea how that happened. On a positive note, we still really enjoy the menu/food. The service is what needs work.

Saturday at lunchtime: wait was 40 minutes and they text you when ready so you can roam the neighboring stores :) nice touch but don't understand why they don't just take reservations like all the other CPK chains (you can reserve on OpenTable. ) Our waitress Malinda took about 7-8 minutes to get to us but she checked in before and let us know that she would be right with us as she appeared very busy. She was very outgoing and overall a very good server . I ordered the honeybee lemonade--oh so delicious. I had the margarita pizza and it was quite large and thin crust and was very good. My friends also had different types of pizza and everyone was pleased. One person in my party had a pizza that looked slightly charred on the crust and they brought her a brand new pizza (she didn't even complain!) I thought that was a very nice gesture and it really set the tone for the rest of the lunch.  The manager came by to check to see how everything was and we let him know that it was great. Overall the entire lunch took right around an hour and was pleasant. Melinda had no issues separating the checks into three. I will definitely come back. This place has some bad reviews but our experience was nothing but positive.

If I had to pick one chain restaurant to eat at for the rest of my life, I think I could be fine with CPK.  There are enough menu options to keep you constantly entertained.  There is a lot to be said for a consistent dining experience.   That being said I always seem to order the same thing.  Since they took away my miso salad (I have to mention that whenever I can in hopes it will return), the thai crunch 1/2 size with avocado is my fave.  But you pretty much can't go wrong, pizza, pasta, or salad.   Because the west side has been hurting for food options for so long the wait here can be ridiculous.  That being said, go early or off-peak if you're impatient like me.   Service was friendly and food was as expected of a CPK.  Hopefully they will slow down a bit but good for them that they are so successful.

The wait here can be long, but if there is seats at the bar.. that is the best solution! NO WAIT! We ate dinner, drank, and met some cool people around us. AJ and Amber are theeee best! They wrote our names on the back of their tip jar so they'd always remember our name. No matter who was in front of us, they always checked to see how we were doing. I'd definitely just come back to the bar, than waiting for a table. It's more fun!

Went to have dinner tonight since my husband was off today.  There were about 10 tables on the lanai that didn't have anyone occupying them.  So I thought it would be quick.  When I asked the lady at the door how long the wait was.  She said 1.5 hours.  Then I thought well he is off next weekend we can make reservations.  They don't take reservations!  Who runs this location?  They are losing a lot of business having people not eat there because the wait is so long.  Wouldn't you think you would bring on more workers to maximize the amount of customers you anticipate to have on a weekend!
Great bar atmosphere. Extremely attentive bar tenders. AJ is awesome and so is mark. The manager (Kawika) is also super attentive and super awesome. Great food. Def will come back again soon!

This was my first time eating at this beautiful location. The reason it's 4 stars is because of the ridiculous wait time. When my family and I walked in, there were so many open available tables. It could possibly be that they were under staffed but c'mon it's a Saturday night, you know it'll be busy. Our waitress Brittany was really sweet, always smiling, and always checked on us :). Food came out faster than I thought it would. I always order the chicken piccata, it's my favorite!! I'll def. be back since its so close to home as well.
Poor service, food feels been rushed and wasn't good. The waitress seems have way too much to do, she was trying her best an am sure it is not her fault. Bad experianc

Returned recently to this restaurant and I have deleted my previous review as a result. Twice since my initial visit the waitstaff have been attentive and orders arrived promptly. Wait times are manageable and a text alerts you when your table is ready; much better than carrying around a giant 80s pager. Roast halibut is good; I had chicken piccata which was good. The drinks are refilled promptly and the servers are all very efficient now. The mall is still full of empty stores but that is no CPKs fault.
Skyler was a great server !! but the kitchen wasn't was good as it could've been. The manager did everything in his power to make everything better . customer service was very good!
The food at this CPK was better then other locations  (Kahala, Ala Moana). Service was very good. They make sure your food is to your liking.

The food is usually good, but the service has been pretty lackluster. We have gone here probably 10 times since they opened (my inlaws love it here), and each time something happened: our order was forgotten to be put in, our drinks were never refilled, we got the wrong order, they didn't know what to do with our pizza dough rewards so didn't apply it, etc. Once as we waited an hour after ordering to be told that they forgot to put in our order, the manager came by to speak to us and basically said "I'm sorry that happened." She offered no incentive for us to return like most managers do (10%off order, a free dessert, etc.). She's lucky we like the food haha. I really think that the waiting staff might need more training on EVERYTHING. They've gotten a lot better and faster than they were in the beginning though.

Ok.....  Our server is just outstanding. Patrick is an amazing server and he constantly checking up on us. He went up and beyond with our question about the pizza, drinks, and salad. Patrick is awesome

Although we had to wait for awhile, it was not so bad and it was worth the wait. The food was delicious and our waitress was amazing! She did a great job taking care of us and we will definitely be coming back.

We love everything here! The service is fantastic and so is the food.  We usually order an appetizer, a salad and a pizza and share. No complaints at all! Never a bad meal.  The Thai pizza and waldorf salad arevsome of my favorites.

Ok decided to give this place another try again.  Once again for the price you pay on spaghetti still skimping on the amount.  Both the kung pao and chicken tequila fettuccine lacked any chicken pieces.  Imagine just your fist full of noodles.  Also the tequila plate lacked its usual flavor.  We also didn't get any bread unless we asked.  The only good thing was it wasn't busy.  The ahi tuna rolls were ok.  The only flavorful dish was the charred shishito peppers.  Also our waitress Sandra is nice so she made this visit a little more pleasant.  Hated the flying bugs in this place. Should close the front door.  This place needs improvement in their dishes.

My wife went to kapolei today to kill some time.  Went to the new mall and decided to get take out from here for lunch. She said it was a little crowded, but not for the take out side to be so slow.  She waited 10 minutes until someone noticed her, but still ignored her and blew her by.  Long story short she waited and made a order, and took the food home and got the wrong thing.  Especially the drink, which was a bad mistake. She ordered a peach lemonade, but got peach tea (with caffeine) instead. She's pregnant so excessive caffeine isn't something she should be drinking.  Had high hopes for this place, but sadly take out side just doesn't make the cut.  I guess the pearl city and Kahala locations are worth the drive than to go to the one closest to home.

As for the long wait times, I have yet to go to a  CPK that doesn't have a long wait time. That's why I stopped going to the Pearl Ridge location.  On the day we went there was no line which surprised me but I just figured it was because they had just opened this location recently.  The service was good as it is at all the CPK. The quality of the food is good as I remember it since it's been some years that I ate at a CPK. But the prices sure have gone up though lol. I was glad that there's a CPK near by but not happy to read all the reviews about the long wait times.

I came for a dinner for 2 around 7:35pm on feb 12,2017. Was all checked in and was notified through text. Which is really neat that they do that now instead of a buzzer. The lady who had checked us in she had let us know that it maybe a 40min wait. Not too biggy it was a Sunday night and everyone was out to have something to eat in the kamakana ali'i mall. We didn't go very far pretty much stayed on the benches laying outside. Than later got a notification through text saying my table is ready at 8:15pm. 40 mins on the dot !! Everyone was very nice very greetful. the waitress who had served us was named JANI. She went through all the specials and new dishes and what was featured. she was very helpful on helping us decide. Like gave a few recommendation. So we ordered got our order in a flash everything was timed perfectly. Like the appetizers arrived and one after the other. Waters was always filled did not meet the half way mark. Jani kept us in check and ask if we needed anything else even little things like extra napkins or more bread. And towards the end she asked if we wanted any desserts or boxes to take our left over food home. Overall Jani was amazing and she made out 1st visit to the CPK in kapolei an amazing one !! With that kind of a staff. I will definitely be recommending that place. JANI did the full 360 experience for us that night. Thank you JANI !! you have very well earned a very nice tip. We'all be back again.

Ok, so it's CPK, you know what you're going to get as far as the food goes. So this review is for the take out service. I ordered online, but still had to wait after I got there. The manager saw me waiting, apologized, and offered me a drink while I waited. Way to step up to the plate, very impressed with the service. I'll be back- thanks CPK!

Not so good.  1.Our table was dirty when they sat us down  2. Took 10 min for our help to come see us  3. The artichoke dip with chips for appetizer , the chips were stale  4. Didn't come check on us when we got our order  5. We felt rush at the end because she gave us the check when I didn't even get my dessert yet  6. We were not ready to leave, but the was already cleaning our table and dare to ask if we got our check or if we paid yet  7. Overall, 1 star out of 10

Went here on a Friday night. We were told the wait would be an hour. Ok fine... we came back after an hour only to be told there was still party ahead of us and it would be another 10-15 minutes. It was already past 9pm so we decided to leave. We walked passed the restaurant and counted at least 12 empty tables. We called the manager to find out why a party of 2 could not be seated and he said that the kitchen was overwhelmed with large parties. I've never been to a CPK with that many empty tables and customers still had to wait more than an hour. Save yourself the trip and go to the other CPK's on the island.

Me and my family came here for the first time and we had awesome experience! Our server Brittany was so nice and polite! She recommended good alcohol drinks and deserts ! We are definitely coming back to try other foods!

So, just had my 1st experience at the CPK ever.  One of the best if not the best experience ever from atmosphere, service, food, and management involvement. Our waitress, Jana, asked my wife and I had we ever been to CPK before. This was my 1st, and when I told her she was surprised and let me know that she would let her manager know.  Not 2-3 minutes later the General Manager came by the table to introduce himself, and provided us a sample of their most popular appetizer which was the spinach and artichoke dip.  Hands down the best I've ever had!!!! He stopped by a few more times throughout lunch to check on us, that is what management is supposed to looked like (TAKE NOTES EWA BEACH APPLEBEE'S). We ordered the Ahi egg rolls, Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza thin crust, and the Margherita thin crust Pizza. Everything came out fast, and tasted great. While we were walking out of the restaurant the Manager saw us and met us at the door to see how everything went and asked if we would come back. That's an absolute yes!

Used to eat at the CPK in Kahala Mall all the time when it first opened and I lived in nearby Pu'u Panini.  Usually crowded, but wait times were short, service was good, as was the food.  That was about 30 years ago.   About 2011 or 2012, had a bad experience at the Ala Moana CPK.  My guest and I were treated very shabbily.  Haven't eaten at a CPK since.  But a friend had never been and since she lives near the new Ka Makani Ali'i Shopping Mall and I was jonesing for pizza, we decided to go there.   We drove by about 7 pm one Sunday evening and it looked crowded, so we drove through the rest of Kapolei and couldn't find much to our liking.  By the time we returned to to CPK, it was a little after 8 pm.  The restaurant closes at 10 pm, so we thought the crowds would be lighter and we would get seated soon.   The very young hostess told us the wait would be an hour.  An hour!  There was a handful of people waiting and we could see a few empty tables, so an hour wait didn't make sense.  I just got the feeling the hostess wanted us gone.  CPK Kahala was much more hospitable than here or Ala Moana, but that was 30 years ago.  Perhaps our age exceeded CPK's target demographic?   Been to Lui Buenos in Hale'iwa several times, early, late, there was always room, and the food and service were great.  So we walked over to the new Lui Buenos in Ka Makani Ali'i.  Closing time is/was 9 pm.  There were a few tables with people eating.  We walked in and the young staff told us the kitchen was closed, even though plates of food were being brought out of the kitchen as we watched.  We could sit at the bar and drink, only.   If you're not serving after 8 pm. then maybe that should be your closing time?   As we walked back to the car, I said to my friend, "Sometimes I get the feeling the young employees don't want to seat or serve older people."  She agreed.  Their loss.  Waited tables in college and I tip big for good service.  This will be posted to the Lui Buenos Yelp page, too.   We ended up, for a second time, at the Plantation Tavern near the Safeway.  No pizza, but we were warmly greeted.  They're open until midnight, the food and service are great.  No complaints.
Avoid this location. Either their kitchen is too small or they're short kitchen help. Lots of empty seats but the wait times are long.
Danielle our server was awesome. Had her twice. Place is beautiful and food good. Location great. Patron the stores and restaurants in the area to support your local community. Money means growth.

The service here is absolutely terrible. I have dined in and have ordered takeout from this particular location on multiple occasions. Almost 90% of the time, the service has been horrible. I've never been here when it's super packed or busy, and yet my food is ALMOST ALWAYS cold. I'll ask the servers for straws or balsamic vinegar and they say they'll bring it, but they will forget. Water or beverage glasses are empty, and they won't get refilled unless I flag someone down.  The last time I ordered takeout, I asked for my Cremini mushroom pasta without Parmesan cheese, and they had covered the pasta with it. I had to give it to someone else to eat because I am lactose intolerant. I ordered food for five people and everything except for one of the pizzas were all cold.  Tonight, I tried to call in an order again. My call was first answered by a man named David. He transferred me to Kay, who put me on hold. I called while exiting Target Kapolei and I was still on hold when I got to the hosting area at CPK. I called for a manager and showed him that I was still on hold. He verified my phone and indeed saw that what I had explained was true. I walk over to the takeout ordering station and am helped by the same Kay, who had me on hold for almost 14 minutes. She and three other employees are not helping anyone, but are socializing amongst each other. Once my order is finally placed, she tells me that I will have to wait almost 25 minutes for my food. I tried to avoid this wait time by trying to call into the establishment in the first place. I didn't even receive a decent apology. This place is a complete joke. I think I might just drive down to the Pearlridge location or avoid this place altogether.  SAME DAY UPDATE: I ordered the Garlic Cream Fettucine with Chicken and Shrimp, Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti, Thai Chicken Pizza, Lettuce Wraps with Chicken AND a Spinach Artichoke Dip. They forgot to give me my Spinach Artichoke Dip... I called the restaurant back almost immediately after I came home. Kay answered the phone, apologized when I told her an item was missing and transferred me over to her manager David, who tried to help me sort this out (I guess). I wasn't about to drive back to retrieve it, so we'll see if they will rectify this situation as promised. What a cluster-you-know-what.

This place alwaysssss has tons of open tables with a 60+min wait time. Get your life together CPK. I think the txt system is a fail only do a five to ten grace period for someone to show up and then move to the next person. Also, why are kids allowed to sit at the bar? I don't get it. Foods always good tho.

Go to the Pearl Ridge location if you don't like to wait longer than 30 minutes to get seated in a restaurant that's not at full capacity, and get mediocre service. The quality of the food is typical of all CPKs, tasted good and not too overpriced for my wallet.   The quality of service on the other hand was lacking.  They're either understaffed (according to them), or under-trained, or maybe both. Firstly, our table wasn't set with any napkins or flatware.  We didn't receive them until after we ordered and gotten the house bread.  And even then, there were only 2 napkins for 4 people.  Secondly, our server looked like she needed a pick me up.  No smile at all, and gave us a "look" when we asked for serving spoons/tongs for the full-sized salad that was to be shared among us diners.  She also seemed to have a bit of an attitude when she herself pointed out that our free birthday dessert wasn't properly deducted from the bill (to begin with it was incorrectly billed for a la mode when we didn't order it as such). Thirdly, the wait time for our food and drink refills was quite long. Lastly, we ordered the red velvet cake for the dessert, but got some other kind of cake a la mode.  Instead of telling the (different) server to take it back, we accepted because we didn't want to wait any longer for them to bring the right cake. Would I recommend this place.  Until this location can get its act together and severely improve their service, NO.

A for cleanliness/ambiance. C for location. But only due to lack of parking.  Hopefully this will improve.  D for management.  When I provided feedback that 'service was slow', he said nothing and walked away.  However, we were given gift cards in hopes that this would appease the poor service.  Would have preferred that he acknowledged the feedback and make a commitment to improve. F for service.  Had to wait 15 minutes for server to initial come to the table; had to wait another  20 mins for a glass of wine that was waiting for me at the bar; had to ask for complimentary bread; saw a lot of wait staff chit chatting with each other throughout our dinner; lots of available tables but saw people waiting outside to be seated. Overall - skip it and go somewhere else.

Aloha, hello it's CPK, you really can't do much wrong.  One of the newest CPK's in Hawaii, 2nd on the west side, nice.  The decor is beautiful, the ACU works fantastic as it's super hot outside, and the food is typical good CPK food.  We shared a pizza & salad for lunch while doing some work out here.  Glad we chose CPK, always consistent, always fresh.  Our server was quick to refill my iced tea, nice. But I must admit, we arrived around 11:45, thus before the lunch crowd, thus we had good service.  I hope they work out the kinks, a very nice restaurant & great addition to the west side.

I had a great experience with my boyfriend for a casual dinner thanks to Jeremy L (our server) and the bussers! Jeremy took the initiative to address us by name during each encounter which makes me appreciate the experience and service more. He was also understanding when my order came out wrong and didn't hesitate to make the adjustments. Overall, we had a great experience and hope that next time we were here that we will be serviced by him again. The 5 stars are solely based on the customer service provided and his ability to adapt to situations with a smile (he even did some small talk)- thanks Jeremy!

Hi Yelpers,                   Last night 2/23/17 at 730 pm, I decided to check out CPK in the new Ka Makana Ali'I shopping center. I was very excited to see the new mall and see the new restaurants. I love CPK as I have gone to both Ala Moana and pearl ridges and had great experiences. I couldn't wait to try the new one.          Pros: lots of parking, friendly hosts, text message when table is ready giving us time to walk around and check out the mall, the atmosphere was amazing (beautiful) and the spinach artichoke dip was delicious.   Cons:  I had a waitress who clearly did not want to be there, first off there was something floating in the tea, I ordered wine and was brought a 9oz pitcher and glass to pour myself, which would have been ok if she didn't go to the table next to me and then pour theirs for them. I felt very offended. The water was refilled twice which was awesome but no refill offered on the tea, or even asked. The Balinese pasta that I was looking forward too was over cooked and left a chalking taste in my mouth, and the salmon was raw in the middle so we didn't eat it. No dessert offered, just all around terrible service.   Conclusion:  I love CPK and hate to say this but I really hope that this gets addressed and corrected. The place looks amazing and the food presentation was great. Good drinks and mostly friendly staff. I just feel that if someone doesn't want to be there, do not force them to be as they will take out their attitude on the customer and leave us with a bad experience. Coming from a culinary family who was raised in family owned restaurants, I know that the most important thing is the guests' experience. This was a fail but I look forward to returning in a month and hoping for a better experience.   Mahalo, Arlo G.

This pains me to post 3 stars and I'll probably be back to give it another try another day. The parking situation is great. Tons of parking nearby is available. The wait time wasn't bad (given we came around 430). Our waiter was very friendly. The food tasted very delicious.  So you must be wondering, with all of those wonderful tips why just 3 stars? Our food took around 45 minutes to come out. It tasted good, but when you've devoured the dip and bread and still have to wait a while...it takes up a lot of time. Especially when you have children who are hungry. They get restless and the wait seems even longer.  While waiting for our food to come out I spent a lot of time watching the surrounding area.  We were seated out on the patio and there was a lot of empty seats. A lot of empty seats when there was now a lot of parties waiting to be seated. As a customer I know that it's frustrating to have to wait a long time when you see seats empty for a long period of time. Not once did I see our waiter standing around doing nothing. Perhaps management needs to step up and have better training for the employees to get a more efficient system going.  So, what happened after we finally got our food? One of our plates were forgotten. Either not put into the computer, not made by the kitchen, etc. all excuses that shouldn't be made when your patrons already waited 45 minutes for their food. Now we had to wait even longer for that plate of food. By this time 60-70 minutes had passed. Granted the plate was comped and a manager came out to apologize, it's clear there is a lot of work that needs to be done here.  Our beverages were being refilled in the beginning of the meal but as the restaurant got more crowded, it never got refilled. We constantly had to remind our wait staff for more water, utensils, plates. Pretty much everything you'd expect at a regular restaurant.  I think management needs to either have a more comprehensive training program and/or hire more employees to make the customers experience better.

A bit slower than average for CPK and possibly a bit understaffed.  This CPK has a great interior and the same food you know and love.  But the major tweaks needed just seem to lie in the wait staff.  I can't remember what day of the week I came on, but there was quite a bit of a wait despite open tables in the patio seating.  Fortunately, there's a bunch of shops around the area to pass the time with. Once seated, my family pretty much ordered the usual stuff we like.  I like the Chinese chicken salad and the Thai Pizza.  I also always get their fresh lemonade (with free refills).  Unfortunately, it was difficult at times to find our waitress to get a refill...  Anyways, the food was solid and what you'd expect.   If you're craving CPK, then this place will deliver, just be wary of the possibly wait depending on what you come, but overall a good CPK experience!

c.p.k ,always good lots of room,space kool n comfy great place to kick it or hang out early dinner is the best,no crowd got a kick out of the pizza man tossing the dough in the air,great spin love how the change up the menu

I hate this place! I don't even know why I attempted to even come here. The food is okay but also not isn't consistent. It took 30 minutes to get my kids sundae to the table. I don't think I'll coming here ever again

So asked for a few minutes to look at menu 20 minutes later came and we ordered then waited almost an hour for the food. Not once did waiter come by. The food is really good, service is horrible. No reservations and will text for seating but long wait and there are open tables. Asked for patio seating which was empty but they gave us inside table. They did give us a discount on the bill for waiting so long.

I am writing without having eaten anything, yet. My family and I have been waiting for one hour for our food. The table beside us is complaining to the management of the same issue. We normally enjoy CPK, tremendously. However, we will NOT be coming back to the Kapolei location at Kamakana ali'i.

Had a great experience here! These low reviews really has me stumped. Either it had to have been the usual kinks with opening a new place and or just really unrealistic expectations from "foodies". Any how, I braved dining here during PEAK lunch time on a Sunday. I was immediately impressed how fast my name was taken then notified when my table was ready. Food and drinks were brought extremely fast and fresh! No joke, me and my wife were both stumped at the pace we were serviced. Our server was around when she needed to be and not overbearing whatsoever. The service and food had to have been on par if not BETTER than their locations in town. People really need to dial their expectations back down a bit and not be so quick to crap on a place. So glad to have a CPK on this level in west Oahu. I'll definitely be back!

This is the third time that we've been to this location, and the second time we've experienced this extremely slow service. We were seated at 8:10 on a slow Thursday night and by 8:25 hadn't even received water, napkins, or bread. We placed our order all at once when we saw our server (who was great, it just seemed like she was overworked) and by 8:55 hadn't received our two entree salads or the drink my husband ordered. I could understand if it had been busy, but we were the only guests seated in the outside area. We left $10 on the table for the flatbread and found dinner elsewhere. Needless to say, after 45 minutes, one flatbread,  and two waters later, we've learned our lesson with this location and won't be going back.

Expect to wait awhile during dinner service. Its always busy after 7 pm. Check in and leave your cell number to receive a text when your tables ready, this is convenient so you can walk around while you wait. The wait staff is excellent. They were on top if it and very freindly. I noticed that the staff worked together to get food out and service everyone.  We asked for water, the water had some strange floaters in them. I've noticed this is frequent lately at all the restaurants. We definently didn't drink them. That didn't damper our dinner though. Sadly I see this too often. We ordered other drinks. My little ine had pepperoni pizza, my boyfriend and I shared our fav the cob salad, I had the works pizza and my bf had the chicken with vegetables. They were all excellent. Our food didnt take ling to come out.  In all great food and wonderful staff.

With over an hour to spare before our movie, we decided to dine here for dinner. There was a long wait (40 minutes for a table) and we decided to try getting bar seating. After getting seats at the bar, our drink order was taken. We tried to order our dinner quickly but with a busy bar, we did have to wait. After our order was taken, we enjoyed our drinks and after 20 minutes I wondered where our food was? I also observed several patrons that were seated after us get their food, I tried to flag down the bartender. When I finally got her attention, I asked if she could check on our food and was told "okay." The bartender then walked to her register and after 10 minutes came back and asked if we wanted another drink. I reminded her again about my previous request to check on our food and it was only after asking for a second time that she went to the kitchen to check on our order. After another 10 minutes, she talks to the manager and then the manager comes to talk to us. Apparently the kitchen "lost our order"... and they are only now gonna make our food. After multiple requests to check on our food, 30-40 minute wait for our order, our movie about to start in 20 minutes .. they lost our ticket ? Fuming at this point, I let my mister talk to the manager. He gave us a half hearted apology and gift cards to the restaurant. The bartender avoided coming by and to appease us they brought out our salad. A salad, after a 40 minute wait ? No thank you.. my mister told the manager to cancel our order and we were leaving. Luckily, Olino has a great menu and we hurried over to make our movie and grab a bite to eat.  It makes me sad to write this review as I've never had such a horrible experience at CPK and love their food. I tried to be optimistic that their service would improve but I'm going to have to call a spade a spade. We vowed to NEVER dine at CPK at In the ka makana alii shopping center AGAIN due to their horrible service.  Tip: don't dine at the bar if you're hungry and hope to get your meal on time before you head to the movies cause it won't happen.

This review is solely on customer service.  We sat down at our table and waited about 10 minutes. A server named Dayton asked us for our drinks and told us that the server for our section probably doesn't know that we've been waiting. He took our order down and did most of the work. 5 minutes later, another server (didn't catch her name) tells her coworker that she doesn't want to serve us because we didn't have a reservation. She was blatantly pointing at us too. Rude much? Dayton continued to serve us with quality customer service. When we asked our lady server for boxes, she said she would package them for us. Walking to the car, my brother asks how she was able to fit all my pizza slices into the tiny takeout box, so he opened it. My pizzas we upside down AND FOLDED. I was not okay with this. I asked her for a box, so I could have done it myself?  Dayton, great job. We appreciate that you covered for her.

Even during the lunch service, we ended up waiting. I don't recommend eating here unless you have time to spare. Trying to go before a movie isn't the best idea.  Our waiter was really nice but after hearing "I'm Sorry for the wait" so many times, it gets annoying.  We got lots of water refills which was nice so yay!  I think that because they are a new restaurant they may still be working out the kinks.  The food quality is still superb but hard to enjoy when the service is not on the same level. I am sure that I will go and eat here again with my girlfriends when we have plenty of time. The bathroom was very clean and decorated nicely and I really liked that. The overall cleanliness of the restaurant was great too!  The appetizers are bomb!

Good service but mediocre servings. Food was good and came out fast but seemed a lot smaller than the usual I've experienced at other locations. Overall not awful, but not a lot of bang for your buck.

Went to have a late lunch at around 2 pm, so we were expecting quicker service... We were wrong! After receiving our drinks, we ordered the chips and dip and our food. We waited around 10 minutes for the chips and dip. After that, we waited what felt like FOREVER for our main dishes. I won't blame the cooks for this one, but the servers! We had a table right next to the kitchen, so I was keeping an eye out on the pickup table. Our food was sitting there for, no even exaggerating, 15 minutes. Servers kept passing the table empty handed, so I don't know why they wouldn't serve the food?? The table also got full, so the cooks had to keep some of the plates waiting on other counters.
