The fork they gave me was so dirty and there was something stuck on it. We finally got our food and my pasta looked sooo dry because it was sitting for so long. It was only after getting our food when our server would continuously check up on us. Giving a generous 2 stars because the food was great, but the service was crappy. Need to work on FOH. Not sure if I'll come back to dine in.

Normally  I don't give reviews to chain restaurants.  I am only doing so this time because of the staff. They were great!  No,  I don't know them. Haha.  I was seated quickly,  because I got here at 5pm. It started getting crowded while I was eating.  I had two girls (Leka and ?)  taking my order,  bringing my bread, refilling my drink. They were cheerful and efficient. They are getting a star for great service.  I ordered the Ribeye. It was cooked the way I asked and had a nice flavor.  The fingerling potatoes were really good. The Arugula salad was nice.  So,  overall it was a nice dinner.

This location does not meet the CPK quality values we are used too, AT ALL. We tend to frequent the Pearlridge location and occasionally the Ala Moana.  Both stay consistent in how meals are prepared...it's a place our kids love to go.  We are a family of 7 so we drop a good penny each time we visit. Came for dinner 3/14/17 to the Ka Makana location.  We were sat quick, 20 minutes (it helped being a weeknight).   We got appetizers, buffalo cauliflower and ahi avocado roll.  The rolls here, small! (See pic). They skimp you!  The Buffalo cauliflower, small portion not worth the price. My oldest daughter and I got the Chicken Piccata, our usual.  Our son is the pickiest eater and always orders the kids grilled chicken but requests it prepared piccata style, never an issue in almost 10 years!   The kids mac n cheese for the majority and then a turkey club sandwich. The food comes out.  My son's chicken piccata kids is nothing but something with a watery soup like sauce on grilled chicken.  I explained to the server this isn't piccata style.  The waitress came back and said the cook said if we want piccata style kids, we have to order the adult plate.  I nicely explained we've been frequenting CPK for years and it's NEVER been an issue.  She came back and said ok, they're going to make it. My daughters and I piccata plates tasted way off and were watery soup too!  Please see my other location photos for YEARS back, they did not prepare this right.  Had to share my dinner with my son and his food doesn't come until we're packing up basically everything to go (soon to be trash because it wasn't good).   We get the bill and regardless of the lack and my son not getting his dinner with us, they charged an extra $1.00 for his meal!!!!!!!  No one even made mention of that. 1. They should of said right of the bat they couldn't do it, although every other location has ZERO issue. 2.  They should of got permission to charge extra upon the mess up. 3. They should of comped because of the crap job they did. I actually had to complain, NICELY to the manager and it was a brush off.  I had to get stern for him to take off my son's food. This is never been our experience with the food or service. The kids didn't like their mac n cheese said it tasted off.  The turkey on the sandwich was like the blub of fake meat...it again just isn't the standard for the establishment and we know after our loyalty and frequency after all this time. Return to this location, NEVER.  To the leadership, address this ASAP before you tank the business.

I went here last night with a few of my colleagues and was craving the carne asada pizza. I took a bite of one of the slices and saw something scurry from the corner of my eye. I thought I was seeing things until it perched itself on top of one of the pieces of meat. I was so disgusted. I had to walk out of my seat and bring the plate to one of the servers since no one saw us waving. Our server Shauncee was quick to apologize and recommend other options since the carne asada "just ran out". I opted for a pasta instead.. I was weary of getting another pizza. I ended up getting the usual creamy garlic fettuccine with shrimp. I was a little annoyed that it took another 30-45 minutes for my plate to get to the table. At this point, everyone had finished eating already. Shauncee did come to our table periodically to update me. I understood that they were backed up in the kitchen, but I mean, they're the ones who gave me a bug.. shouldn't they have prioritized my plate? All in all, I love CPK, but I don't think I'll be coming to this location anymore. Food was good as always, but the insect was unacceptable.

Service was fast, when we checked in with reception she said 15 to 20 min wait but they sat us with in 5min. Food was ok but took little longer then normal so waiter gave complimentary appetizer. Any thing free is good in my book.

First time to the new California Pizza Kitchen and was really impressed with the ambiance. Our waitress was super cool and made sure we had everything we needed for a good time.  I ordered the Bolognese Spaghetti which was very tasty and filling.  Our table was also very clean, every waitress or waiter who went by our table collected anything that looked like trash or the plates that we were finished with. I especially like that everyone there looked like they really enjoyed their job and worked as a team.

Good food and environment. Food served correctly and on time. Everytime I finish my meal i always order a cup of coffee. When i was half way to my coffee i saw the coffee cup and stop drinking it; because my coffee cup is stained with old coffee. I know CPK is busy most of the time. But can we maintain the environment or things clean before serve. Its CPK's reputation is in it we dont want to ruin that. Thank you for a good meal.

Saturday lunch before a movie. Place was packed. Shortage of staff. Our server was very nice but over worked. We had to ask for water and silverware. Ordered a pepperoni pizza and garlic cream fusilli. Pizza was great  but the pasta was missing the sauce. Overall an experience I wouldn't want to do again. Kudos to the folks working there, everyone was very hospitable.

Regardless of some comments we found the place up to CPK standards and the service was excellent. Thanks Deidre for taking care of us! We asked for bread (actually hubby did bc he bit into the red pepper in his Kung Pao spaghetti (lol) . Great atmosphere food was excellent and although they said 30-40 min wait we were seated in 13 mins...it was a Sunday crowd but they managed. CPK has always been my favorite- Funny but I don't like the taste of the food ( it's actually different - bland). Five stars for this location  I noticed the manager was walking around making sure empty tables were cleaned quickly because patrons were waiting- .

What can I say, we came in late but the staff at the Kapolei CPK are awesome.   They were slammed with customers and they all still rocked, from the front of the house to the back.  We sat in view of the kitchen and got a great show, the kitchen staff were cool under fire and I mean that literally.   I not only recommend this place for the food but the staff will make you family before you leave.  The parking lot is not their fault so don't listen to anyone's excuse as why not to come, it's worth the wait and you will not regret it one bit. Sorry, update food is off the chart everyone in our party received and enjoyed everything, Kiara just killed for us, non stop great service she was on the spot with recommendations and keeping us refilled on our beverages.  Thank you Kiara for letting go us keep you guys a little longer.  We'll be back, often. Bill Abilla

Incredibly terrible service. I will not be returning to this location. Sat at the bar, which didn't have very many people, and it took 15 minutes before either bartender acknowledged I was there. 10 minutes after I ordered a drink, the bartender hands me a water to "drink while I wait." Like, why can't I just have the drink I ordered? I'm still confused. I finished my drink before I got my food, and I would have loved to order a second one, but no one offered me any service for the rest of my time there. When I finished my pizza, I was just handed my bill. Which was fine, whatever, I saved $10. However, I put out my card to pay immediately, and I waited at least another 20 minutes before anyone actually took my card and charged me. All in all, I was there for a total hour and 20 minutes for just one drink and a small pizza.

WTF CPK!?  I was truly a fan of your Pizza and restaurant.  That is saying a lot from a Pizza Aficionado.  I grew up on Pizza in Brooklyn and lived in Naples, Italy for 3 years enjoying the best Pizza on the Planet from the Birth Place of Pizza.        It shocked me to hear from your store that you knowingly double charge guest each visit and leave us to resolve getting our funds credited back from our financial institutions.  WTF how does a big company like California Pizza Kitchen not know how to process guest payment?        I'm not hurting for the money but if I didn't follow up would I have gotten my money back?  Assurances aside, I don't care to believe it would have been credited back.  What do you call someone  or a company who knowingly takes more money from you then agreed upon?      I've read up on this, some state require the company repay up to 10 times the difference if discovered.  Since my bill was $80 with tip included, and I have a second transaction of $70 for no service rendered that $700 owed for my time.  I cannot be the first to notice this as your management team already confirmed this happens regularly.        Yep feel free to contact me with your solution, do not call me with the problem as that is clearly stated in this review.  Hint the answer is not "contact your bank to get your money back from our inept business practices. 2017.03.27 Update      So it's been the whole weekend and no contact from CPK.  Sounds like they give zero on customer service.  They could of contacted me by phone, Yelp and still crickets.  Folks who enjoy the food and the atmosphere, I caution you that it seems corporate and service only care about your green.  Perhaps this is not a big problem for them cause no one says anything.        Folks I purchased a meal for two on Tuesday March 21st of 2017.  It is now 27 March 2017.  Six days, is six days an acceptable turnaround time for someone who charged you twice for a service?  I've never gotten crazy and decided to buy two plane tickets for myself on the same plane.  If I did it by accident I would contact the airline and get it resolved in the same day.  CPK's answer from their manager was, "we do this all the time when a tip is on the receipt".  Charging twice is common practice.  If that is everyday and CPK is a large chain and they have double there money in there accounts daily how much interest are they making off all of our money they hold onto for 6 days or more days?  Sounds like I have been forced into a one sided, unsanctioned, involuntary loan to CPK and they have no skin in the game.  They can say they only charged once and assure all they want about the transaction.  What I see is they overcharged me plain and simple.  My bank shows two separate transactions.  That is not legal period.  I wish I could post ZERO stars.

Kung pao spaghetti was on point. Our server wasn't. Got there around 4ish- took over 15 minutes to get our order taken then the server took away our dishes to get them boxed up WHILE we were still eating. When asked "would you like a box?" I thought she would bring back a box not take away the food while we're still clearly eating. She then dropped the check right after as we were still chewing our food and our keiki still finishing. Literally 2 minutes later asked if the check was ready. Our timeline was less than 40 minutes in there. The restaurant was at 30%capacity. I'm assuming the server was in a rush to go home or busy talking to her coworkers by the pos, but she should of just taken our order when we were ready to order or asked someone else to take over her table. Also, No bread or silverware or plates until we had to ask. Being from this industry- I have very low expectations and still tip the same no matter how crappy the service is. (Everyone needs to pay their bills) i just don't appreciate being rush when I made ever effort to ensure I would have allot time to enjoy my meal.

Came here on a Friday and I must say we only had to wait 30 min. As soon as we got seated our waitress took our drink orders quickly. Our waitress had really good customer service. The food tasted really yummy and the dessert was huge! My daughter ordered a kids ice cream and when it came out I had to ask if that was a kids size or a regular ice cream. Thank you again for the amazing customer service.

I have left maybe 3 negative reviews in my life but this is deserving. We were told a 40 minute wait with no line, and we spent 35 minutes looking at one of the seven clean, empty tables that we would eventually be seated at while standing beside the bar. I say "we" to include myself and three friends, who were standing beside the bar for the 50 minute wait for the empty table. We were going to order drinks at the bar but the dirty dishes sat on the bar for about half an hour while Liam, the bartender, talked to someone on the other side of the bar. After we sat down, three tables that were seated after us received their food and when we finally got ours, it was almost cold. So sorry - I was really excited about eating here.

Despite that they were out of tomato juice for my Bloody Mary craving then out of this other drink I made my second choice, they redeemed themselves by covering our appetizer bill.  My husband and I ordered the buffalo cauliflower, a cup of farmers market soup, and a wild mushroom pizza.  All of which tasted amazing. I still wish I had that Bloody Mary tho! Giving them a 5 star because TIARA was our amazing server and so very kind for taking care of us.

I don't understand why there's bad reviews, this place is good. My family and I came here for lunch on April 1st. This is my first time ever eating at a CPK location and it was great. Our waitress was Torie and she was ON IT! She constantly refilled our drinks and made sure we were doing okay. I believe the CPK manager was here too. We came at a great time where the wait wasn't too hectic. Plan to come back with my boyfriend later this week.

SERVICE: We have visited this location on two different occasions. Both times, we had EXCEPTIONAL service! My husband and I are big tippers if we have good service and I made a joke with him that we may need to stop coming to eat here because we are going to be broke from the tips! I am terrible with names and unfortunately cannot remember the names of our servers, but our most recent waitress was wonderful and didn't make a mistake on our order, even though we ALL requested substitutions and changed what we would like multiple times mid order! If she was annoyed with us at all, she hid it well and received a hefty tip from us. I would also like to add, that on our most recent visit to CPK, the manager (I believe) addressed us 3-4 times asking if we were satisfied and if there was anything we needed. It's always great to see management out on the floor, showing that they care about their customers. My husband's appetizer was dropped on the way to our table and they didn't charge us for it and even gave him extra on his plate when it finally made it to the table.  FOOD: The first time we ate at CPK, we ordered the food the way it comes. They are not skimpy on the toppings and the food was good. On our second trip, we made some substitutions and the food was even better!! Since they are not skimpy with the toppings and the toppings are large, I would suggest that if there is anything you don't really care for, substitute it for something that you do like! It made all the difference! Also, I ordered the wheat whole grain crust and it exceeded my expectations! I will forever order it in place of the hand-tossed crust. Thank you for wonderful service each time we visited! I hope this review was helpful to everyone reading!

Wish I could've gave more stars because I love all the other CPKs. Second time here at the Kapolei location and both times our food took over 30 minutes for a party of 2, people at other tables were getting their food before us and in that 30 minutes the server didn't check up on us. One of the meals did get taken off the bill which is why I have 2 stars and not 1. Nice place and I still love the other locations just 2 bad experiences for me.

I love California Pizza Kitchen!! This new one was really nice inside, I love the ambience and and the decorations it's really well put together.  The hostess was really nice and helpful when we checked in, there was about a 45 minute wait so we gave them our number and they texted us when our table was ready.   The food is really good, we got the sun-dried tomato pesto past, which is my favorite, a Cobb salad (which I also loved) and another pasta that was super good.  Our waitress was really nice and always refilled out drinks and was very attentive.  She even offered to get more sauce for the two children meal pastas because she said it looked a little dry. She was very helpful!

When we arrived we were told there was a 20 minute wait. Mind you it 515pm..and there were a lot of empty tables..we got seated in about 15 mins. Our waitress was great, took our orders.  The wait for the food however was exceptionally long! Overall the service was good but the wait times are too long for not being that busy.

Wait time is not that bad, depending what time you go.  Third time here with the family and the food is consistently.....good!  Can't go wrong with CPK!  Employees are always courteous and the food wait is not that bad.  Enjoy with the familia or friends!

We had a large party of twenty and were told it would take 40-50mins. This was during a slow time Sunday afternoon. We asked if we could sit in the patio and they said no, because they have no servers. We asked to sit out in the patio and eat take out, they said no. After we got our take out order and settled outside in the food court the manager (Dave) changed his mind and said we could sit out in the patio. This was a horrible dining experience. Don't take large groups here unless you want a headache.

The founders of the CPK chain would cringe at this place with the service today. I have been here twice before on a weekday and the service and food were fine. Today, either due to very poor planning or understaffing, they ran out of glasses and served beverages in paper cups. Had to wait a long time for bread AND utensils, some that weren't washed and had to be replaced. One of the orders did not get placed and the waitress tried to get one of our party to cancel it (he didn't, because he wanted the food!).  Someone needs to help out these folks. CPK's reputation is on the line.
Definitely one of my go-to restaurants because the food is always good. The place is always busy(reason for four stars) so I always end up at the bar but, nonetheless, the service is always great.
It is a 30 minute wait. Menus feel oily. Price does not equal value. Waitress was friendly but then again food portions are small.
I am here way more too often! Great food and wonderful service! Make sure you sign up for the pizza dough rewards! You get a free small plate! Plus for every $100 you spend you get $5

We were excited to come to eat at a CPK and in Hawaii. But we've come to realize that unfortunately they don't hold the same standards as other CPK's.  Wait to be seated was normal, waiter for about 15-20 min to be seated. Once seated, the waitress told us that a high chair couldn't be placed here and we needed to be moved.  Right when we were being moved the greeter told us that the waitress had a problem, not the restaurant and apologized for moving us on her behalf.   Now, I'm not sure why we're moved at this time, after what he told us, but I felt offended.  So, now we're moved to another section and another waitress which couldn't find us for ten minutes.  Finally, after she found us, we hurried to put our drink and food order before she was lost as sea again. Ten minutes later, one of the managers brought my Caesars Salad , pretty nice and pretty good .   Over an hour later, the manager apologizing twice  (about waiting and being patient for our order)within this time frame and still no food.    It makes you think about what happens with other guest waiting this long, savages! While we're waiting, our drinks are done, no refills and again our disappearing waitress is on with her act.  Getting anxious because my family is thirsty and getting more hungry - while my toddler is going full Hulk now, our waitress arrived and asks if we needed a refilled. We had her working on those refills for about another ten minutes, until we got our food delivered. About, that last time we had that same manager come by and apologized for the tardiness of our order, I had to ask him if there was a Fire  Code or an ordnance that would of made that waitress tells us that this area needed to be clear for an emergency then move us because our high chair was placed there.  Surprisingly, he said nothing to what she said, he said no code or no ordnance that would of prevented us to have a high chair there- then he threw out that maybe she wanted to make sure there wasn't a blockage in the walkway but he knew she was wrong and like a good manager wanted, he said that last line to cover up his screw up.  But I had to say that the meet and greet guy told us that she only had the problem and that we were allowed to sit there with a high chair - it was just her.  I told that manager, he threw her under the bus .  Well our food was not the best and after our experience it was making us feel more sick.  A lot of other customers waited for their food while some food sat on the pick up line for twenty minutes or more and no waitress to deliver the food.  Full check, nothing taken off, after all.  Service a 10 (ten being horrible) Food was 09 (ten being horrible) Never again in Hawaii!

Finally got a chance to go to this new location in the Ka Makana Alii Shopping Center. While waiting for your table, there is complimentary water infused with fruit flavoring which is really refreshing...especially on a hot afternoon.  The decor and dining areas are well designed for comfort and style.  The menu is the same as the other CPK's...so it's basically a different vibe when compared to the other CPK's that I've been to on Oahu.   I had the Zucchini pasta with Shrimp and I think it's my new fave.  The kids had Mac and cheese (again!) and it was a good portion.  I think the best bang for your buck would have to be the pizza because it's made nice a toasty in the oven for a very reasonable price.  I would say the price for the pasta is a little much considering the serving size you get...the plate is huge and the pasta is small in comparison.  Eat with your eyes!  So...if you're like me and you drink a lot of Strawberry Lemonade because you're thirsty after waiting in the afternoon sun, you shouldn't have a problem.  But...if you're hungry, you best get an appetizer help fill you up.  (Artichoke dip with yellow and blue tortilla chips would be a yummy choice.) We went with some friends and had a total of 8 in our party.  Service wasn't the greatest as we had a difficult time finding our waitress.  However, other servers stepped up to help when we asked them to refill drinks, etc.  So...maybe we just got the wrong server that evening. It's a very nice restaurant and I'm sure we'll be back with friends.  Would it be my first choice...no.  But if my friends wanted to go, I wouldn't avoid it.
impressed, never visited sit down CA Pizza Kitchen, and will seek out again! food n service outstanding

I was disappointed in this visit overall. My family including children were included in this visit. The wait time was about 10-15 minutes which I thought was great for lunch on a Saturday. However the service and food was subpar. The waitress Rae forgot our silverware and plates even after requesting them several times. So we were eating off napkins. The food took over 30 minutes to arrive and when it did the alfredo pasta sauce was missing. We didn't see the waitress Rae until it was time to pay the check. No apologies. Just subpar service. I don't think I'll  eating there again anytime soon.

I used to... -hate- CPK for the high priced far-too-small pizzas that my friends would drag me halfway across the island to eat. I never understood what was so great about it. Turns out, good thing is I don't have to understand because I actually found food I really enjoy eating here! One was a salad and the other was the tequila pasta--that is now my favorite cpk dish. My only issue was that the pasta is too little. If they would just give a bit more noodles I'd feel it was better worth it and it kind of keeps me from wanting to eat here despite that it tastes so good. I would suggest that they experiment with giving a better value to their food to hopefully raise return business but other than that, everything else seems fine to me. Service is great and the interior looks amazing here. Definitely recommend eating here (just not for the pizza).

My fiancé and I had some time to kill before our movie so we decided to come here for dinner. We read the reviews and decided we would chance it.  I'm glad to say we were pleasantly surprised (: We were seated within the estimated 30 minute wait. Our primary server for the evening was Diedre, and she was very nice and attentive to us. We were also served by a few other employees that refilled our waters and delivered our food. We ordered the spinach artichoke dip for our appetizer. My fiancé ordered the Kung Pao Spaghetti with shrimp and chicken and I got the full Cobb Salad with Beets and bleu cheese dressing.  Our appetizer came within 15 minutes and our entrees within 5 minutes of that. My fiancé's food was still steaming hot. We finished our meal and ordered Buttercake a la mode for dessert, which was at our table within another 10 minutes.  Overall the service was good and so was the food. We were seated and finished in an hour giving us more than enough time to catch our movie.  I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 since it was a one time experience. We suspect we might have came on a good night judging from other reviewers' experience.

First thing you notice when visiting on a Friday or Saturday night is the complete lack of parking.  We arrived around 1730 on Saturday night and were among the many other people driving around looking for parking. We got lucky and found a spot within 5 minutes behind CPK. We were told wait would be at least 45 minutes so walked around. Once we finally got seated we ordered an appetizer (crispy ahi tuna egg rolls that was the special they were pushing), a Chimay (beer), Sangria flight, and our food. After 7 minutes the waitress came back to tell us they were out of Chimay so my husband ordered a different beer. My sangria flight came out and all were delicious. About 10 minutes later the manager comes out and tell us they are out of crispy ahi tuna egg rolls and the prep guy is making more but it would take "a long time," and do we want to wait on them. She also asked if we wanted a different appetizer which we declined since it wouldn't be there before our food. 10 minutes later our food came. One pizza crust was black from being over-cooked and the other had very little of the sauce that was supposed to be on it. When our check came it had the appetizer on the bill that we did not receive. The waitress took it off, but should have checked prior to giving us our bill. Being out of beer and your advertised special on a Saturday night is the wrong way to get and keep business, as is an incorrect bill. Waitstaff should check which items are out of stock when they come on shift to avoid telling customers they have items that they don't. We probably won't visit this location again.

Pleasantly surprised! Came here on Easter Sunday and the food and service was excellent! I had the Chicken Piccata and my husband had the Mahi Mahi Tacos. Took one star off for the initial wait time but everything after that was very good. Will go back again.

California Pizza Kitchen is known for their long wait times and poor service. This is thankfully not the case at their  new Ka Makana location. I really like the service here - everyone is really sweet and attentive. I always feel like they are checking on my table and asking for more. This location is pretty nice with a full size dinning room and small bar area. I have had great experiences during lunch, dinner, and also ordering take out.

Atmosphere/decor was nice and felt more clean and brightly lit than the Pearlridge and Ala Moana location. Food was great although the kung pao pasta was a bit on the salty side with a bit too much sauce but upon telling the waiter he informed the manager and he came to the table immediately to apologize and had the kitchen make a new dish. The second time the pasta was much better but to be honest I thought the other CPKs I've visited made the kung pao pasta better.  I loved the spinach and artichoke pizza. Creamy and flavorful and you get nice texture difference with pizza crust. Also you can't go wrong with free bread and olive oil while you hungrily wait for your order. Balsamic vinegar also adds a nice acidic touch which can request.  The beehive sangria was great not to mention pretty too. I'm not much of an alcohol drinker unless the drinks are sweet and thought it was quite balanced. The sangria had white wine, lavender, honey, puree strawberry and lemon.  Overall I would probably come back again to try their new menu of food and drinks. It also nice its conveniently located at Ka Makana Alii.

Not a work-friendly lunch choice, unless your boss is cool with lonnnng lunches!  Four of us went yesterday: 3 had salads, one had pasta. Our food came out after an hour! We should have gotten boxes to go right then, and left.  The food was good.  Our server disappeared for long periods of time. So much so that one of us went to the manager to get our checks. He did not speed things up at all. It took another 15 minutes after that to be on our way. We can't have lunch here again. Not during work hours. Too bad--I like CPK food.
Besides the food being good due to their reputation, this place is ridiculous slow. They don't have enough workers. I didn't even get water or complementary bread for over half and hour.

This place gets 3 strikes for us. I cannot see waiting 40 minutes for seating when there is open air seating. If can't fully utilize it, don't have it. There were a few people seated out there and a lot of open seats. So I can't see why there is a wait if there's all those seats. Fail from the start.

Had lunch today and son in law and granddaughter both ate the chicken fettuccine. Within a couple hours both were sick with diarrhea, vomiting, and stomach cramps . Called in to Manager just to make him aware and maybe not serve that dish anymore but he got very defensive and all he said was "Well if it was from our restaurant then they wouldn't feel any effects until 24 hours later.

Food was consistent with the quality at the other locations. Service is where it felt short. We waited an hour before our food came and it was not during a busy meal time. The waitress brought our drinks & bread but never came back to check in with us while we waited for our food or let us know why it was taking so long. The drink I ordered had so much ice. The ice filled the entire cup and was above the rim a good half inch. I drank the drink quickly as there was not much due to all the ice. When our food came our waitress asked if I wanted a refill, and I did. Same thing, full of ice. She asked if I wanted another and I declined. When I got my check my drinks did not have refills and it would have been nice if she told me rather than continue to offer me refills

Was excited to try this location and had high hopes it would be just as great as all other CPK's I've been to. They have tons of outdoor and indoor seating. The seating inside seemed pretty specious which was nice. The food however was not that great. I got a half order of the thai chicken salad w/avocado and realized there was hardly any chicken. I literally had to search for the few pieces of chicken that they gave me. I also ordered the cranberry cooler (cranberry juice w/sparkling water) and was very disappointed. Even at first sip it seemed very watered down & could hardly taste the fizz..maybe the sparkling water was flat? However..one thing remained the same as all other CPK visits..the butter cake was amaze!! Thank God! I agree w/some of the other reviews..maybe the kitchen needs more training on portions/food prep?

Sitting at the bar late night is great. Food and drinks were just as good as sitting in the dining, bartenders were attentive and get your names to remember. Didi and AJ were the ones working when we were there.

i understand it can be a variously reasoning to slow down orders but as a server should have etiquette.  We, 2 of us waited over an half hours for salad and pizza the waiter himself realized something went wrong bcz he double checked what we'v ordered yet NEVER apologized.  He just snatched bill and didn't even ask if we needed take out box. Duh~we only had 45min of lunch break and couldn't finish in 10min.  Can I mention his name?

If I could give negative stars I would! Besides getting told to move out of our original booth to across the room to a table because my daughters high chair which the hostess put us their was annoying!  Then to order, waitress went missing, manager came by twice, kitchen couldn't handle the rush, food took over an hour where we were about to just leave! What a disappointment!!  The manager comes by to apologize but you would think he gives free dessert or discount on the bill lol nope!

After 3 tries at this location I just cant get myself to go back. All three times we have waited well over an hour for our food. 2 occasions we didnt have water for at least 20mins after being seated. Tonight was just too much, sat down, ordered an apetizer and a drink. Appetizer came out in 5min, crazy fast, but our sangria's never came... 20 min later I ask a random waitress to check on our drinks because one its been awhile and two our waitress is Mia. Once our waitress cones with our drinks we order dinner, 2 pizzas, a salad, and their new power bowl thing. Pizzas came out within half an hour, power bowl came in about an hour into ordering, our two friends who ordered the pizza were done with their dinner by the time our other friend received her bowl. My salad was still being made.... Thai salad with avocado. Idk maybe growing the avocados in the back?! But after an hour and half, and no waitress in site to give a heads up, I stand up and walk to the counter to let them know I dont want my salad anymore. Its been way too long, my friends are waiting for take out boxes and ready to go home.  Its not the first time we have experienced crappy service or long waits. Let's just say next time we will go to johnny rockets and when cheesecake factory opens they better get their service and timing corrected because their soon to be neighbors will putting a good competition up...

So...been here alot since they opened but for some strange reason, I always have some sort of problem...like ordering a chicken salad and not getting any chicken in it (after I brought it to their attention they brought some on a plate), or ordering some soup and it being just lukewarm...anyways, tonite we get this waitress who was pleasant enough but who asked if we wanted dessert even though we were in the middle of dinner and then brought us the check before we were finished eating! Then, to pay our $45.82 bill, I gave her 2 gift cards. One I didn't know how much was on it (which later we found out had $50 on it and a card that had $13.31 left on it. We get the folder back with a card with a $4.18 balance on it which was the $50 card. So we wonder where the other card went with the $13.31 on it. We ask to see our server and she comes back with the missing card with a receipt that said it had no balance on it. We check the back of the card number to make sure it matches the receipt that she gave with the supposed empty card and it was. We point out that the number that was rung up was off a digit on the receipt but she  insisted that it was right and that she could check it again if we wish. We decided to check for ourselves, got on our phone's computer and sure enough, the card still had a balance of $13.31. Waited for her to return but she never came back. So though it may have been an honest mistake, I took a few bucks out of the cash 20 % tip that I had already put in the folder just because she argued and didn't really seemed concerned. I think this place needs to train their staff a little bit better on customer service. She should have brought back the card that she said had no balance on it and because she seemed to be rushing, is probably why she didn't input the right number because I would hate to think she was trying to keep that card in question with the $13.31 balance on it. Wonder what will happen on the next visit!

The wait wasn't long at all, considering we came during the dinner rush.  Our waitress was super friendly & attentive.  The ambiance is relaxing.  Perfect for what you need after a long day at work.  Although my steak was a little more cooked than I requested, I still left satisfied.  I'll definitely be coming more often, especially because it's so close to home.  Happy eating!

My boyfriend and I hadn't been to CPK in years and decided to check out the new location in Kapolei. We went on a Friday around 6pm, the wait wasn't too bad, maybe about 20 minutes. Initially we were seated at a booth near the bar. Given it was a Friday & Cinco de Mayo it was prettttyyy noisy. We figured it wouldn't really be enjoyable to sit through a whole meal unable to hear our conversation so I asked to switch tables. The hosts were super nice about it and got us a new table on the opposite side of the restaurant where it was much quieter, really appreciated it! I wish I remembered their names. Food came out pretty quickly and was decent. The menu seems much smaller from what I remember from years ago.

I have eaten here several times and love the open - cool- family environment. The staff is always so helpful and accommodating! Thank you for always serving with a smile !! The food is fresh and hot and tasty too!  I love the fact that IF there's a wait we can go roam the mall and spend more money to kill time and build up our appetite. It's awesome during the holidays and especially for a special occasion. The space is perfect for large or small parties!! I highly recommend the the new fresh salad with strawberries and other healthy goodies. Yummy! The chicken piccata is a favorite and the Thai crunch salad w avocado.  The menu is always full of healthy choices and don't forget the butter cake w ice cream !! Awesome experience at CPK KAMAKANA ALI'I ;-). Mahalo !!

Worst service ever ... Can a dude get a napkin a glass of water or how bout a flippin menu .... #neverbeback Update sittting here now  They seem to not be able to bus tables  I've had to ask 3 times for there staff to take our plates  This place is literally the worst cpk on island Here again becuase cheesecake is full  And this was the only option ..... place is slow and lame can't believe I'm sitting here waiting for these lames to get it together

I totally love this place.  Last time we were there when my  husband's 3rd oldest daughter was here to visit for 2 weeks.  Pat is our server and love how he tells what are the popular toppings for the pizza and drinks.  Like how he constantly checking up on us and/or if we wanted more drinks.  Will be coming back to this location again.  IF you are coming back here to eat make sure go see Pat.  He is such a great server.

So I asked for what's popular n good. I bought the the 2 items that the hostess referred to b the best (just under 40$ for 2 tiny pizzas) I'm a female 150lbs and 1 pizza feeds me. Honestly will not go again because it wasn't that great (taste wise)

I was disappointed with my take out order this week. We ordered chicken piccatta and the first plate some of the pasta was stuck together in clumps like they didn't mix it while cooking or boiling and both plates our pasta was dry. There's usually some sauce in the plate but this time there was just drops of it!  Our orders are usually good but I guess the Kapolei location still has to work on their foods. To me from all the locations Ala Moana is still the best to go to!

We were told there was going to be a 30 minute wait for our table; we patiently waited outside. 20 minutes later we went inside to wait and were told that they had a table available. Another couple who was waiting outside, prior to us, came in to ask if a table was ready. Only then were they told a table was ready. We received a text that our table was ready after sitting at our table 25 minutes later! Service was very slow at this site; even though there was quite a few empty tables. Though our drinks and order was taken right away, we didn't get our food until approximately 45 minutes later. We ordered salad as our appetizer and the order wasn't made. The only reason I gave them 2 stars was because they waived the price of the salad and the staff was friendly. If Kapolei CPK wants 5 stars, I think they should learn how Ala Moana and Pearlridge provide service.

Im so glad that the west side of the island has a CPK location. I disliked the drive into Aiea, just to have an hour long wait outside. Maybe that's my bias against going to Pearlridge in general talking, but man I'm glad I get to dodge that 20-30 minute drive now!  This CPK is at the Ka Makana Ali'i mall at the far end near the Olino Theatre. There's ample parking in front and behind the restaurant. The only thing is that the mall can get pretty congested, so you still may have to walk a ways to get to your destination. At least the parking lot makes sense, though. This CPK is fairly new and looks as such. It's very clean and well kept. The inside is dimly lit in the evenings, and there's tons of seating. Despite that, sometimes the wait times can reach an hour or more around dinner because of the location.  I've become so smitten with their baked potato soup, it has made a regular customer out of me. A bowl of that and two rounds of their house bread will do me in every time. But I can never leave it at that - I HAAAAAVE to have their butter cake. Y'all don't understand how seductive it looks on that menu page. 100% recommend every day.  The only drawback about this location is that you can really feel when their team is understaffed. The last time my boyfriend and I dined here, we waited over an hour for house bread, soup, and appetizers. Very upsetting, but we saw our server hustling so hard to tend to almost half the restaurant. I have mad respect for a team that can pull that off, but come on management! Can we hire more people that can rotate out with those who work their butts off, or at least hire enough to account for those who just call out? It's not that simple, I get it, but there needs to be a happy medium - if not to better serve your team of hard working servers, then to better serve your paying customers.

This was the first time I have been to a California Pizza Kitchen, and may be the last.  I was looking forward to trying it out, due to all the hype I hear about it.  Yet, this place was not the best.  Service took forever.  Ordered things that we never received.  The waitress was super standoffish, and sort of passive aggressive.  I am not someone who is rude to whomever is waiting on me, I know how the service industry is.  I try to be as appreciative, and as personable as I can.  It was a weird atmosphere.  It felt as if we almost weren't even welcome.  Honestly I don't even understand how someone like that could be hired.  She wasn't even the only unapproachable person who worked there.  Most of the workers seemed uninterested and unamused. The appetizer we ordered (club eggrolls) was really good, but our dinners were subpar.  I ordered a pasta dish, and I'm pretty sure the noodles weren't cooked long enough.  For the prices they charge, I definitely was expecting something more.  There are so many amazing places to eat on island, so I would say to spend you're money supporting the many local businesses that are half the price and 10x better.  Sorry bout it CPK

in fact this place does not even deserve a 1 star, the in-store dining service is always pretty good but the TAKE OUT SERVICE needs some work. i go in and order a pasta with extra sauce and wasnt given a waiting time so i was like ok cool theyre just gonna call me. so we sat there for around 40 min until i went up to the waiter and asked how much longer the wait was going to be. the waiter looked at the receipt and pulled out my food that was ALREADY PACKAGED AND UNBAGGED ALONG ALL THE OTHER TAKE OUT ORDERS. but then i noticed they didnt pack extra sauce so i asked for it and she said wait another 2 min and theyll have it out. WE WAITED FOR ANOTHER 10 MIN AS ANOTHER 10 EMPLOYEES IGNORED US AS WE WERE STANDING THERE

Sat at the bar expecting a great lunch date with my boyfriend. Bartender, young haole guy, was slow and inattentive. We didn't even get water, after asking for it! And when he did bring one (after my boyfriend asked a second time, he only brought us one!!) We found a hair in our chicken dumpling appetizer. Manager helped us resolve the issue by comping a pizza (thank you sir for being the most attentive worker there!) And there was no complementary bread at the time. Get it together please Kapolei CPK!

The waitress Jenn wasn't so nice. She seemed so nice to the other tables and talked in a nice voice and called them ma'am or sir, but not us. She slammed down my drink and some of it spilled on my leg. She seemed very rushed and we were the first customers to be seated, they literally just opened. Lucky the food was good  service wasn't so great.

Service WAS SO SO SLOW....I was already disappointed After sitting down took 10min for someone to take a drink order after that took another 15 to actually get our drinks then 45 mins to get our diner order ... my salad came after my dinner .... I had to hail down other waiters an waitresses for a drink refill .... a couple an family behind me came in after us got there order an left before us .... We were there longer than I wanted to be 1.5 hours is to long , it ruined my scheduled appointment I was supposed to be at after dinner  If I have anything good to say is the food was still tasty !!   Service just sucked

As much as we like the pricey food, the service here is lacking.  When dining in, we had to remind our server about our drink order that came in the middle of our lunch, and we asked about the bread and she said that she was waiting for it to be done, and we never got any.  Ordering for pick up is disappointing.  I had to stand there and make sure everything was put in or else I probably would have not gotten any.  Like the drinks that come with the kids meal and the bread.  I said we have 4 people eating and they give us enough for 2.  And the covers on the drinks don't fit, so it was spilling all over the place!  They didn't ask if I had a rewards card and now I can't add my purchase for points.  They didn't give me a receipt to verify either.  I don't know.  This location is not giving me reasons to come back.

We went to cpk and the first thing I noticed was that the wait was very short more than usual. Maybe it was because it was on a Tuesday but the staff was also very friendly and accommodating. The food was the best I've ever had in all my visits to California pizza kitchen. The only thing that wasn't 5 star about it was the chicken in the Asian crunch salad was a tad over cooked, but the appetizers pasta and pizza was amazing!

My family ate here for my aunts birthday and my aunt paid the tip for the whole table to the waiter whose name is DAYTON.  My mom checks her bank statement and she is charged $5 more than she ordered so clearly DAYTON gave himself a $5 tip on the receipt which my mom left blank. She calls them to let them know and the manager has the audacity to basically call my mother a liar and say she can send her a photo of the receipt as if my mom wouldn't remember the amount she put ( which was nothing) on the food she bought just the day before. It's not the $5 that matters it's the fact that these waiters are basically stealing from you. Please fill out your receipts completely because there are people like this who like to take advantage. Not eating here anymore. Watch out for DAYTON the self tipping stealer

This review is long over due. My husband and I have been to CPK here multiple times with family, friends, on dates, and even ordering take out. The staff here is friendly and nice. They helped me set up my cpk rewards app so we could start collecting points the first time we went there. One of my favorite drinks is the sangria trio. You get 3 flavors in a flight, all were very yummy! We will definitly be going back.

Second time eating at this CPK location for dinner and let me tell you, I initially would have rated this establishment a 5 based on my first visit, however, I am unable to do so following this evenings experience (6/1).  The main factor for my previously pending five star review was due in large part to the dishes we've ordered tasting better than our known and loved expectations we've consumed many a times. Everything we've ordered has tasted great.  Now moving on to this evenings experience, please see the following pros and cons:  *THE GOOD* - Whom I believe to be the  Manager on duty tonight, Kawika (please forgive me if the name or title is incorrect) was the perfect model of exemplary customer service.  - Atmosphere and decor. This location contains the best design I've seen in a CPK establishment on Oahu. Brings a nice modern vibe and setting to the West Side. - Both times we've dined here the wait was little to none. Keep in mind though, each time was from 8-9 pm.  - The food! I have to reiterate that the standard, always good CPK dishes were noticeably elevated in comparison to all previous dining experiences at other beloved CPK locations. we came to CPK to have a nice afternoon lunch, got seated, ordered our food, but we have been waiting for almost an hour for our food. plus a waitress came to ask us if we wanted dessert BUT WE DIDNT GET OUR FOOD YET. plus my dad ordered a chicken sandwich but it took over an hour to get to our table......DID THEY HAVE TO KILL THE CHICKEN IN THE BACK FIRST ? btw don't get the baked mac and cheese because it is really bland

I finally gave this place a chance after letting yr hype die down. I love CPK, I'm never disappointed with my food or service.   The day we decided to go, Brittany took care of us. And when someone is as PERSONABLE as her, it makes your dining experience 150x more better.  She was on it! Always had our drinks full and checked on us periodically. When someone makes you feel like you're dining with a long time friend it makes your experience so much more worth wile.  I'll most definitely be asking to sit in her section again. QUALITY service is so hard to find!

The first time and last. Sorry but I'm just not a fan for places that treats customers with kids like we are some kind of aliens. Checked in when the place opened. Waited about an hour half because we had a big group, but it was called in. So no excuses. Just to be placed outside by ourself. Our waiter was extremely mr. aloha, he was full of a warm aloha spirit. He was kid friendly and adult friendly. The food I ordered, not my taste but it's always a first time for something.  So thumbs up for the Kamehameha grad server, and thumbs down for the place in general.

EVERY single time I come here, we sit and sit and sit waiting for a server. I only came here this time because I had a gift card. Can't wait for Cheesecake Factory to open. I'm pretty sure CPK is going to lose a lot of business if the service doesn't get any better. Obviously the food is good. Would never complain about it. But not even for the best food would I compromise service!

WAIT time to be seated took too long during slow business hours.   SAT a long time before order was taken. Loved Arugala Asparagus salad with sun dried tomatoes parmesan slivers and a nice vinegerettem.  TWICE my fiancés drink was left empty for a long period   FORGOT about fiancés water that he asked for a good 13 mins POOR order system  * WE came during server/ waitress change over so took that into consideration.  SHRIMP SCAMPI  PASTA DISCUSTING ZUCCHINI LOOKED OLD AND NASTY . Poor birthday dinner. Overpowering flavors.  dessert: popular butter cake with whip cream and ice cream (+  $1.75 for ice cream) was plain cake for me although my fiancé enjoyed every ounce . Like usual when it comes to tipping time is when it seems that wait help finally gives fair or good service.  *** as someone whom had gone to cpk many times in the last 15 plus years the over all quality and service has decreased . Our all time favorite tiramisu was taken away . During every visit I ask why and they did not have a reason and or gave an unpleasant comment.

Kay who works at take out counter was very sweet with lots of patience for how slammed they were. I picked up a huge order for the clinic and one of the orders were wrong. Something to do with the toppings on the pizza. Tricia who I believe was the manager immediately apologized and asked if I could wait awhile longer for a new pizza. Mind you, If it was my order I would've took that pizza how it was but it wasn't. So yes I waited. It took a little over 5 minutes but it wasn't no problem to me especially since I'm on the clock:)  While leaving Kay and another younger female with blonde hair, I totally forgot her name apologized once again and thanked me for waiting. They also told me that they gave me the other pizza for free. Awesome customer service
Another late lunch disappointment. Came to check in with a party of nine and told us they could not seat us because they are waiting for servers to start their shift. Better planning!

Located on the east end of Ka Makana Ali Mall next to the Olina Theaters just behind the upcoming Cheesecake Factory, talk about location. The menu covers a good range of options and the prices are on par. I had the Fire-grilled Rib-eye steak ($28) no complaints. There's plenty of tables plus a bar and the drinks looks pretty good. I tried the Cucumber Reviver, very refreshing drink (my go to beverage). The service is great I was there during a weekday lunch period and did not wait long to be seated. Plenty of parking available while it lasts because the mall is still growing. Please remember to tip.

If you're visiting with an elderly person, in this super-hot, brand-new, shopping mall in Kapolei, you should park at the far end, next the restaurant (at least while it's still the far end; they'll make more buildings in coming weeks and months).  The heat and lack of shade coverage will be hard on that person's body, otherwise.  We walked all over the mall trying to find a decent eatery that wasn't small and suffocating and felt like a real break from the heat, and finally, made it to this end.  Jeez. Open all afternoon, less teeny than the other restaurants (Luibeno, the healthy Cove, Koa restaurant) near the Food Court area, and more of a true sit-down place, cool and oasis-like with its high ceilings and slightly darkened interior. Good service: Lots of water refills, bread basket refills, and we even got an offer to have our endless iced teas turned into take-out drinks.  Bravo on the training of new staff. We tried: Shishito pepper appetizer:  Husband's mom found this interesting, in its slight bite of bitter-spicy, its brown sauce obviously some kind of olive or grapeseed oil with ground garlic, its texture and soft toothfeel.  MIL thought this a little salty, but I thought it was ok. BBQ chix sando set:  hubs got the smashed pea and barley soup accompaniment, but should have gotten the caesar salad one. Now that they put ALL the caloric info on the menu, you can see what's naughty and problematic, and what's not. :) Arugula and asparagus with shaved parm (? not sure the cheese variety) starter:  VERY fresh peppery greens.  Dressing is neither too oily nor too salty.  Refreshing and delightful. Banh mi quinoa bowl: MIL got this, including the grilled chicken, and LOVED it.  She complains about everything and has an excellent palate, and is trying to eat super healthy.  She liked the pickled veggies despite their unfamiliar sourness.  She's never had real banh mi nor Viet sandwiches, and tends to be hostile to new foods/tastes, so this was a true WIN. Two in a bowl soup:  smashed split pea/barley and summer soup (squash with other veggies?).  This is always just okay, and I don't know why I keep ordering it whenever I go to a CPK.  I think there's a lot of cream which makes it a comfort food.  The new summer soup is kinda blah, but that's how I feel about everything soup-y in this joint.  Still, hit the spot, along with the endless iced teas, bread refills, cool restaurant, etc. Did I say their bread is very sourdough-y and crisp-chewy in the right ways?  Refilled at least once.  NIIIICE, as Borat says.

Always love CPK. Sign up for Pizza Dough Rewards and collect points towards discounts. I love their Farmers Market Soup, but practically everything on the menu is delicious. Parking isn't too bad here, depending on what time you come, and seating at the bar usually has no wait. Great servers - good management. I highly recommend this new location.

3 stars has 0 reflection on the staff: I've only ever gone during lunch hours, and during these times they have always been very friendly, attentive, and fast. My only complaint would unfortunately be on the food- the pizza has been burnt and very tough the last few times I've been there.  Salads are always good, but something about the kapolei location, the pizza needs some work!

It pains me to write mediocre reviews for food. Mostly because that means I wasted money and consumed calories that weren't worth it. Additionally, I realize that taste can be relatively subjective, so I generally exercise a great deal of discretion when it comes time to criticize a restaurant. With that out of the way, let me just state right off the bat that my meal was objectively bad. I didn't think it was possible to screw up a salad but congrats, CPK - you did it! My salad tasted like somebody forgot to dry the veggies before chopping them up and putting them on my plate. Everything was a soggy, watered down mess. Everything except for the grilled chicken, that is - that happened to be insanely over salted. I would have mentioned something to the restaurant but I was sitting at the bar and the poor bartender was way too busy to even stop by to offer a refill, much less ask how my food was.  Look, I wasn't expecting some Michelin three star experience. But I was expecting something decent, and this place failed me miserably in that regard. Do better, CPK. I'll be back in a month or so to check on you. Please don't make me regret giving you a second chance! Otherwise I will resort to stealing a silverware set just to get my money's worth.

This location is TERRIBLE. The customer service is NON-EXISTENT here. From the time we were seated, it probably took 7 minutes before we were acknowledged and got water. We never got any bread even after asking for some. There were 2 tables seated near us that got water and bread before we were even greeted! Terrible.  We ordered appetizers and they came out with our meals, not before. My son ordered a shrimp Caesar salad and it came with NO dressing. I didn't realize this until after I started scolding him for not eating his salad. Since our server did not come to our table, my Mom took the salad back to the counter to let them no there was no dressing. Three minutes later our server comes back with the salad, questioning whether or not we wanted the salad so we let her no there's no dressing and wanted dressing. Her follow up question is whether we want the dressing on the side or on the salad (still holding the salad). Does it really matter at this point? Just bring the dressing!!! I wont be going back to this location anytime soon.

Be careful--I called ahead to ask about the current wait time from the road and makoa answered the phone. I specifically asked about a table for our odd party size and he stated "there is no wait." When we walked in 8 minutes later he told us the wait would be 20 minutes. Or we could split our party. Wth?  The kicker... my mom kept checking in with Makoa on the wait time because my dad was becoming hypoglycemic and every time he gave her a short and dismissive reply. Never made any sincere effort. She asked him if we could do a take out order so my dad could get something to start eating or maybe he could get some bread. He was not helpful and at one point said directly: "there's nothing really we can do."  When we finally got seated more than 30 minutes later, our awesome server (local female whose name starts w a J) said the table we got was empty for the past 10 minutes!!!!!!!!  our server was 5-star but the host was 2 thumbs down. The manager usually comes to check on tables but did not tonight. We spent $220 tonight and truly feel it was a poor experience. If I owned the business I wouldn't want Makoa as the first contact w my customers.

Went to CPK this evening (Fri) with my family for dinner.  There was a 30 minute wait which wasn't terrible until you realize half the outdoor seating is empty because they don't have enough servers on staff.  Once seated, we were waited on in a timely manner, but the appetizers (chicken lettuce wraps) and drinks arrived before we had flatware or napkins on the table.  We asked for some additional crusty bread and we're told they ran out.  The dinner (2 pizzas and a salad) arrived in normal time and was very tasty as usual, but the slow service due to under-staffing sure made our normal great CPK experience less than we've come to expect.  I'm sure we'll go back, but next time maybe not at dinner time on Friday night.

Decided to try this place out :) first time to this location it's super big spacious indoor and outdoor so it's nice ! We were sat shortly after being greeted  waiters brought us water with out asking super cool ! Then she asked if we wanted anything else we order 2 sangria flights ! Which are yummmy ! 2 white wine mixtures and 1 red wine ! My favorite ! We order some food , mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza , lettuce wraps and avacado rolls so good ! Everything came out hot ! So that was nice ! MALINDA the waitress were super sweet ! Even the manager ALFY was nice ! He actually brought us out our food ! I had a 5 dollar rewards that I used towards our bill which ended up only being $60 dollars ! SCORE!!!!!! For just opening they got it running great ! I've wrote a review about the Mililani location and the service was way different ! Great service for sure and the  atmosphere is great  ! Will be returning to this location !  KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK CPK KAPOLEI :) !

The latest edition to the CPK chain in Oahu... this location  is in the Kamakana Ali'i center in Ewa or newbies call it Kapolei... and the joint is on the O'lino or Ewa end of the center. This place is great... an up grade from the other CPKs with a larger bar area and bigger wide screen tvs to view... the seating is very open and airy and doesn't give a cluttered feeling like some of the other locations feel like... a great place for groups to come and eat... they even have dedicated stalls and counter for take out orders...  The goods... This was a lunch visit and we just ordered a couple things... First came complimentary sour dough bread with olive oil... delish but didn't want to get full on the bread... 1) Thai Chicken Salad... kinda huge for one person and didn't seem to have as much greens as a salad would have but that wasn't a problem... was more of a blessing for our bellies... 2) Pepperoni, Sausage, Mushroom Pizza... my fav lunch to have at CPK... done well and with freshly grated parmesan cheese on top... was easy to finish! Service... was good for a busy lunch hour and our server was at the top of her game... kept us hydrated and checked in more than we thought she should being we weren't the only ones she was serving and we already said everything was good!  We will return when in the area as this is my favorite CPK out of all the others on this island! Till next time, Grind On! Pau!

For a Saturday...we were seated pretty fast. We got a booth next to the window...which is a huge plus for us. Our server didn't look to happy and she didn't greet us with a smile. Which is a negative for us. She took our drink orders and left us be to ponder on the menu. We got appetizers to share...chicken lettuce wraps & mushroom spinach flatbread. The appetizers came pretty fast along with their ever so famous baguettes with olive oil. Loved every bite of it. Then another server came to introduce herself. She replaced the first girl cause she didn't feel well & she had been sent home. The second server often check on us. The 3rd time she came to check on us, she hands us a dessert menu. We told her we've been waiting for our entreès and it have been over 20 minutes. ShFinally our shared a Thai e apologized and went to check on our order. Finally our Thai Crunch Chicken Salad & The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza came. The manager also came to check on us and said dessert would be on the house due to our long wait. Which we were all grateful for. Nevertheless...I've never had anything there that I didn't like. The salad and pizza had been perfect to share  amongst us. Our bellies were super stuffed. Dessert came...Butter Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream...eye rolling to die for! Thank goodness for the second server who came to the rescue...she had been super friendly and very attentive. The manager was very apologetic and helpful. Thank you for the dessert! We'll sure be back again for another round of girl time.

I've heard great things about California Pizza Kitchen and coming in and sitting down and actually eating the food did not live up to the hype. The waitstaff was great and friendly and the service was excellent.  The Strawberry Mango Cooler was excellent and I'd order it again and again. The Spinach + Shaved mushroom flatbread left something to be desired... it had decent flavor but there were several pieces of the flatbread that were plan and crisp, lacking any mushrooms, cheese, or spinach. Where my disappointment came was the Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese. In the menu description the "Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese" was described their "classic mac 'n' cheese lightly fried with panko, served over creamy cheese sauce". However the Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese I was served was extremely hard and difficult to bite into and hardly had any flavor. I don't know if that's how it usually made but personally I didn't enjoy it. The Butter Cake is a totally different story, it's moist and excellent has such subtle flavor that works so well with the vanilla ice cream on top. This Butter Cake was so good that I might just have to come back for more.

I normally ALWAYS enjoy my time at CPK but this time it was different.  We got there about 6:00-ish and was told that the wait would be 30-40 minutes.  Normally I would say "forgot it" but it didn't seem too full outside (aka lots of empty tables) so I figured we would be called quicker.  We walked around and still not call after awhile and by that time I was really hungry.  I told my husband if they aren't going to call us soon we should go home and eat.   To our surprise when we asked the hostess how long it would take before they call our name and they asked if we wouldn't mind eating outside and then took us to our table immediately (we should have asked them about it sooner so we would be seated quicker!).  Although the menu is the same, the service and and food was not the same.  It seems that the food tastes better and is/seems to be fresher at Pearlridge, I'm thinking because they're more established and probably have old timers who probably know how things should be?  I'm not sure.  The Spinach Artichoke Dip wasn't as warm as it normally is and the chips seemed a little stale.  The salad and pizza seemed okay although I don't think I'll order that Carne Asada one again.  It was okay but not "killer-like" compared to the Thai Chicken pizza.  I would come back maybe in a 6 months to a year to see how the service compares to today--hopefully it will be better.

Thank you again Alfred for inviting us back to your store for a better eating & service experience, I really appreciate that so much! The service was very nice & our server Brit was so wonderful, we will definitely be coming back here again! It's so true California Pizza Kitchen really takes care of their customers!!

I've been to this location 5 times now and 4/5 times I've been here something ALWAYS went wrong. I'm honestly so done with coming here.  1st time) Ordered lettuce wraps and a side Caesar salad. Lettuce wraps came out, and about 30 minutes after that we had to flag our waitress down to ask where our salads were (which, you'd think, would come out first). She apologized saying they forgot to make it and would start on it right away. Mind you, this was during a weekday right at opening and the restaurant was not busy whatsoever.  2nd time) Someone in our party had ordered a salad (we were a party of 9) and while everyone else's food was brought out the salad never showed. Again, we had to flag down the waiter and ask about how long the salad would take.  3rd time) there were 3 of us in the party who ordered salads. One of us got it as a meal and the other two were side salads. As all the food was coming out, low and behold what never made it to the table (AGAIN!). We had to flag down the waitress yet again to ask where the salads were. The response? "We ran out of lettuce and someone else is out buying more right now so it'll be awhile". What in the actual heck???? 4th time) we went right at opening and when we were ready to order someone in our party wanted to order avocado club egg rolls. The waitress told us that "it's not available because it's not prepped". Ok, fine whatever. So we just order our food and I order lettuce wraps and a small plate of Mac n cheese bites. As all the food starts to come out I get my lettuce wraps but the the Mac n cheese never makes it to the table. About 10 minutes into eating my lettuce wraps the waitress comes over to tell me that it's taking awhile because they're prepping the cheese bites. So I say ok that that's fine. Another 10 minutes passes by and she comes by again and says they're frying the bites and it should be ready shortly. ANOTHER 10 minutes go by and she comes back and says "sorry, we ran out of the Mac n cheese bites, but you can order the avocado egg rolls because those are ready now". WHAT. THE. F??? I just said forget it.  ANOTHER issue we had with our food this day is a kids cheese pizza. It was so ROCK HARD our poor guest couldn't even eat it! We suspect it was ready before all our meals were and was just placed under the warmer too long to be brought out to our table at the same time as all the adults food. Which should NOT have happened. I don't know why they wouldn't have just brought out the child's food first. We complained to the waitress and she said she would tell a manager to come over and have them talk to us, but alas, no one ever came and she brought the bill with the rock hard pizza still being charged to us.  Safe to say, I won't be back at this establishment anymore. I'll drive to another CPK if I'm ever craving it. I can't wait til Cheesecake Factory opens up next to this CPK. Hopefully they have better service.

Me and my boyfriend really enjoyed are time here yesterday. Our waitress sky was very friendly and great with her customer service. We came during busy hours but she made sure that this experience was a great one!

There is a wait almost every time I come here. One day I asked for a table and they said it could be a 45 minute wait and I said fine I'll just walk around a little bit. I came back and asked what the progress was and the guy said "oh you've only been waiting 38 minutes, hang on, oh okay I guess I can seat you now." Uhhhh wtf...was I waiting for an open table or were you jerking off giving us a time limit. Anyways, the food is tasty and the waiters are usually cool. The front staff and the price are what makes it 3 stars.
CPK just as good as anyone I ever been to, nice environment, big dining area, large TVs at bar

I read several reviews here and the take away is always subjective. So, here is my subjective review. I've been to most if not all of the cpk locations so, obviously, I've been somewhat satisfied on each visit. My recent visit to this location was indeed very satisfying. Great service and had a salad instead of pizza this time and was extremely impressed. The kale salad mixture, don't recall the name off hand. Delicious! I've been wanting to return for more. Obviously, a five star review can turn to a one star if anyone encounters terrible service, but it was not the case this day for us. Excellent service and left over full and very satisfied. Good job cpk!

Opened since October 2016, this new CPK addition to Oahu is really nice. The restaurant itself is spacious and beautifully decorated; it still has that new feeling. I honestly believe it's gonna be in a hot spot with all the new shopping places still coming up!  Our waiter was very kind, no complaints there.  In terms of food, I ordered a shrimp scampi zucchini (one of their popular items). While it was really tasty, the price of 16.99 for the small portion I got was not worth it. For that price I wish there was more food and more flavors. My mother ordered their lemongrass chicken (available for a limited time), and it tasted delicious. The chicken was doused in teriyaki sauce on a bed of brown rice, mushroom and lemongrass. Very healthy and very tasty (I may be bias because I love teriyaki sauce).

Had the best sandwich one day and the next week it  tasted completely different and was very disappointing..my waiter was amazing both times,but I'm going to stick to my usual pizza and avocado rolls .

This Kapolei location has horrible management.  We love CPK but will not come to the Kapolei location anymore.  On three different occasions my sons macaroni and cheese was served with spoiled cheese.  It was clumpy and sour.  The previous two times this happened we sent the dish back.  The third and final time my son had an upset stomach and ended up in their bathroom.  We sent the dish back and politely informed the manager Patrick about our previous incidents.  He was so defensive and said there is no way my son could have had an upset stomach from the mac and cheese and he must have been sick before we came in.  That was the most unprofessional behavior I've seen from a manager.  We will not come to the Kapolei location and will drive out to Pearlridge or Mililani where they serve fresh food.  Kapolei CPK, please get your management team in order.  Patrick needs to be retrained or fired.

10 Stars  Me and my boyfriend's experience here at Kamakana Ali's CPK was outstanding and I'm excited to come back here! We both haven't eaten at CPK in two years and we've been meaning to visit this location! I'm glad we did!   We were greeted with happy upbeat workers. I love how they send you texts when you're ready to be seated! We were seated and had the most sweetest waitress. I wish we had got her name. She was very informative with the menu and made us feel welcomed and treated us with priority. She was on it with our refills and was very attentive to our table. The food was AMAZING. I loved everything that we ordered! I also love that they have a lot of Vegetarian options. As I'm vegan, so I was able to alter my meal without hassle. I had their Cauliflower Buffalo Wings and omg, to die for! Highly recommend to everyone! Esp vegetarians and vegans. So tasty and mimicked buffalo wings perfectly! It satisfied my wings cravings that i couldn't find anywhere else! My boyfriend ordered their seasonal Thai Chicken and Crispy Mac n Cheese. The Crispy Mac n Cheese was so interesting but so delicious!!!!! He also got his favorite, Lemonade. Lemonade was also perfect! We shared a Key Lime Pie and oh my god, lol so damn good!!!!!!!! We recommend that dessert! It was my first time having a key lime pie and it was amazing. Can't wait to try their other dishes and desserts. Overall experience here was more than 5 stars. Our service and food was so good we tipped our waitress. We will def be telling others about this location and come back for more!

California Pizza Kitchen has become one of my favorite places to dine in at. My boyfriend & I come here at least 4 times a month because their food is just that good. I was never really a fan until they opened up in Kapolei so convenient and close to home!  Hosts are always smiley and super friendly, I've never had a bad experience with them. The restaurant is huge and I've never had to wait as long as quoted, they text you when your table is ready so you can walk around the mall while you wait!  We've had many different servers between our visits and everyone was outstanding besides this one lady we had who seemed like she just didn't want to be there at all, never smiled nothing /: I think her name started with an (S) On to the food... although it takes a while to come out they do provide you with bread and (I forget what the oil is called) to munch on while you wait. I usually ask for a side of butter.  My FAV soup is the baked potato soup, so good, specially the fact that it's topped with green onions and bacon bits.  My favorite dish that I suggest everyone to try: specially any sushi lovers like me, Ahi Tuna rolls, it's kinda hidden on the back page of the menu but I'm so glad my boyfriend discovered it one night because it's what I've ordered ever since. Nothing beats it, specially with the sauce.  For apps, the spinach and artichoke dip is a must! And it tastes just as good if you have to pack it up and bring some home.  Overall I officially love CPK, A+ for you guys :-)

I love going to this location because it's close to home, and not much of a wait like the other location.  We always get sat promptly and the service is always great.  Our favorite server has to be Cheyna because she is always quick and gets us whatever we need. The layout of the restaurant  is pretty open and there is a lot of space to move around without bumping into another customer.   Food is always great, no complaints on the way it taste.  I always leave full even though I only get a salad and pizza. Soon Cheesecake factory will be opening and they will definitely be major competition, but I will still continue to come here because it's still one of my favorite restaurants.
