Started our night at another establishment and after waiting 20min w/no service...we walked out and left. Drove straight to CPK and waited 5-10min for a table. It was smooth sailing from there. Excellent, prompt service and the food was sooo ono. What started out as a bad night ruined by the other establishment turned into a nice meal thanks to CPK!

Before CPK opened at Ka Makana Alii we would drive to the Pearlridge location for their lettuce wraps, chicken egg rolls, and BBQ pizza. Having a location at the mall is so convenient and it's easy to enjoy one of our favorite lunch/dinner spots more regularly. As with any CPK the food and service is excellent, great portions at a great price however, a majority of the time you'll have a 20-30 minute wait.   Because it's so busy the service time for orders can be long but with bread at the table I don't mind the wait.   Rated an overall four stars because there is a wide menu variety, kēiki friendly options, and again the appetizers are ono!  If you're at the mall I recommend checking in early because there will most likely be a wait and to visit or shop at the nearby stores during that time.

Our server Danielle was amazing! She was super friendly and gave us excellent costumer service. It's been a while since we've eaten out and I'm glad we came to CPK tonight. Thank you so much Danielle!

Stopped in for lunch before taking in a movie next store at the Consolidated Olino Theatre. Convenient location but nearby parking was limited due to theatre patrons. Service was excellent from the time we walked through the doors until we left. Dining area was much more spacious than the Pearlridge location. Food was excellent and being able to use my CPK rewards for free dessert and a reduction in my overall bill was definitely a plus.

I come here atleast twice a month. Today I went with my mom and received service from Shantel our waitress. The service wasn't up to par; the worst service I have received thus far. I am used to having drinks filled automatically, my mother ordered tea and Shantel mentioned she would come back for lemons and she never returned. We had to ask another waitress for sugar, lemons, and bread. We were still working on our meal when Shantel approached the table and asked if we wanted to go cups for our drinks. "Really" we are still working on our meals, this completely made us feel rushed as she was brushing us off! I can't stress how important service is. I will always choose service over food! It's sadly disappointing that my lunch date was ruined by a waitress who is not qualified to serve. Hopefully this will be a coaching opportunity for Shantel.

We walked in to be seated and they told us it will be about a 15 minute wait.  Looking around they also have people waiting already before us as the restaurant was maybe about 25% capacity if anything.  We left and went to applebee's which was 75% capacity and they sat us no wait time.  This was the 2nd time I went to this CPK location and both times we had to wait when capacity was low.  On top of that the host/hostess were not friendly or smiled.

Although the wait time was 50 minutes, it's to be expected considering it was a Friday night. The food came out quickly and tasted great. But the best part was our server, Skyler. She is exceptional. She quickly refilled our drinks even before we were halfway done with the first one. She consistently checked on us. She's so cheerful. She's the face of outstanding customer service.

I'm really bummed that this location has such bad service. I've literally never had bad experiences at any CPKs besides this location. I have gone twice and both times the service was so terrible. However a few nights ago it was really horrible. The first time was really bad too but the manager made up for it. We ordered the artichoke dip, a salad, a pizza and a pasta. Another couple gets seated in front of us about 10 minutes later. Another 10 minutes passes and I see that that couple gets an artichoke dip...meanwhile we still don't have ours. I'm a server, I know how things go sometimes so i just let it go. Then this couple gets their pastas and we still don't even have our artichoke dip. Our server hasn't come up to us once to say what's going on or anything. We finally get our artichoke dip and the usual complimentary bread which should have been brought out way before. We finish our artichoke and literally have to wait another half an hour for our pasta then even longer for the pizza. No explanation once from our server. Very sad experience & Im bummed that i had to pay 80$ for that meal. Please train your servers to be more like the other CPK servers at other locations!!!

What can I say? LOVE LOVE LOOOVE THIS LOCATION! Me and my other half come here a lot and every server we get they are each helpful and provide excellent service! The food may take a little while to wait but it is so worth it. And the fact that it is so close to home just makes this location even more my favorite. I will never go to any other location than this one. I love you all and thank you for the great service and hospitality you all give :)

Excellent service! Was waiting a bit for my Caeser salad, and when I reminded an employee they wasted no time retrieving my salad. The food was delicious, the shrimp was packed with flavor and the dressing on the lettuce was wonderful. Didi was a wonderful waitress, she provided wonderful service and had great communication skills. She sung "Happy Birthday," to my friend Ashanti, and overall made our night a whole lot better. I hope Didi is your waitress when you visit!

Ate here a few times since they Opened which has almost been a year and till this day I'm still disappointed don't get me wrong the food is amazing but the wait times are absolutely exhausting me and my husband visited recently there were so many open tables and they couldn't even sit us ( I worked in a restaurant so I know that if my manager was there that would not fly) also when we finally did get seated my husband and I figured we order salad so we could get in and out to catch a movie, and guess what it took 50 minutes for us to get a salad. That was so unbelievable if it wasn't for our amazing waitress (who constantly had to apologize for us and kept giving us bread) and the salad tasting bomb I would've gave this place one star, can't believe they've been open for almost a year and they still can't get the back of house down, they definitely need better chefs or helpers or something.

The service was awesome! Although it would take awhile for our food to come out the service was excellent, I wish I could remember our servers name. We stayed inside CPK for at least 2 hours cause the wait for our food was kinda long but me and my date didn't really mind since we used that time to talk. If you want good service and don't mind the time it takes to get your food then eat here.

The food was the typical CPK menu but the service is above and beyond.  My server Amy made suggestions for my son's meal that he understood.  And when he was bored Amy gave him some pizza dough to play with as a play doh.   Pat the manager was busy being the host, server, and busboy. So someone is always there for you.   I got the wild mushroom pasta with shrimp and it was ooh so ono.  Say that 10 times fast.   It does get busy since you are in a mall, but worth the wait.

Was sat down rather quickly, but wasn't told that the kitchen was backed up.. waited over an hour for our food. Waitress barely stopped at our table-told my partner that she would be back to refill her water glass and never did. Pasta was good but the pizza had little taste (roasted garlic). I just wish I was informed of the wait ahead of time..

I just finished with a 5 day cleanse and decided to treat myself to a dinner out. I decided to try California pizza kitchen for my first time after checking out all the menus at the other restaurants in the mall. I sat down at the bar with about 12 other patrons. It took a while to be greeted and even longer to get my drink. The Bartender was busy enough that it effected service. Besides all services taking a long time and not getting the bread I requested I witnessed other patrons being neglected as well. The bartender seemed to be knowledgeable and have a good personality so maybe another bartender would be the answer. I ordered the spinach and mushroom flatbread and a pizza. I thought both were bland. I now wish I could take my restaurant choice back.

We have always liked CPK , but our experience tonight in the Kapolei restaurant was one of our worst restaurant experiences of all time. We were seated relatively fast, and we got outside seating - which we wanted because it's way too cold and loud inside.So far, so good. Almost an hour passed before we even got bread, which we asked for repeatedly. The other tables around us were given bread soon after they sat down. We were told the bartender was very busy and the drinks would take a while. It didn't take long to get my sangria, but my friend ordered a beer and even after almost 2 hours of asking for it repeatedly he never got it. We asked for vegan salads with all meat and cheese left off. One of us got a salad with cheese, and my salad had no dressing at all. Even asking repeatedly for dressing, I never got any. My friend ordered soup but never got a spoon. He finally had to drink it out of the bowl.

We went here last night because I was waiting for a movie to start. We ordered the lettuce wraps, pizza and steak. The lettuce wraps we got with chicken, chestnuts and shiitake mushrooms with a spicy ginger soy sauce, they only give you 4 pieces of lettuce which isn't enough for how much filling they gave, so I asked for more and the other time I got 2 they were both wilted and brown like rotten looking, asked again and I got 1 back... it was frustrating cause I probably could've made 3-4 more, but I was sick of asking so I didn't ask anymore and just stopped eating. My husband got the spicy chipotle chicken, he ate all of it, and the lady was nice about giving him sauce but was stingy with the lettuce. And I ordered the steak that they had, asked for well medium and got medium rare, sent it back and it came back how I wanted. It was just difficult but, my husband loved it so.. cheers to that.
The food is always gonna be good. The problem is the wait! It takes like and hour everytime I've went just to get seated. The service is good and it has a nice outside sitting area.

After hearing & reading  mixed reviews of CPK at Ka Makana Alii we decided to give it a try.  My son  ordered our food online since it was take-out. We ordered creamy fettuccine pasta with shrimp, wild mushroom strozzapreti, and a pepperoni pizza.  The online app said the order was going to  be ready in 15 minutes.  My son left home at 800p.......the food was not ready and he did not get home till 930p!  Needless to say I fell asleep waiting.   When he got home and woke me up, the pasta was al dente and in the lukewarm side, my daughter enjoyed her pizza (usually every 9yr does), and my son enjoyed his dinner too. In total our 1st experience was not that great although the food was, and hopefully the service will get speedier.  I know they are busy but I'm wondering does anyone even monitor the online orders?  1 1/2 hour wait time in my opinion was excessive, albeit the hostess gave my son a $15 gift card for next time.  Perhaps someone should look into this and just perhaps I'll increase my rating as well.  The food my have been a 5 but the overall experience brought it down.

Whoever decided to open up this mall in Kapolei is genius. This place is busy! I really like the ambience here with the lights and design. And I appreciate that they are open later than the other restaurants in the area on a Friday night. Everything closes about 9/10 while this place is open until 11 pm. I really liked the chicken dumplings! The flavors all came together nicely. The California veggie pizza was good. I liked that they packed on the veggies. And the buffalo cauliflower was spicy and tasty. My husband said "its cauliflower". Yes it's not buffalo chicken wings but buffalo cauliflower. But he did enjoy it so it's a good choice. I'm trying to tell you about all the positives because overall there were many good things about our visit.  Our waiter Tiara and her manger that evening were fantastic! But I must tell you the lead up to explain why they were outstanding. My friends and I consisted of a party of 7. We were quoted an hour wait and we decided we would wait. The hostess asked if we would like the patio or inside and I said the first available. So while waiting outside we noticed that the patio cleared up, but they were lagging on getting the tables prepped. I could see four employees gathering around the host table just chatting away while there were so many tables that we could have been sat at. So after waiting patiently for one hour my friend went in to check how our table was doing. And they had decided to close the patio because the waiter/waitress had been there too long. Ok so I get it's an HR problem. But the fact that they closed the patio wasn't really the problem. The current host just made a really impersonal shrug on the shoulder and an uncaring "there is nothing I can do." Come on, don't act like that when a woman is hungry. You'll turn it into hangry! We finally got seated and we're comforted by the fact that Tiara was an outstanding waitress and she knew what she was doing. She knows what it means to be in the service industry. We told her about the host and the manager swept in and took care of it right away. I just hope that the host learns because he's the first one the customer comes into contact with. And the steak my friend ordered was underdone (maybe because they were trying to get our order out quickly) but they made sure to fix it and comped our Dumplings. So because of these outstanding individuals I was able to come from a "I'll never come back here again" to a "I'd come back here again".  So I hope you can give them a chance too.  And it seems that the employees have a good camaraderie, but maybe you shouldn't take your break in the front at the host table where hungry customers are still waiting to eat.  It makes me wonder that maybe you could have been tidying up the bathroom or the dirty floor. So if they can maybe train their employees to be more professional I could easily give them 4 stars.

There was bad service, the people were in bad moods and I saw the food on the counter but no one gave it to us! The servers were just lounging around! It took like five minutes for someone to take it to us.

My wife and I tried again to eat at CPK tonight but we were told there was a 30 minute wait at 5:30 on Friday evening, but there were many open tables, visible as I drove by. As a consumer I find it unacceptable that during a prime meal period they cannot seat me for whatever reason. This is not the first time, but I gave them a pass last time because they were only open a week or two. Now, months later there is no excuse. I don't know if my wife and I will ever get to enjoy the new local CPK.

This is one of the newer and probably newest CPKs on the island.  It is located at the front area of the new Ka Makana Ali'i shopping center mall.  It is kinda interesting because they are about to get some huge competition with Cheesecake Factory right in front of it when it opens.  Anyways, it is also located in front of the movie theatres.  It is in a pretty good location because the restaurant makes for a great dinner and a movie kind of setting.  In regards to the food, I like it.  The artichoke and spinach dip is always winners.  It is kinda interesting that I usually go here more for the pasta versus the Pizza and it is funny because they are called California Pizza Kitchen.  However, the pizzas are all also very good.  They have a pretty good drink selection as well.  In regards to dessert, I like the parfait and brulee.  Any of them are pretty good.  If you come during the weekends, you can expect for a few minutes wait time.  If you are waiting outside, they have a pitcher of water for you to drink which is awesome.  The restaurant itself is pretty spacious and stuff.  It has TVs and a bar and good amount of table and seating areas.  The staff and customer service is good overall I would say.  Usually the front parking lot areas near the restaurant fills up pretty quickly.

Management continues to have an issue with the execution in the kitchen. Two children pasta dishes does not take 30 plus minutes (and counting). Hats off to Amy at the bar, thankfully she was on top of getting things done.

Thought I would give it a second try and was definitely better this time around. Food coming out in a timely manner and staff was more attentive. Food was good and service was awesome.  I understand that this location is fairly new, but I do hope the service and food quality will continue to be good or better.

Service was great. Problem was the bar. Twenty minutes for a drink to side up. Despite the timing service was exceptional. Positive attitudes all around. Food was the standard for cpk. Beehive sangria was in point.

I've been here quite a few times, and it has always been excellent service. The waitresses are very friendly and give really good recommendations. I'm not a big fan of the bread and olive oil dipping sauce, but it's a light snack before ordering appetizers. The pastas are delicious, but the plates are HUGE. It takes up a lot of room on the table. I highly recommend the Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti pasta if you love mushrooms! The ambience is nice, and the wait time is not too bad. I try to go before the dinner rush, so I can be seated within 20 minutes. Next time I come here, I will try out the pizzas (I always get full off the pasta dish) instead!

I don't complain about the wait that comes with being seated at a restaurant, however I do complain when it takes fucking 10 minutes to get drinks, a half hour for our appetizers and an hour+ for our meals. It took an hour for my partner to get the shrimp tequila for it to be brought out and it be fucking chicken and hard like the noodles weren't cooked thoroughly. On top of that my steak wasn't even started, and when they finally did bring it out, it was fucking burnt and not cooked med-rare. I don't get why we order things the way we want for it to be fucked up. Then on our separate bills they added too much items on our bill and when asked to add it to the other couples she brought it back 'adjusted' but still charged the said amount from the beginning. I noticed the next morning that I was charged too much and the fuckig managers took more than 4 hours to get back to me and refund my money. I was told they would get back to me so I called two hours later for them to give me attitude and not answer my questions straight. And when I called back two hours after that very upset they fixed my issue in five minutes. So basically it takes an angry customer to get what you want in this stupid fucking restaurant

A great location for this reputable pizza chain. I would recommend coming here after my over 30 visits to this particular venue.  PROS: Always clean and fast service. Food always come out in an excellent presentation. Additionally, the orders are never wrong regardless of what menu item you order. Place is always clean and staff is always courteous. The drink menu is very broad and extensive. Prices are a little high but your eating at a brand new restaurant in a brand new mall in Hawaii, so I guess that's to be expected.  CONS: Due to lack of sit down eating options in the area, this place can be crowded quick and there isn't enough staff at times to handle the rush. Even when you can clearly see multiple empty tables, the staff can't seat you because they can't accommodate you. Hopefully the staff can grow now that it's been here for almost a year.

TERRIBLE SERVICE. The waiters/waitresses are so rude, disrespectful & impatient. What keep the customers from not coming back is a BAD ATTITUDE and that's exactly what they have. Definitely DO NOT recommend coming back to this one. Unless you want to be treated badly, come here

Arrived at 8:40pm on a Saturday night and there was a 40 minute wait. Sat down 40 min later and ordered our food. Server was friendly and apologized for the long wait for our food. Eventually we left without getting our food because we weren't going to make it to our movie on time. The manager came to ask us if we were sure we didn't want our food, it was coming right out, but that's what they said 5 min and 10 min before. He sounded mad. We were mad too, a 30 minute wait for our salad and chicken is unacceptable! Would not go here again.

Had dinner at this location for the first time to celebrate my mom's birthday. The wait was about 30 mins for our party of 7. Our server was Kelsey, very high-spirited and nice. Our food came at a good time and everything went just about well.  Just two things that I didn't like about our experience - 1) Our drinks and waters were never refilled. It took 3 times to ask to finally get a refill but we were already done with our dinner by then. 2) I had my 1 year old with me and she needed a diaper change so I brought her to the restroom but it didn't have a diaper changing table  I rarely ever change her diaper at the table especially in a restaurant because I think that's a bit rude and disrespectful to the families/tables next to us, but where else would I have changed her without walking back to the car ‍ And no, she didn't have a stroller because she sits in a high chair lol.  Smallest things to frown upon but overall we had a good time and fulfilling dinner.
Here regularly and this Time I'm pretty disappointed. Maybe because it's the weekdays idk.
I've always love CPK. To bad they got rid of the Thai linguini. But still I love this place. Favorite dish is the Thai Rolls and Kung Pao Spaghetti

Ordered a BBQ chicken salad... but... Beware of the hair... Deep down in there... They just don't care... but next time I SWEAR!!! They gave me a new one... THE HAIR BETTA NOT BE IN THERE! Lol. It just sucks that I only saw it at the bottom of the plate as I was taking it to go.
Always a great experience coming to Kapolei's cpk. Service is on point, food is amazing and we enjoy it every time we come out.

Last night we visited this restaurant, to hopefully have a better experience than our last one but no. It took 10/15 minutes to get any attention by a server, finally someone came over and stated nicely that there was a section change and our server probably didn't realize it. I appreciate the tip but why does the customer have to suffer for that? Shows poor communication within operation, that's just me. The wait for our food was over and hour, my kids mac and cheese as well. One of the mac and cheese was cold the other fresh. I gave it back to the manager & made my girls share, she was nice and apologized, accommodated us by removing their food. My husband and I still waiting for our food and notice the table who ordered after us got their food before us.  If you don't mind waiting and waiting then you wouldn't have a problem. The food was ok I had the chicken piccata and the capers were a little over powering, need to make a note and have light capers if I ever go back there.

I love this CPK! Truth be told, CPK is my favorite chain in the world and if my life were to turn into groundhog day this would hopefully be the place where I'd live out the rest of my eternal existence. I love the gorgeous new modern design with the same solid menu I've enjoyed for almost twenty years. Pizza? Check!  Pasta? Check!  Salad that doesn't make me feel sad and empty like regular salad? DOUBLE CHECK! Wine & cocktails? Check! Service was solid and food was as expected. CPK is one of the few places on the West side where I can get a cocktail with a girlfriend and it was perfect for a weeknight catch-up dinner with my bestie!

Went here recently with my wife for some holiday (mothers day?). Im not usually a fan of CPK, but this one in Kapolei was not my usual experience. I had a good time and the food was great. Definitely going here again!

Omg...I knew we should have sat at the bar. We get better service there than getting seated at the table. We get to our table and get seated. Our waiter comes and he asks what we would like to drink. My boyfriend asks what kind of beers they have on tap? And he straight up says "honestly I don't know, I don't know my beers too well"....(awkward silence) me thinking in my head...I'm shouldn't you say you can go check and come back? 10 seconds later for it to hit his mind he goes and checks....this guy is either new or really should not work here since he can't even tell us what beers they have on tap! I was this close to getting up and actually leaving. We'll just eat our appetizers and take our business elsewhere where someone knows their menu. So we got our beer minutes after our egg rolls come out and I've just about had it. So we ask for our bill... and this gets even better our bill was $25 tell me why when the bill came back he charged me $29!?!?!? When I asked him what happened he had no answer!!!!!

Service was awful, we ordered the simplest items on the menu (mac and cheese and ceaser salad) and had to wait 45 extra minutes just to revive the entree, server was rude muttering billeting comments under his breath all night, and the wait staff dropped a platter of our food twice throughout the evening. overpriced for the experience we had!

Came here about a week ago. Did a online order.  Was really disappointed.  Ordered the white corn & guacamole dip and brownie sundae.  When I got the dip it was all guacamole and the chips was so stale.   The ice cream in the brownie sundae had icicles. I went back in to see what they could do about the dip, the workers did go back and fourth and say their almost closing. And????  So I made them make me a fresh batch.  Their excuse was, that was the bottom of the last batch.  Smh.

Had a mishap with a take out order that I placed through their App. Placed my order at 8:10pm and expected pick up time for 8:45pm, giving ample time for my order to be made and ready to be picked up. Arrived on time but my order wasn't ready. I had to wait 15min for my order. The employee listed my order while handing the bag to me so I expected my order to be right.  Got home and found out an item was missing. I called the restaurant frustrated that I had to go back cuz at that point I'm super hangry.  David, who was manager at the time handled the situation very well, the way a manager should.  Any ways... They're human. I'm human. People make mistakes. I really enjoy their food but I'll probably stick to dining at the bar...
Went back to the restaurant got sitted right away served promptly my only complaint the steak was very fatty and the like salad had little fish but very tasty and refreshing

After all this time being open you would think they got it by now but noooooo. Runs out of utensils, glasses and food takes too long. This particular location is not well run. Poor employees have to deal with the inadequate management. Not going to this location anymore.

Service was awful ordered appetizers the server never put them in. Ordered a drink that didn't have it but did anyone bother to tell me no. Just sitting here waiting for it . Order entrees out they come and we ask her where are the appetizers and she says I don't know yes you do you didn't send them in. Oh then she lets me know the bar doesn't have my drink well thanks a lot. Food is cold and this Jambalaya Fettuccine is full of raw bay leaves . I am so done
Very very slow service as always!!! No one come to ask if you want a refill on drinks or bread. They seem to never have enough servers working

Me and my family came here a week ago. We never do go out together so we wanted it to be special. Plus, it was my brothers birthday and we wanted some of the employees to join in on singing "happy birthday" First of all, we get to our table. We get our drinks, appetizers, and then our entrees. Waitress took a long time filling up drinks and even refilled my brothers Sierra Mist into a Pepsi, which is alright people make mistakes.  So then after a while, we were waiting for her to come back to our table. She was helping other tables in her section but not ONCE did she glance at our table. I had to walk up TWICE to the to go sections where 2 girls helped me out. I asked her to tell our waitress if we could sing happy birthday to my brother. Finally, she come to our table and we order desserts, and our drinks still I filled, we had to ask.  When she bring the desserts, my brothers free birthday dessert doesn't come! So we tried getting her attention but she doesn't glance over at us! By that time we were done with our desserts, she still hasn't come to our table after about 10 mins. We had a movie to catch at around 8:40pm and it was already 8:30! I had to walk up AGAIN to the 2 girls in the takeout section and asked for the bill! I saw them go to our waitress and tell her and the waitress snobbed! 15 mins later we are furious. We missed a good 10 mins of our movie.  Every time I come here, there is really bad service. I was gonna give it 2stars, but added one more because the food was great.

Called CPK to place a take out order at 10:28pm on a saturday evening and was placed on hold for take out. When I finally got thru the time was 10:34pm and was told they cannot accept my take out order because they stop phone orders after 10:30pm. I missed the time by 4 minutes and was told sorry. Really bummed considering they close at 11pm. If i wasnt placed on hold maybe i could have got my order in. Well its a good thing cheesecake factory is coming to kapolei, maybe they will accept late phone orders. 2nd and last negative experience with this location.

The restaurant can seat many, but it's the kitchen that can't keep up. It takes super long for food to come out.  Our entrees came out before 2 appetizers. My pasta didnt have enough sauce and had to ask for more. We asked for no onions on our salad, but they forgot and it was in the salad. We didn't want to send it back because we didn't want to wait super long for them to remake another one.  There were so many seats available but we saw so many people waiting outside because they are "staling" because the kitchen can't keep up. Our server was nice, it's just the kitchen.

CPK has always been hit-or-miss as I've been to the Ala Moana and Pearlridge locations. There's a total of 5 on Oahu (Hawaii Kai and Mililani as well) with 2 more opening in the neighbor islands in the future (Kauai and Maui).  But I can honestly say that CPK Kapolei was a hit in my book! This new venue is located across the new Cheesecake Factory at Ka Makana Ali'i (KMA). Parking can be accessed through the mall parking lot - I prefer parking on the movie theater side as those lots are usually available. Be careful parking in lots that have blue dots as those are for workers at KMA. The GOOD: Compared to other CPK's (except Mililani), this CPK has a nice outdoor area - they use this area for Paint Nite. Be wary of the weather though because it can be quite chilly if the wind is blasting in this area. The drinks are tasty too - the bar is spacious and would recommend the Moscow Mule and Honey Bee Sangria!  The BAD (Not Really): I don't have much negative things to say about this place as the wait wasn't bad at all. Probably the only uncomfortable part was the wait as there was a moment when the food took awhile for our large party of 16. But our waiter was patient and accommodated us well (Shoutout to Tito)!  The BEAUTIFUL: The food was SICKNING! The spicy buffalo cauliflower is a must-get!  If you're wanting to save room for your entree, I would recommend the white corn guacamole + chips or the spinach artichoke dip! Our friend got the Thai crunch salad and I'm sad that I didn't get it - it was that good! The fire-grilled ribeye was good - take note that you can replace the arugula salad with Mac salad. I also got the shrimp scampi zucchini, which tasted perfect (good amount of shrimp) and wasn't heavy because of the zucchini noodles (it's mixed in with regular noodles as well). I avoided the pizzas as I wanted to get dessert too - YOU MUST TRY THE BUTTER CAKE!!! It's a mix of butter, whip cream, cheesecake and vanilla ice cream.  I definitely have a different view of CPK after going to this one. The interior is classy and the workers marched the interior - classy as well. Just a tip - lunch doesn't get as chaotic as well as weekday evenings.

Came here for lunch with my bf and my daughter. We were seated right away and I love how the place we were seated my daughters stroller was not in anyone's way. We got ordered our food and didn't wait long for it to come out. The only down side I have is the servers don't check on you much. Within the hour-hour an a half we were there eating our server came around only 3 times. At one point I didn't have an water and had to wait for our server to come back and ask her for more. Other than that everything was good

This was very disappointing! It took 1 hour to be seated then it took another hour to get our food. They served my granddaughter a bowl of dried pasta no sauce no taste she didn't want to eat it. We asked for more sauce for the pasta and they took another 10 minutes. So I went up to the manager to see why the food had no sauce and taste and why was it taking so long.  I feel like we wasted our time and money here. Thank goodness there are more places to eat now in kapolei

Busy busy busy, seemed understaffed with the overflow with the people who could not get into the new Cheesecake Factory. Waited for one hour. The wait staff kept bumping our chairs as they passed cause the party next to us left their stroller with baby in the walkway, breach of fire safety policies. Waited 20 minutes for the food. They forgot the appetizer and did not bring our drinks. And no utensils. Food was not hot and fresh. Very disappointed.

In honor of national pizza month,  I had pizza for dinner. I don't normally go out of my way to visit CPK but, it was close to home, no waiting and I'm glad I did.  Service was great and the food was much better than I remember. Our food took about 35 minutes to arrive from time we were seated.  The waiter was efficient and friendly. I had the roasted artichoke and spinach pizza...yum!! CPK still a little $$$ but, pizza was well worth the wait and $$$.
Too long of a wait for Cheesecake Factory so we went next door to CPK.  Much better choice. Got seated in 5 minutes!  Great tasting food, excellent service.

Had lunch yesterday and ordered spaghetti/ cauliflower/ BBQ pizza and salad . It was all good ! The best thing was our waitress Kuulei / we told her we had to leave by a certain time because we had to make it to our flight at airport . She got our food and boxes in case we had to hurry and leave . Got our bill taken care of and we never had to wait . Awesome !

We usually come here during the weekend for lunch shortly after they open for the day and sit at the bar. Everything is always solid, from food to the service. I've never had a bad experience or a bad dish. My top go-to restaurant at Ka Makana Ali'i.

Stopped by to grab some lunch with my sister today! We decided to sit at the bar since it was empty and so she could watch her football. There was only one bartender servicing the bar and then she ended up having to service the outside patio tables and then tables surrounding the bar. When that happened, service got a little slower towards the end, but it was understandable, she still gave great service! I felt bad because she had to cover all that by herself. The manager did stop by for a quick second to check on her. I'm guessing they were short staffed? We ordered the Bianco flatbread (my fave), the shrimp scampi with zucchini noodles and tried the pumpkin cheesecake for dessert. The bianco was good, as always, the shrimp scampi was alright, it just seemed like it was sitting under a heat lamp for a little bit because the cheese congealed on my plate and it just didn't look fresh off the line. Also, our food came after a couple who sat down about 10 minutes after us and ordered after us. The pumpkin cheesecake was definitely rich, but it was delicious and that caramel sauce is delicious!  Right now, the CPKs are donating their round up for charity to the survivors and families of the victims of the Las Vegas shooting, as a CPK employee in Las Vegas lost her life and left behind young children. So go ahead and round up for charity!

Giving them a 4 out of 5 stars because of the wait time. It was over an hour wait. We to this location for my sister in laws birthday dinner so we had no choice but to wait haha. My husband doesn't like waiting over an hour for a place to eat but since it was his sister's birthday he just sucked it up hahaha. Other than that, my pizza was alright. Should've got the chicken piccata instead. Oh wells. The service was good, our drinks were always refilled and food came out in a decent amount of time and all correct orders. I was feeling sick that night as well and the lovely waitress there was helpful and expressed her empathy.  Fyi, it's real busy right now with cheesecake factory and Sura now open. People probably can't wait 3 hours to dine at cheesecake factory and decides to head over across the street so it might be more busy than usual.

Got take out tonight and was very disappointed. The pizza and avocado egg rolls were way overcooked. There was barely any sauce on the pizza and it was like a stale piece of cardboard. They were not busy, so no excuse. Really there is not an excuse ever, why would you sell someone burnt and over cooked food? If you messed up on it, re do it! We are paying customers.

We all know that when there is a new location that opens up, there is bound to have a downfall somewhere in your experience. But tbh when we came here on a Friday Night, it was actually the best idea evarrr! We were originally suppose to go to cheesecake factory here at ka makana but because they just opened and everyone and their mama wanted to eat there, the hour was a 2-3 hour wait. So my sister in law just put our name down at cpk just incase because they wouldn't even give us a buzzer at cheesecake. We cancelled our reservations a cheesecake because cpk was ready to seat us in no time. the wait wasn't that long (hence the fact that we were coming all the way from kalihi, lol) I wish I remembered what our servers name was, because honestly she was the best server I have ever had in my entire life. When she talked to you, she had made sure she made direct eye contact with you, and that she had her full attention on you, nothing else to distract her. She listened and answered all our questions and also put in her advice on what she liked. She kept all our drinks topped off, kept the bread coming, and made sure our orders came out at a steady pace as well.  Their lettuce wraps and avocado rolls (I think that's what its called) appetizer is the freakinggg bommbbbbb ! I literally want to go back to cpk just to eat that. Lol. I had the club pizza had that was so ono I couldn't even finish it all, back then they used to call it the BLT pizza. But now they just add avocado to it, which isn't all that bad either. But the real winner of the night was the dessert! lol I forget what that was called to. Its that butter cake one I think ? That was yummy too. My bf didn't even want to share it a first, I had to fight for the plate. It is really rich so make sure you share it. But overall the location is nice and big, very fancy to me rather than the other locations.
Waited 40 mins to be seated. Then  another 50 mins for our meal. The wait was worth it my Jumbalaya was as always wonderful and my husband had the chicken picatta which he enjoyed as well.

This is located across from Cheesecake Factory in the Ka Makana Ali'i Mall. There is plenty of parking, but it gets pretty packed.  Came here on a Saturday afternoon. It was pretty busy but my party of two got seated right away.  The server was very nice and was great at making sure our beverages were refilled throughout the meal. We ordered the White corn guacamole + chips it actually had a lot of flavor and was served on a chilled plate. It cost around $5 and it was an ice scoop size. Also ordered the tortilla spring rolls: Thai chicken and Mediterranean veggie. It came with 3 of each flavor cut in half with Thai peanut sauce and marinara sauce. Probably wasn't my favorite appetizer but it was okay. Also ordered the garlic cream fettuccine with sautéed Cremona mushrooms. Pretty good, I feel like it should have more sauce. Over all the food was good, nothing out of the ordinary.

Sunday afternoon late lunch early Dinner.  Full house, seated quickly.  Order a good ol fashion mushroom pizza.  Ingredients getting tighter.  Mushrooms were literally paper slice thin!  See picture.  Service was good though.  The waitress tried her hardest to keep us happy.  If not for her it be a 2 star from me.

location: Mililani Mauka - Launani Valley, Mililani, HI
review: The wait wasn't bad only 15 minutes, entitle service was fast and she did refill our drinks but when the food came out it was barely warm. We got the clubhouse pizza and it basically has a whole salad on top of it. The cheese was cold so it was kinda of like eating pizza that had the cheese harden. My daughters pepperoni pizza was pretty good she enjoyed it. When the pizza arrived we wanted to ask for the menu but the waitress was gone for a while so by the time she came back I just asked for boxes and the check. Started out great, ended ok I guess.

Went to he bar hoping to have an enjoyable afternoon of pupus and drinks with my boyfriend. Sat down at the bar and it took 10 minutes for any of the staff to acknowledge us sitting there as they talked story amongst themselves in front of us.. When we ordered our drinks my Long Island came back too strong for me to drink so I asked the server to mellow it out a little.., it still tasted horrible so we had a server help out and dilute it even more. We were never offered water, never served plates or napkins to go with our pupus and we're basically abandoned by our bartender who had a total of 6 people at the bar. Horribly disappointing service at such a quiet hour. The new bartender switched on while we were still there and we wanted to order a round of shots- but she did not approach us for the 15 minutes she was working - so we were unable to even order.  I wanted to complain to the manager but my boyfriend told me I was being a diva and he wanted to get home because we were just so irritated with the shitty service... This is why we don't go out.
Service is slow but the staff is trying to be as attentive as they can. Should improve as time goes on. Bread was spot on.

I can't say whether the food here is good or not because I didn't even get to eat it. After waiting over an hour for our food, the manager came over and said our food was accidentally given to another table. It took another 15-20 mins until my friend's entree was delivered but mine still hadn't come out and I had to ask for it to be put in a to-go box. Our waitress was very nice, I just think the manager should've taken initiative to comp our food . We paid for a restaurant experience, but literally all I did was wait over an hour and a half for take out food. Just ridiculous.

I stopped by CPK while strolling the mall with my little one. I checked in for a table and they informed me that they'd send a text once my table was ready. Wait time was approximately 20mins (not too bad for a Saturday) so I shopped the mall until they texted me 15 mins later letting me know it was time to be seated. Once in, I ordered the Kids pizza (trust me it's filling enough for an adult). I ordered a pepperoni, sausage, with extra cheese pizza. The wait time for the pizza was sort of long in my opinion but I'm willing to wait for hot fresh food. To my dismay they brought out a mushroom pizza??? The manager delivered if the table and he offered to allow me to snack on that pizza while he made my correct pizza unfortunately I do not like mushrooms so I had to sit there and admire other people's food. I waited another 10 or so minutes for my fresh pizza to come out and it was really delicious and hot.For dessert I ordered the salted caramel pudding it was super tasty and bigger in person than the picture they show in the menu. Overall the experience was OK and the food was good. I just expected my pizza to come out correctly the first time. P.S. Every time I come, the GM (I'm assuming the guy in the aloha print shirt is the manager) is so helpful and always staying busy helping his team. From delivering dishes to sweeping up a mess, he does it all.
So far so good. Good service, good food, good environment. I will be coming back for more food! I love the chicken piccata!! Staff is friendly.

We came in on a Sunday afternoon right before lunch. We did not have to wait too long, and received a text when our table was ready. Our server Skyler was very friendly. It took over 30 minutes for our entrees to come out, with our kids entree coming out about 15 minutes before ours. When are entrees did come out, my husband's pasta was lukewarm and flavorful, but I'm sure it would have tasted much better if it was warmer.

Omg the restaurant is not full lots of tables inside and out! U would think that .there services would be great! No wonder Cheesecake Factory is crowded. CPK customer Service is going down hill I wouldn't make a comment like this ! This is my favorite place !
Placing a take out order can't be simpler. I called in at 11:02 while I was still up in Makakilo and it was ready when I arrived 15 minutes later. Quick and helpful service.

Waited 30 minutes for bread. Didn't receive our food until 45+ minutes after being seated. Multiple tables that were seated after us received they're food while we were still waiting.  45+ minutes for a salad and tortilla spring rolls!  Can't get that hour of my life back.  Definitely won't be coming back anytime soon.

I've always been a fan of CPK and was so happy when they came to Kapolei. Fortunately, I never had to wait longer than 15 min for a table and if it's busy then we just make our way to the bar, which normally always has seats open. My favorites here are the Avocado Club Egg Rolls, Spinach Artichoke Dip, BBQ Chicken Salad or BBQ Chicken Pizza. And for dessert the Buttercake with Ice Cream is a must. They have a full bar, with a variety of beers on draft, wine and lots of really good mixed cocktails. All of the drinks I've tried here have always tasted great but I always come back to the Blueberry Smash, which is strong but delicious! Whether it's coming here for a full lunch/dinner or just for some apps/dessert and drinks at the bar, we love this place and have always had the most amazing servers/bartenders.

This review is for take out. Their take out system is great. Phone is answered promptly, order taken and received accurately. There are designated  parking stalls for take out orders, which is really nice especially since this parking is often full, and a convenient separate entrance for take out orders. THE 3 STARS are given for portion sizes of their take out orders. I've placed a few take out orders, and each time the portion was noticeably less than their dine-in portions.  So be aware.  Packaging is always nice (compartment plates, sufficient utensils, condiments, dressing kept separate from salad, etc). Taste is on point too. Just wish they gave the same generous amount as they do when eating in.

No wait to be seated despite a weekend evening.  Unfortunately they offered no local, military discounts nor any happy hour discounts on drinks and/or apps.  Oh well- pizza was good and csme out quickly.  Lemonade was excellent!  Dirty dishes had to be retuned snd no refills on bread.

California Pizza kitchen is always a go to place when we need to decide a restaurant with the family. We seriously come here too often and we always order the same things lol.  Husband orders the Avacado egg rolls and bbq salad. I get either the lettuce wraps, thai crunch salad, or roasted veggie salad. Super delicious!! We can't forget the bread and spinach artichoke dip, talk about a must at the table. For dessert we would get the Butter cake SOOOO GOOOD!!! Now you see why we always come back here. Sign up for the pizza dough rewards you will get free money to use on your bill or free appetizers!
We love CPKs Sicilian pizza and draft beer.  A variety of salads to choose from. And a mojito.

**NOTE MY RATING IS FOR THE SERVER I HAD. NOT CPK ITSELF**    I've been here many many times and didn't even bother to write reviews because how bad the service was. I recently went to have a lunch with my coworkers and was very scared because of my previous visits but our server lilo was extremely kind and great. The most mind blowing thing is that she seemed to be the only server on the floor and was still giving us better service than I had in the past when there were a bunch of servers. Mind you there was about 4-5 other tables.  Overall this was one of the greatest customer services I've encountered on my move down here, her genuine kindness reminds me of back home and I will visit again because of her service.

I was able to lunch at this location to support Nanakuli High & Intermediate School Performing Arts Center & try CPK's new menu items as well. Their new tomato basil bisque was very tasty. I also tried the shortribs with mac & cheese. The shortribs were very tender & yummy. It was a great meal for a good cause.

This is the second and last time we will go to this particular CPK. We went last night Saturday, December 2nd for our daughter-in-laws birthday dinner. Getting seated was problem..although the waiter was nice, service was ok at first and then it slowed to a dribble. One of the waitresses accidentally knocked over my water. Accidents happen..but no one cleaned up the water from the floor..it was everywhere! I had to wipe underneath the slats to.our table because it was dripping on me. We asked if the water could be mopped up..no one was sent over. I had to take my grandson to the restroom and almost slipped! Service at this location is horrible. Not ever going back there.

I'm not a big fan of this location. I've been here about 2-3 times. The most recent time, my boyfriend and I sat at the bar since it was first-come-first serve and this particular night the wait was 1 hour since it was a Saturday night and there was a reserved party for 40 on the patio. We waited about 10-15 mins before getting seats at the bar. The bartender Wika was really nice and informative. I usually order fish tacos but I was in the mood for a pasta. I remember before they had a pasta dish with asparagus. I noticed it wasn't on the menu so when I asked our bartender, he mentioned that they could still make it even though it's not on the menu. However, he wasn't finding it in their computer system and didn't know how to ring it up/in. So when a manager came, she told me that they would have to charge me for all the ingredients which would come out to $21-something. Nevermind! That's quite expensive! I would think as a manager, it shouldn't be an issue to charge me for the most comparable pasta dish on the menu and just tell the kitchen guys what dish to make.  Oh well! I ended up getting my favorite pasta dish there, which I don't usually get because it's probably really unhealthy - the garlic cream fettuccini. I haven't eaten this dish for a long time. I'm not sure if all the locations make it the same way, but I remember it being much better! Like I said, maybe it's just the way this location made it. First of all, it was such a small portion. Usually I could take some to-go. Then I noticed the pasta was a little dry and maybe not boiled long enough because the pasta wasn't very swollen. It was still a bit on the harder side and showed color of the yellow when the pasta is uncooked. And the flavor wasn't on point! My boyfriend got the steak dinner. He said it was just okay. He'd much rather have the steak at Cheesecake Factory.  Also, I asked the other bartender/bar back (?) for a little more complimentary bread, and she responded so quickly to say there was none but that she could bring some out when there is more. I felt like she was just being lazy and didn't want to check or walk to get some. How does CPK not have house bread? I've never been told that before. Later she even acknowledged me when she noticed we were done eating, as if to say she would be bringing our check. You would think, she would remember about the bread and say something about that like, "I have some bread for you or I still don't have any yet but they'll be ready soon. Do you want to wait or do you want your check already." Maybe they need a little more training on the hospitality side and the cooks too...my pasta wasn't really worth it. I think when coming to eat at this mall, Cheesecake Factory will be our first choice even if the wait is long!

Take-Out: Love the take out parking, especially when the mall is packed. Was able to pickup a vegetarian pasta dish for my wife really easy. The take-out window is staffed as soon as you enter. Everything ready as soon as I arrived, no wait. I generally wouldn't eat a meal like this while on vacation in Oahu when there is so much great food in the area, but I guess that if I lived there, I might stop by to add some variety. It was a little further out from Ko Olina that the other Kapolei restaurants.

CPK as most of my friends refer to California Pizza Kitchen is a place we tend to venture when we want a pasta or pizza fix.  There are various kinds of pasta and pizza to choose from. But my favorite is pasta is Chicken piccata and favorite pizza is the roasted spinach and artichoke.  The servers are always friendly and what I love about CPK is the Pizza dough rewards.  There are offers that often compliment the order we put in and often get added savings.  They also help out non-profits with fundraisers which is an added bonus.  Kapolei location has a different vibe and decor than the other location on Oahu.  I love it because it is sleek and modern decor.  There is one thing that CPK shine and that is their signature dessert.  I actually devour it myself it's the BUTTER CAKE with vanilla ice cream.  The cake is comes to you warm with the generous scoop of vanilla ice cream on top of it.  But what makes it so good also is the sugar crystals you experience in every bite full.  I even come back some times just for dessert.  You can't go wrong with CPK because of the various dishes to choose from.  Enjoy and get that Butter Cake!

Another California Pizza Kitchen at a new mall, Oh yes please, I am a fan! I just love this California Pizza Kitchen location! Yes., we need more CPK locations and happy that CPK is now on the west side. I have been here many times and it is so convenient for my family. After the movies & shopping, what a treat to end with dinner. This fairly new CPK  opened on 9.30.2016. I remember when I dined during their grand opening, the wait was over an hour, so I went shopping and I received a text that our table was ready, such great service. During my recent visit while staying out at Koolina, We didn't have to wait for a table, it must be that I am lucky or because of Cheesecake Factory. Doesn't matter, I was happy that we didn't have to wait. Every visit, it gets better every time.  I love this CPK location, with great and modern decor, love the full bar with multiple big screen TVs. The restaurant is spacious and great seating, indoor and outdoor.  What is your favorite at CPK?  Although everything is so good and I want to order everything on the menu, my favorites are the Thai crunch salad, with avocado for 3.00 more is a must and I always get the full size, BBQ chicken pizza, and recently I am in love with the Jambalaya!! For some reason, the Jambalaya is so much tastier at this location. This is enough for my family. Oh & I must have the bread with my Thai crunch salad and jambalaya. YUMs!!  & for dessert, I LOVE the butter cake! This is a must order, the butter cake with ice cream. Think pound cake but this butter cake is way better, served warm and taste out of the oven fresh!  During this recent visit, Kasey was our server and she was awesome! She provided excellent service, from taking our orders, filling our drinks and checked on us often. Since I had leftovers, she even gave me extra, fresh bread to bring to the hotel.  Overall, this is the best CPK, (my opinion) I can't wait for my next visit to the west side and for CPK again!!

I'm basing this review off of the wait, food, and three times I've been here. Mainly this last time.  I came here for my bday last year and everything was great.  Fast forward to now, one year later, HORRIBLE.  We walk in on a Wednesday afternoon. It's not busy at all. No one was in the front so we waited about 10 minutes til someone showed up to help us. She apologized for the wait which was fine. We got seated at a booth.  No one came to help us for a good 15 minutes. When someone came she showed up with just the bread - not fresh by the way. It was COLD and super stale :) we ordered our food - OH but alas, they changed their menu again. They no longer serve the Chinese chicken salad I've been ordering here for years :( What?? Omg. Okay. We just ordered a pizza and my sons Mac & cheese. And just waters.  We also asked for balsamic vinegar, that never came. So we had to ask another server that came out with my sons Mac & cheese for it and she got it for us right away.  I understand as servers we all have bad days and good days but YO this server has NO customer service skills whatsoever. We weren't given utensils for my sons food, so I asked her for a spoon & she said okay. She never came back. She came back again, 10-12 minutes later asking if I wanted to order anything else........I said no? But can I still get a spoon for my sons food? She didn't even say I'm so sorry, nothing, and just said "sure!" Like are you serious right now? she came back with the spoon, placed it in the table and didn't say anything.  At this point. It's been almost an hour and we still haven't gotten our pizza yet! We only ordered ONE pizza. I don't understand why this place has gone completely downhill and I'm sad to rate cpk 1 star because I honestly love cpk - well not so much anymore since they took my fave dish off the menu.  Our server came to drop off the check and didn't bother asking if we wanted dessert, which we did. Every time she came to our table to do something she would leave right away without asking if there was anything else we needed. She came back, another 15 minutes later and I said I wanted to order butter cake. She took the check away and came back with the butter cake when it was ready. I asked for a box for my sons food cuz there was obviously a lot left over, she said okay, and didn't come back, AGAIN, for another 10 minutes, to ask if we still wanted the food boxed??? I just said yes...we asked for s box........she took the plate away to box it. Came back dropped it off and didnt come back with our check. We were 15/20 minutes after finishing our butter cake just sitting there waiting for our check. Idk if she forgot or what but we were literally wasting SO MUCH TIME. She only had two other tables btw it was really not busy at all, again. I told my bf to just go up and pay for it already because we had to go, so he did.  As for water refills we never got one. It was strange when she noticed my bfs water empty at the end of our meal and she took the whole glass and brought back a new one. Usually they just refill waters in front of you, or already have a new one ready to replace it before taking the glass away.  We ordered the bbq chicken pizza btw which is something I order regularly at CPK, it was the most dry pizza I ever had :( it definitely needed more bbq sauce. My son enjoyed his Mac & cheese at least from what I could tell, and butter cake was amazing as always.  I hope to come back maybe to write a better review but not so sure since they keep changing the menu and taking away the good stuff lol.

We ate here the other night to celebrate my baby turning 2. Got here at about 6:45 and were promptly seated. Our waitress was ok. Not bad but also not incredibly friendly but we found out later that she had been up since 5:30am, has 5 kids at home and was visibly pregnant with her 6th. She was actually friendlier towards the end of her meal. But I am a mom of 3 young kids so I never fault another mom for working hard to support her family and being tired. She is trying her best I know.  We put in our order fairly quick due to the kid and it came out quick enough for my liking. She also brought us a lot of bread which was helpful.  I am on a pretty strict diet and I really appreciate how accommodating CPK is to patrons like me. I sometime get big eye rolls from servers and kitchen staff but CPK is really liberal when it comes to substitutions or special dietary restrictions. I didn't need to make substitutions though. They have a shrimp scampi zucchini dish that is phenomenal. So good that I was too excited to even take a pic.  But it's shrimp scampi with half fettuccini noodles and half zucchini noodle. And they make the zucchini noodle broader to blend well with the fettuccini. And it tasted like they made their scampi sans butter which helped my special diet even better. I felt like I could comfortably dine out and be in control of my diet. The amount of pasta in my dish made me feel like I got a taste of it without depriving myself of it or feeling guilty for eating it.   Thank you CPK!

First and foremost, I just gotta say CPK is my absolute favorite place to go but this location was a little disappointing. Don't get me wrong, our server was very friendly and attentive so she isn't the reason why I'm leaving a review. I got their Kung Pao Spaghetti, and it the portion was way different from the other locations. I got a mountain of noodles, and not enough sauce so the noodles were very dry. The server topped it with a little cheese on it and it made it a little better. Lettuce wraps were on point, we got the chicken & it was tasty. My friend attempted to order their Chinese Chicken salad and they no longer serve it. Great. So my friend ended up ordering warm veggies, it was OK. The dressing had a sour taste to it. The grilled shrimp was good though. As for drinks, I got the Beehive Sangria. I usually get it whenever I go but this time it was waaay too sweet. My friend got their wine flights, all was pretty good except for the red sangria. It tasted super watered down. Probably won't be returning anytime soon but maybe one day we'll give it another try.

Food is good. Bartenders are great. Waitresses could use some tips on manners and maybe learn to smile once in a while. I've worked in the restaurant industry and you could be the lousiest waiter or waitress but if you have a good attitude it can get you a long way.

Ugh, this was the last straw cpk! I'm done with you!  One pizza was raw the other was burnt and covered in ash.  WE NEVER GOT PLATES.  We had like 3 waiters and when I asked one of them if I can change my kids drink he stands there looking at me says "well what do you want" Seriously IT'S not hard TO BE A NICE PERSON.  We waited half an hour for an empty patio that continued to be empty as we ate there. TELL ME WHY THAT IS... I'm just done with CPK. NEVER AGAIN.  (My family and I used to go to cpk all the time, but this is enough for me)  CPK you guys need to start hiring nice friendly people cause these mean waiters are getting really annoying.

This was a long awaited blast from the past! I haven't been to California pizza kitchen since the 90s before I moved to California, now that I'm back home it's great that they have more of them closer to my house on the west side. I went to the newest one at the new mall in Kapolei Ka Makana Ali'i. It was great! I wanted a pizza with a white sauce and the only one they had was a shrimp pizza but I am allergic to shrimp, so they made it with chicken instead and tasted great! Service was great, the atmosphere looked clean and modern. They have a legit bar too! I can't wait to go again to try another pizza or even their great pastas.

We went to lunch there today, I ordered shrimp with fettuccini , it came to the table cold, the noodles were hard the sauce was not creamy, and it had no flavor. My girlfriend ordered roasted chicken and vegetables, the chicken was dry and hard . My kids ordered other stuff and our bill came up to $135. WTF this was the first time we ate there and definitely my last!

Service was extremely slow. Waiting for a table during lunch hours is totally understandable but took way too long to get burnt bread and didn't even get napkins and utensils until the food arrived. Took 40 minutes to get food and even after manager came to apologize waited another 20 min to get the dessert for   disappointed

This is our 2nd time coming to CPK.  1st time we ordered spinach dip and chips, avocado egg rolls and shrimp scampi the healthy version and it was all junk.  Today is our 2nd time coming here we got a cold pepperoni, mushroom, sausage pizza, salmon with burnt vegetables and a salad.  The food is not tasty at all and burnt food is a joke.  I'll stick to Chili's or Outback Steakhouse.  Not returning even if I was paid to eat there.

First time here and they are very slow. It took us 45 minutes for a table and we still had to sit at the bar, which the dining area had a lot of seats open, even the outside. After coming back 45 minutes later The hostess said we would needed to wait another 20 minutes for a table, that would have been one hour, WTH...  we decided to sit at the bar.  I know it's new but this place is the best design place and very clean!   Bartender Mark was great!!  And made the wait worth it.  I would give this place more stars but the wait time needs to improve.

Just had diner here and because it was Jan 1st staff was limited.  Ordered the shrimp scampi pasta. Not impressed.  Should have stuck with salads and soups. Then ordered the key lime pie and it took a while for the server to bring out. Dont know how long it sat out but was melting and the server still put it in front of me. I try never to send food back but i should have with this pie. Now having stomach issues on my vacation.

SUBPAR FOR THE CPK FRANCHISE Typically when you visit a CPK restaurant, food and service is pretty consistent across the board. I'd say that the one thing that I am always impressed with when things do go wrong, is the service and attention from the restaurant manager. They'll typically come to your table and if anything was lacking, they shower you with apologies and gladly offer to rapid-fire up a new dish. At my most recent visit to this location, both the food and service was substandard. Although the restaurant was pretty empty, our server was very slow to tend to us. I ordered a pinot Grigio, and she brought me a glass of red wine. When I told her that this was not a pinot Grigio, she insisted it was and said that their wines are different. Oohhkayy, I thought. "Well can you just bring me your version of a white?" It was a good thing I had my wine because we then waited 45 minutes for a salad, a pizza and Mac and cheese (for my kids). Really? It's not a very complex order. When I expressed concern, the manager seemed a little dismissive. But I was willing to overlook because I was hungry and just wanted to eat. The salad was unfortunately drenched with dressing. I am a religious eater of the Thai Crunch salad and know how it should taste, this was not it. When they offered to replace it I declined in fear I'd be there another 45 minutes. She brought me my bill and while I didn't expect a huge discount, I expected a little bit off for the inconvenience and bad experience. But nothing. I flagged down my waitress to ask her about it and she said she would talk to her manager. For 15 minutes I sat there and watched her go about her business, no urgency. I finally had to stand up and went to a man who looked like he was someone important and he quickly took care of me. Just a bad experience. I will not be back here!

Never again CPK!! This location for me is the worst. we waited outside for half an hour. After that we waited an hour to get our food. The worst thing is when we got our food its very disappointing. my nephews fussili pasta was so dry and its tasteless. damn! and i ordered shrimp zucchini scampi and oh boy! worst pasta ever. its sour,zucchini is really soggy, doesnt taste fresh. We actually ask the server and she explain it nicely and offer if i want another dish. Even if i want to im not willing to wait for an hour to get another pasta!.. oh and btw they never charge me for the scampi! i guess thats the right thing to do!!!

Attached photo is what I was given for takeout pasta ($18) barely even a layer of food filling the already small container. Literally after two bites it was more than halfway gone. Super disappointing especially for price.

This would've been a great day to dine in at one of our favorite restaurants, but my son and I decided to go for takeout. I was very impressed with the whole transaction. We actually got there around half an hour after the place opened. We were greeted at the front, and the hostess directed us to the other end of the restaurant where I had no idea that there was a separate entrance to the takeout counter! Duly noted.. we were both kinda hungry so we ordered enough, probably for 5 people! But we were planning on sharing, so we got: -California Cobb Salad w/ side of beets -"the works" pizza(its every single topping you can imagine) -shrimp scampi zucchini -wild mushroom strozzapreti with chicken(the chicken was an extra, you actually don't need to order any meat with this dish!) Did I mention we were feeling hungry? For dessert, we ordered the Butter Cake, sadly without the vanilla ice cream since we were taking it home, and the Salted Caramel Pudding.  .Gosh...it was freakin awesome! I can agree that their takeout portions are actually a good amount, even when you're sharing and you don't mean to. We got full fast, but that didn't stop us from trying some dessert! But pasta and pizza are always good foods to have for leftovers! Danielle, who helped take out order was very polite, and did an amazing job! She reassured me that their gift card machine was taking a little bit longer to process, but told me that our food would be ready in 10-15 minutes. Instead of just waiting around for it, she asked if I wanted her to call me when it was ready, then that way we could look around the mall. How great is that?! Kudos to you Danielle!

Great service here. We came here on a Wednesday and it wasn't busy at all. I always order the Chicken Piccata as a main course and that's always good. The Avocado Egg Rolls and the Lettuce Wraps are always good too for appetizers. Very affordable prices. Great staff and great service. I'll come back here again.

Food was outstanding but the music was extremely loud.  We couldn't even talk without raising our voices and this was in the middle of the day.  Hard to enjoy your meal if you feel like you don't want to even talk.  Very annoying!!!

My hubby went to see how long the wait was during lunch time since Cheesecake Factory was approx 1.5hrs wait. The hostess said about 15 mins for our party of 12. So of course we ditched CF's wait. It was 1:30pm. Well guess what? We ended up being seated at 2pm cause the hostess said they were waiting for the party of 9 to leave so she couldn't really say how much longer we had to wait after 20 mins passed. Anyway, our waitress (Jaymie) took our drink orders once we were seated. Got our drinks at 2:10pm. Then she disappeared & came to take our orders for entrees at 2:30pm WTH?!! By the time we got all our food it was almost 3pm!! By the time we were done we left at 3:30pm. 2 hours in a restaurant is RIDICULOUS! Never again CPK. The only reason why I gave 1 star is because Jaymie was very polite.

We had an awesome experience here! Our hostess was pleasant and our waitress Melika was awesome! She definitely catered to our four girls! All the girls ordered the cheese pizza. 3 out of the four girls gave it a thumbs up!  The best part though, was our waitress brought out some pizza dough for the girls to play with while we waited on the food! This definitely occupied them the whole time! Even after eating, they went back to playing with their play-"dough!" Even if it is a little dusty, we had happy kids! Happy kids=Happy parents! My go to meal is the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad which is what I always come to CPK for!  My husband enjoyed the Ribeye with a side of Fettuccini Alfredo. We also tried out the Crispy Ahi Rolls which were also awesome! We definitely will be coming back to this location again and will be recommending it to all our family and friends over all the other restaurants at Ka Makana Alii! Best thing is it's kid friendly!
